0,"

It’s a race against time to fight climate change. You and your friends must work together to reduce global emissions before it’s too late! As you strategically deploy climate solutions, you'll need to think critically and discuss with your teammates to avoid climate catastrophe. But watch out for dangerous feedback loops and global climate events! Will your team save our planet, or will you break the thermometer as global temperatures soar?

Solutions is an intense, non-traditional game based on discussion (like Cards Against Humanity but for climate change!) Designed for and tested with gamers, non-gamers, educators, climate experts, and even those who have no particular interest in climate.

Every year, global temperatures increase, keeping you under constant pressure. In order to keep the Earth cool, players will propose climate solutions. However, some solutions can have more impact than others!
column2: >Deploy an array of unique and surprising climate solutions, from solar panels to bamboo to clean cookstoves and more.
column4: >Next, it's time to debate! Together, your team will need to decide which of the climate solutions will have the most impact on reducing global warming by 2050.
column5: >
column6: >Once you've come to a decision, it's time to reveal your fate. Flip over the cards to find out how you did!
column8: >Reduce global temperature by the number of solutions successfully proposed. Any mistakes will cost you!
column9: >
column10: >Roll the dice to see if you trigger any Feedback Loops. Just like in real life, these get more likely the warmer the world gets! Event cards can help or hinder your mission - prepare to make some tough decisions and complete team challenges! As you play, you'll also collect Reward cards to help you succeed.
column11:
> 

Watch a gameplay preview by the Dice Tower:

column1: <div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/nrvYgfo7RT8?autohide=1&amp

The Anatomy of a Solution card

To save paper, and to give you the best experience while playing (no more fighting over the rulebook!), the instructions for Solutions are fully digital. Simply scan the QR code in the box to access them.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/I8zMKIEoHkQ?autohide=1&amp
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/oVRrzzFAHoE?autohide=1&amp
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/34YeL-5SOjw?autohide=1&amp

Some notes on the above video ^^

There will be no plastic whatsoever inside the box of the final game! They will be using a different manufacturer. For example, the cards will be held together with a paper strip.

The final board will be made with traditional straight-cut folds that will lie flat

The Take Action button will lead to a website by their partners at Project Regeneration, who are developing a comprehensive climate action platform

We have spent thousands of hours during the game’s development to build the game’s foundation on cutting-edge climate research. For example, the core solutions in the game are inspired by the ground-breaking work of Paul Hawken, the co-founder of Project Drawdown and founder of Project Regeneration. Other research, such as the feedback loop cards and the starting points for global temperature, is based on NASA, the IPCC, UNFCCC, NOAA, Yale, Stanford, the World Resources Institute, the World Economic Forum, the AMPERE Database, and more.
column3:
showinfo=0"">

Because Solutions is a discussion-based game, scales in difficulty and complexity with the age group. The content of the conversations changes drastically, but the learning and fun remains the same. Solutions has been tested with hundreds of students at the elementary school (grade 6), middle school, high school, undergraduate, and graduate levels.
column4:
>An 8th grade class in Sweden celebrate after revealing their cards.

Each solution card played requires students to actively engage with the solution, thinking critically and discussing it with their peers. Students will be having so much fun, they won’t realize they’re learning! For students, it will be the highlight of their day – and the lessons will stick, too.
column5: controls=1&amp
column6:
showinfo=0"">

Although the core game takes 60-90 minutes to play, flip the board over for the 30-45 minute version. Perfect for teachers with tight schedules and short classes.

Our lesson plan, developed by Climate Science, will guide you through using the game in your classroom, or provide inspiration for crafting the experience as you see fit. 

Solutions doesn't have to be over when the game ends! Turn your favorite climate solutions from the game into real-world action, with the help of our online templates and global community.  

For example, after playing Solutions, one group of students decided to take action and fight food waste in their school's cafeteria. By measuring their school's food waste and launching an awareness campaign among fellow students, they managed to reduce their daily food waste by over 3kg/day! 

Here's their teacher, Cassie Klein, talking about the project:
column8:
showinfo=0"">

Paul Hawken and our friends at Project Regeneration are developing an incredible platform for fostering climate action that will launch with their Regeneration book on September 14th. Solutions will connect directly to this platform. By scanning the back of any solution card, you will be taken to a network full of resources and inspiration for how you can take action for that particular solution.

Paul Hawken’s groundbreaking work with the Drawdown book (a New York Times Bestseller) was a huge inspiration to us. Without his tremendous work and the work of the amazing team he built, this game would not exist.

On September 14th, 2021, Paul will launch a new book called Regeneration: Ending the Climate Crisis in Project Regeneration.

Regeneration offers a visionary new approach to climate change, one that weaves justice, climate, biodiversity, equity, and human dignity into a seamless tapestry of action, policy, and transformation that can end the climate crisis in one generation.

We’re proud to do a small part to help support the launch of Regeneration. Paul is generously providing us with 30 signed copies of the book to distribute. We have packaged these books in our “Regeneration Bundle” reward.

100% of the revenue collected from the books will go to Regeneration. The bundle costs more than the base price of the items due to the logistics of shipping the signed copies back and forth. We think you’ll agree it’s worth it :)

The signed copy of the Regeneration book will ship before the games, in September or October.

Don't see a pledge that fully speaks to you? Don't worry! We use Pledge Manager with this campaign. This means that you can fully customize your order after the Indiegogo campaign is over!

Once you have funded our campaign, you will receive an email inviting you to the Pledge Manager, which will explain the next steps. You will then be able to fully customize the number of games, add-ons, and shipping locations included in your reward. 

Shipping &
column9:
tax is charged in the Pledge Manager! See the ‘Shipping’ section for more info.

Shipping will be charged in the Pledge Manager based on what you buy and where you live. Below is a chart of estimated shipping costs in various regions for the different pledges.

*For countries with a star, there may be additional duties and/or fees charged by your country’s governmental agencies and/or shipping partners.

Currently, freight and shipping costs are unpredictable, in part due to COVID-19, making it impossible to calculate the exact accurate shipping cost. We’ve done our best to be as accurate as possible in these estimations, but there might be differences in the final shipping costs in the Pledge Manager. As we receive more information we will do our best to lower these costs if these conditions change.

Adding additional copies or add-ons will raise the weight of your pledge and may also raise the final shipping price.

Taxes are not included in the pledge prices unless otherwise stated in the reward. Taxes/VAT will be charged based on your country’s rules when you check out in the Pledge Manager.

Sustainable materials

We will be working with LongPack Games, a veteran board game manufacturer. Their factory is FSC certified, and we have verified the certificate ourselves. The box and all the game components will be either recycled or made of FSC certified wood and paper from sustainably managed forests.

Sustainable design choices

While the box might look small, it can fit the same components as other games with boxes twice the size (by volume)! In fact, we sized the game to fit precisely in a small USPS flat rate box for maximum shipping efficiency. This makes a tremendous difference in the shipping impact and cost, while making the game ultra-portable and saving your shelf space.

In order to save trees and unnecessary packaging, the rulebook for Solutions is fully digital. Simply scan the QR code in the box to access it! This has many added benefits, including that everyone can read the rules at the same time and the rules can be updated with gameplay improvements.

To further minimize waste, we ask you to provide common items: a stopwatch (your smartphone is fine) and a pencil and paper to draw on. 

All of our game components are made of trees rather than plastic: cardstock, cardboard, and a few wood cubes. 

We avoid plastic packaging inside the game. The only plastic is the shrink-wrap to keep your game safe during transportation.

Long-lasting design

Solutions will partner with a manufacturer with an excellent reputation for quality. All of our components are designed to be played for decades to come. The cards are made with ultra-premium 350gsm white-core material, which is generally as thick as playing cards come. They will withstand bending and years of rough play.

The box is made of 1.5mm thick, laminated greyboard, which is the standard for much larger boxes. As a result, not only is the box incredibly sturdy, but the corners are much less likely to tear. The game board is made of 2mm thick, laminated greyboard, the industry standard. We use high-quality black core cards that will better resist bending and rough play.

Neutralizing our carbon impact

Despite our best efforts to design this game in as sustainable a way as possible, no mass-produced product can yet claim to have no impact without a little bit of help. That’s why we've partnered with Cooler to neutralize our remaining impact. 

Cooler calculates the carbon footprint of every board game we print, including manufacturing, packaging, transportation, and even the air conditioning and lighting of the retail store. They then charge us based on the footprint, and use the money to buy emission permits away from tightly-regulated carbon markets in the U.S. There are only a certain number of permits available, and once Cooler buys up those permits, polluters have to find more sustainable ways to operate, stopping pollution at its source. This is a much more rigorous approach than carbon offsets, since offsets allow polluters to continue business as usual.

Supporting Project Regeneration

We donate 10% of our profits to Project Regeneration, to help fund their work to foster learning, connection, and action to inspire the regeneration of the world.

Solutions is ready for production. We own the rights for all artwork. Solutions is based on cutting-edge climate research, all of which will be cited in the rulebook.

We rigorously evaluated over 20 manufacturers, emailing dozens of their customers to ensure that they were satisfied. After eliminating manufacturers that looked great on the surface, we have chosen a highly credible manufacturer in China with 10+ years in the business to bring the game to life.

This is our first Indiegogo campaign. However, we have mitigated this risk by seeking the advice of as many crowdfunding veterans as possible.

Of course, there are always unforeseen circumstances that can affect the production and shipment of a game. Pandemics (too soon?), material shortages, delays by third parties, strikes and natural disasters are always a remote possibility. The current COVID-19 pandemic is still affecting freight times and prices, which we are doing our best to mitigate by securing multiple quotes from highly credible partners.

0,"

After two years of intensive design and development and a successful crowdfunding campaign, we’re excited to offer Ascendant™, a new superpowered role-playing game of infinite possibilities, on IndieGoGo InDemand.

 

Learning the Game  

The easiest way to learn about Ascendant is to get walked through a character stat block. Below is the stat block for Aurora. Previously a D-grade celebrity from a TV  reality show, her ambition to be a dazzling star in the spotlight was granted…sort of… when she manifested the ability to control and generate light. Now she is one of the most famous ascendants in the world, with brand sponsorships from beauty and fashion companies, her own press team, and a prestigious membership in the Star-Spangled Squadron, America’s premier team of crimefighting ascendants. 

Up at the top you can see Aurora's Character Points, Power Limit, and Challenge Rating. Character Points (CP) are used to construct characters. An average human has 200 CP. A trained soldier has 240 CP. An exceptionally impressive, formidable and renowned human in the real world has 400 CP.  Every 80 CP represents an approximate doubling of the character’s competency across all capabilities. With 940 Character Points, Aurora is one of the 20 most powerful superhumans in the world. Power Limit constrains how  characters can allocate their CP and is analogous to class level in a D20 RPG. Challenge Rating shows how powerful a character is relative to a trained soldier. Aurora can defeat 500 US infantry simultaneously - she's a tough woman.  

Over on the right, below her image, you'll see Aurora's Primary Attributes: Might (MIG), Agility (AGI), Valor (VAL), Resolve (RES), Insight (INS), and Charisma (CHA). Each of these Primary Attributes are rated in Supermetric Points (SP). SP are logarithmic
column2:
each additional one SP has a value equal to double the amount of the previous SP.  Ordinary people have 3 SPs in each of their Primary Attributes, and the most impressive humans typically have no more than 5 SP in any Primary Attribute. With 7 SPs of Agility, Aurora is four times more agile than an Olympic athlete. With 12 SPs of Charisma, Aurora is 500 times more magnetic and alluring than any ordinary person.

To the left of the Primary Attributes are Aurora's Secondary Attributes, which rate factors like Initiative, Passive Spotting Range, Height, Income, and more. With a Flight Speed of 14 SPs, Aurora can fly at Mach 24!

Below the Variable Attributes we list Aurora's Powers. Her most important Power is Agile Light Control. Light Control is a pre-defined Power Set that allows her to emulate many other powers.  (The rules let you build your own power sets if you want, yes!)   

The word Agile in front of Light Control is a modifier that changes how the power works. In this case, it means that Aurora uses her Light Control in conjunction with her Agility rather than her Insight. Between Powers, Power Sets, and Modifiers, there are infinite possibilities available to make virtually any character you can imagine.

Below Powers we've listed Aurora's Skills. Skills can be substituted for Primary Attributes for specific purposes. For instance, Aurora has 14 SPs of Aerial Combat. If she's the target of a ranged attack while she's flying, she can substitute her Aerial Combat score for her Agility score, making her much harder to hit. 

Below the Primary Attributes, you can see Aurora's Perks and Drawbacks. Perks function similarly to Feats in a D20 RPG. Some of the most important Perks are the Combat Maneuvers, which allow you to trade damage for accuracy and vice versa. Aurora's got two Combat Maneuvers as well as a host of other Perks related to her status as a celebrity member of the elite Star-Spangled Squadron.

Aurora has a number of minor Drawbacks such as her Code of Honor (""always be fabulous"") as well as one very serious Drawback called a Vulnerable State. A Vulnerable State models all the situations that can result in heroes becoming weaker or losing their powers. Exposed to meteorites from your homeworld? Caught out of your powered armor? Forgot to recharge your power ring? Not angry enough to turn green? All modeled with Vulnerable State. Aurora's Vulnerable State is that all of her powers are based on her egoistic desire to be a star
column3:
if she's ever reduced to 0 Determination, she gets depressed, loses her superpowers, and acquires a host of flaws. 

Speaking of Determination, that's one of the game's Variable Attributes. The other one is Health, and both are listed near the top of the sheet. These are like Hit Points in a D20 Game. Unlike the other Attributes, Variable Attributes aren't rated in SP, just in raw numbers, so that when you deal and take damage it's all scaled correctly.

As for how the game itself works, it's so easy even a 200-CP ordinary human can play it! Anytime you want to make an Action, you choose your Action Value (AV) and then subtract the Difficulty Value (DV) to yield a Resolution Value (RV). You then roll 1d100 on the Challenge Action Resolution Table, or CHART, to see your Color Result. The CHART is carefully structured so that the expected values for any AV versus any RV are exactly what they ought to be, given the logarithmic nature of the Attributes.

Let's simulate Aurora shooting a Thermal Blast at the blindsighted assassin Helen Killer. Down at the bottom of her sheet, we've listed Aurora's Attacks. Each Attack has an Action Value and a Base Damage. If Aurora fires a Thermal Blast at Helen Killer, her AV for the Attack is 14 SPs and her Base Damage is 256. Her DV for the Attack is Helen's Combat Sense, which happens to be 13 SPs. That gives Aurora an RV of 14 - 13 = +1 on the CHART. Let's say her player rolls a 32. Scanning across the ""1"" row of the RV (Attack) column, we see that 32 falls into the Yellow range, so Aurora has scored a Yellow result on her Attack. 

When you score a Green result when making an Attack, you deal Base Damage, while Yellow, Orange, and Red results increase damage by a factor of 2, 4, or 8. Since Aurora scored a Yellow result she deals 512 points of Damage to Helen Killer. Helen now gets to  apply Protection like Forcefield or Invulnerability, then Roll With the Attack to reduce Damage in exchange for taking on various Conditions like ""Dazed"" or ""Staggered"".

What if Superhumans Had Just Emerged?

Enough about rules. Let's talk about setting! Ascendant includes an optional campaign setting inspired by comics like Watchmen, The Boys, Squadron Supreme, The  Authority, and Invincible.

The world of Ascendant  doesn't begin to diverge from that of our real world until 2012, and the first superheroes don't go public until the Battle of Atlanta in 2018, meaning your player characters will be among the first superhumans to ever don tights and fight crime.  The setting is presented as an epistolary novel made up of leaked documents, transcripts, newspaper clippings, and emails that you can print out and give to your players - like this one.

The Art of Ascendant  

Comics are a visual medium and no comic book game should be without amazing illustrations. We’ve secured a team of top comic book artists to bring the world of Ascendant to life. Here's some samples of the artwork we've already commissioned. 

 

Pledge Levels  

Are you ready to pledge? Choose your power level! When you back Ascendant you can choose to receive the 350-page rulebook in PDF, softcover, or hardcover format.   

PLEASE NOTE  your pledge does NOT include the cost of shipping. We will collect the cost of shipping at the time of reward fulfillment by using a Pledge Manager.   Digital rewards will be delivered via DriveThruRPG. Physical rewards will be delivered via our U.S.-based fulfillment house. International backers, please be aware that international shipping from the U.S. is expensive and you will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and tariffs. If you want to minimize your shipping cost, we offer the Vigilante and Crimefighter pledge levels (PDF or POD coupon).

Stretch Goals

We've already met our stretch goals through $40,000 from our prior crowdfunding campaign. In the event that we raise more funds, we'll honor the additional stretch goals from our campaign. Note that Paragon ($90) backers will get ALL stretch goal products included with their pledge in print, while Vigilante + Sidekick ($30) and above get stretch goal products in PDF. All backers can purchase stretch goal products as add-ons while supplies last.   

Risks and challenges

After two years of research and writing, Ascendant's rules are already complete, with more than 230,000 words of amazing content ready to be laid out and illustrated. We've already got the funds to make the product, too. Most of the rewards are digital and will be delivered via DriveThruRPG. For printed material, we use McNaughton &
column4:
Gunn, a US-based publishing house, so the current disruptions to the global supply chain shouldn't have any effect on us. We're grateful for your interest, and hope to see you as a backer!

An exceptionally impressive, formidable and renowned human in the real world has 400 CP.  Every 80 CP represents an approximate doubling of the character’s competency across all capabilities. With 940 Character Points, Aurora is one of the 20 most powerful superhumans in the world. Power Limit constrains how  characters can allocate their CP and is analogous to class level in a D20 RPG. Challenge Rating shows how powerful a character is relative to a trained soldier. Aurora can defeat 500 US infantry simultaneously - she's a tough woman.  Over on the right, below her image, you'll see Aurora's Primary Attributes: Might (MIG), Agility (AGI), Valor (VAL), Resolve (RES), Insight (INS), and Charisma (CHA). Each of these Primary Attributes are rated in Supermetric Points (SP). SP are logarithmic
column5: each additional one SP has a value equal to double the amount of the previous SP.  Ordinary people have 3 SPs in each of their Primary Attributes, and the most impressive humans typically have no more than 5 SP in any Primary Attribute. With 7 SPs of Agility, Aurora is four times more agile than an Olympic athlete. With 12 SPs of Charisma, Aurora is 500 times more magnetic and alluring than any ordinary person.To the left of the Primary Attributes are Aurora's Secondary Attributes, which rate factors like Initiative, Passive Spotting Range, Height, Income, and more. With a Flight Speed of 14 SPs, Aurora can fly at Mach 24!Below the Variable Attributes we list Aurora's Powers. Her most important Power is Agile Light Control. Light Control is a pre-defined Power Set that allows her to emulate many other powers.  (The rules let you build your own power sets if you want, yes!)   The word Agile in front of Light Control is a modifier that changes how the power works. In this case, it means that Aurora uses her Light Control in conjunction with her Agility rather than her Insight. Between Powers, Power Sets, and Modifiers, there are infinite possibilities available to make virtually any character you can imagine.Below Powers we've listed Aurora's Skills. Skills can be substituted for Primary Attributes for specific purposes. For instance, Aurora has 14 SPs of Aerial Combat. If she's the target of a ranged attack while she's flying, she can substitute her Aerial Combat score for her Agility score, making her much harder to hit. Below the Primary Attributes, you can see Aurora's Perks and Drawbacks. Perks function similarly to Feats in a D20 RPG. Some of the most important Perks are the Combat Maneuvers, which allow you to trade damage for accuracy and vice versa. Aurora's got two Combat Maneuvers as well as a host of other Perks related to her status as a celebrity member of the elite Star-Spangled Squadron.Aurora has a number of minor Drawbacks such as her Code of Honor (""always be fabulous"") as well as one very serious Drawback called a Vulnerable State. A Vulnerable State models all the situations that can result in heroes becoming weaker or losing their powers. Exposed to meteorites from your homeworld? Caught out of your powered armor? Forgot to recharge your power ring? Not angry enough to turn green? All modeled with Vulnerable State. Aurora's Vulnerable State is that all of her powers are based on her egoistic desire to be a star
column6: if she's ever reduced to 0 Determination, she gets depressed, loses her superpowers, and acquires a host of flaws. Speaking of Determination, that's one of the game's Variable Attributes. The other one is Health, and both are listed near the top of the sheet. These are like Hit Points in a D20 Game. Unlike the other Attributes, Variable Attributes aren't rated in SP, just in raw numbers, so that when you deal and take damage it's all scaled correctly.As for how the game itself works, it's so easy even a 200-CP ordinary human can play it! Anytime you want to make an Action, you choose your Action Value (AV) and then subtract the Difficulty Value (DV) to yield a Resolution Value (RV). You then roll 1d100 on the Challenge Action Resolution Table, or CHART, to see your Color Result. The CHART is carefully structured so that the expected values for any AV versus any RV are exactly what they ought to be, given the logarithmic nature of the Attributes.Let's simulate Aurora shooting a Thermal Blast at the blindsighted assassin Helen Killer. Down at the bottom of her sheet, we've listed Aurora's Attacks. Each Attack has an Action Value and a Base Damage. If Aurora fires a Thermal Blast at Helen Killer, her AV for the Attack is 14 SPs and her Base Damage is 256. Her DV for the Attack is Helen's Combat Sense, which happens to be 13 SPs. That gives Aurora an RV of 14 - 13 = +1 on the CHART. Let's say her player rolls a 32. Scanning across the ""1"" row of the RV (Attack) column, we see that 32 falls into the Yellow range, so Aurora has scored a Yellow result on her Attack. When you score a Green result when making an Attack, you deal Base Damage, while Yellow, Orange, and Red results increase damage by a factor of 2, 4, or 8. Since Aurora scored a Yellow result she deals 512 points of Damage to Helen Killer. Helen now gets to  apply Protection like Forcefield or Invulnerability, then Roll With the Attack to reduce Damage in exchange for taking on various Conditions like ""Dazed"" or ""Staggered"".What if Superhumans Had Just Emerged?Enough about rules. Let's talk about setting! Ascendant includes an optional campaign setting inspired by comics like Watchmen, The Boys, Squadron Supreme, The  Authority, and Invincible.The world of Ascendant  doesn't begin to diverge from that of our real world until 2012, and the first superheroes don't go public until the Battle of Atlanta in 2018, meaning your player characters will be among the first superhumans to ever don tights and fight crime.  The setting is presented as an epistolary novel made up of leaked documents, transcripts, newspaper clippings, and emails that you can print out and give to your players - like this one.The Art of Ascendant  Comics are a visual medium and no comic book game should be without amazing illustrations. We’ve secured a team of top comic book artists to bring the world of Ascendant to life. Here's some samples of the artwork we've already commissioned.  Pledge Levels  Are you ready to pledge? Choose your power level! When you back Ascendant you can choose to receive the 350-page rulebook in PDF, softcover, or hardcover format.   PLEASE NOTE  your pledge does NOT include the cost of shipping. We will collect the cost of shipping at the time of reward fulfillment by using a Pledge Manager.   Digital rewards will be delivered via DriveThruRPG. Physical rewards will be delivered via our U.S.-based fulfillment house. International backers, please be aware that international shipping from the U.S. is expensive and you will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and tariffs. If you want to minimize your shipping cost, we offer the Vigilante and Crimefighter pledge levels (PDF or POD coupon).Stretch GoalsWe've already met our stretch goals through $40,000 from our prior crowdfunding campaign. In the event that we raise more funds, we'll honor the additional stretch goals from our campaign. Note that Paragon ($90) backers will get ALL stretch goal products included with their pledge in print, while Vigilante + Sidekick ($30) and above get stretch goal products in PDF. All backers can purchase stretch goal products as add-ons while supplies last.   Risks and challengesAfter two years of research and writing, Ascendant's rules are already complete, with more than 230,000 words of amazing content ready to be laid out and illustrated. We've already got the funds to make the product, too. Most of the rewards are digital and will be delivered via DriveThruRPG. For printed material, we use McNaughton & Gunn, a US-based publishing house, so the current disruptions to the global supply chain shouldn't have any effect on us. We're grateful for your interest, and hope to see you as a backer!",9.0,0,"1 Campaign

Who we are

We're just two guys who love being around people and having a good time.  Some of our favorite memories from childhood are of playing cards and board games with friends and family. These games brought everyone closer together, made us think and were always a lot of fun.

We love getting people together and games are fun way to break the ice, so we came up with our own game- Rent 'em Spoons.  Making up a game from scratch isn't as easy as it seems.  We wanted to make a game that was easy to learn, but one that you can play over and over without getting bored.  After a lot of trial and error, we came up with one that has a bit of chance, but you still need the skills to the pay the bills if you want to win.

The game is simple and easy to learn, but you need strategy if you want to stomp with the big dawgs.  Each player gets dealt 4 cards from the deck.  The deck is made of Customer, Soup, Spoon and Action cards. Everyone takes turns drawing and trying to lay down complete sets made of a Customer, Soup and Spoon card.  The first person to get 3 complete sets wins the game.  Of course, we couldn’t make it quite that easy, you have to watch your back.  The Action cards let people jack your cards, skip you, reverse the order of play and few other things to keep you on your toes.  You’ve heard most of the phrases on the Action cards before and the game gets better when you shout them out.

The customers are familiar as well, like The Original Playa from the Himalayas, Stupid Best Friend, The Big-Eared Trash Talker, That Hood Rat from Across the Hall, Your Crazy Mama and others.  Addicting and exciting, Rent ‘Em Spoons is a game that you and your crew will want to play over and over again. You’ll love all the crazy characters and themes in the deck.
<h3><strong>What We Need &amp

Right now, we are looking at you, Indiegogo, for help raising $7500.  This start-up money will cover all the basic costs of making the first run of Rent ‘em Spoons decks and then marketing and distributing our game.  The Rent ‘em Spoons deck contains 70 cards- 15 Customer cards, 15 Soup cards, 15 Spoon cards and 25 Action cards.
<h3><strong>Risks &amp

Because we have already designed this game and printed out the prototype deck, there is very little risk involved with this project.  Our manufacturer has over 35 years of experience in the gaming printing industry. We are ready to move forward right now, and all that is holding us back is our lack of funding. With your support, we know that we can hit all of our deadlines and send out the games to you quickly, hopefully even ahead of the schedule we have set for ourselves.
Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond ordering a deck, you can help us in a big way by sharing our campaign with all your friends and family.  Go ahead and post the campaign URL on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and any other social media platforms you may use.  If you follow blogs, celebs, or journalists, ask them to visit our page and talk about our campaign.  The more people that know of our game, the smoother our launch will go.  We’re even running a contest where you can win a $500 Visa Gift Card by sharing the game online!
We appreciate all of your support.
Peace!!

Short Summary

Hi, my name is James Kathrein, I am the designer of Gravity Dice which are precision, custom CNC machined Metal Gaming Dice. After thousands of requests to create a set of affordable precision RPG dice, I came up with a solution. Our new Dragon Forged Dice campaign will solve the problem of unbalanced, untrue dice.

Dragon Forged Dice will be made from a high resin acrylic glass called PMMA. Our new proprietary methods will give you dice that are true. They will have more random roles because of the system I am using. I have also designed a LED dice case that will hold your dice set and light them up for hours. The dice vault is made from the same PMMA material and custom tooled with a screw top to put your dice in. The vault has changing color options and is rechargeable.

This campaign is important to me because you have asked for it, and because like you, I need to know that my dice will perform for me.  My vision is to design the highest quality gaming products in the industry that will last you for years.  With your support in the campaign I will be able to afford the tooling costs for the vault, LEDs and the dice. Any additional monies over the cost of the tooling will go to adding new colors and variety packs for you.
<h3>What We Need &amp
Our goal is to raise $20,000
<ul>
• Tooling cost for Vault and dice cost over $72,000
• Production for dice and shipping is another $60,000
• We are currently offering 16 dice colors, Translucent, Solid and Glow-in-the-dark
The Impact

Our campaign will solve many problems with the current dice on the market. Current dice are not true, they are unbalanced and lack randomization. We have also designed a truly unique dice holder that we call the Dragon Forged Vault. It has an LED base that gives you multiple colors and is rechargeable.
<ul>

• Our business purpose is to design the highest quality products we can, to bring these products to market and ensure that these products have the smallest carbon footprint we can make for our environment.

• You can see my commitment to our industry and our world through my previous Gravity Dice project. I consider my self a unique designer, I have lived with Aspergers and have been through all the struggles of trying to fit in but now I realize it is time for me to stand out and give you the greatest products you and we can envision.
• Please join me and lets build better products together, we ask you to back our campaign and be a part of the change.
<h3>Risks &amp

I have 3D renders and 3D prints of all the dice and the vault. I have also designed the circuit board my self and tested its success. We have not made the product yet. My secret design plan is to create our dice so they don't shrink when they leave the mold, so they aren't weighted to one side and so they roll like no other dice on the market. The challenges are to ensure these plans work. We have just finished our first prototypes and are making adjustments to the numbers on the dice.
Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone will be able to support our campaign financially. We would like to ask you to share the campaign and help us get the word out. Indiegogo has a great share tool, please forward it along to your Dungeon Master, friends and fellow players.

The Anatomy of a Perfect Dice

Our Gravity Dice™ have been designed for precision but we have taken that a step further and seek to change the way dice roll to make them more enjoyable, more random and completely unique. Each angle, corner, and chamfer has been analyzed, configured and reconfigured so that our dice change your experience.

Why We Use PMMA

PMMA, also called acrylic glass, has a high surface hardness, meaning it is very scratch resistant. It is also easily machined, easily cleaned, and lightweight. PMMA is also fully recyclable (although we know you’d never throw your awesome dice away!).

With a precision of less than 100 microns and engineered to enhance your random roll mechanics, these PMMA dice are simply amazing.

 Our Polyhedral Dice Set

We are offering a full set of polyhedral dice which includes 7 Dice: D20, D12, D10, D10%, D8, D6, and a D4. Each of our dice will have the numbers formed into the dice and will then be color-filled to help maintain the perfect balance.

Polyhedral sizes are as follows: 
The D20 measures 20 mm from face to face (FF) and 21.98 mm at its peak. The D12 is slightly smaller at 18 mm FF, the D10 and D10% measure 18 mm Point to Point (PP), the D8 is also 18 mm PP, the D6 is 16 mm FF and the D4 is 16 mm PP.

 Our first available colors: Translucent Red, Translucent Smoke, Translucent Blue, Translucent Teal, and Translucent Purple. As we reach our stretch goals we will unlock new colors and options, such as:

LED Dragon Forged Dice Vault:

The Light-Up Dragon Case will be in a solid color with translucent dice to match and will come with white LEDs and replaceable batteries.

Vault Specifications:Inner plastic tube casing: Height: 6.25,"" Diameter: 1.25""

The vault can hold up to 9 dice, depending on the size and shape of the dice. It comfortably fits our set of 7 polyhedral dice or 9 D6s.

We took our famous Aluminum Gravity Dice and made them in PMMA just like the Polyhedral Sets. Each dice has a perfect center of gravity as well as mathematically calculated to create more random rolls. Each dice has the pip numbers at different depths and inked in either silver or gold dots.  

COLOR OPTIONS:

OVERVIEW

Have you ever had a great idea you just really needed to jot down?

Better yet, have you ever struggled to find a graphic designer to bring your idea to life? 

Well, what if the graphic designer you were looking for was you? 

There's a creator in everyone and realizing you have a good eye for design and big ideas is the first step toward bringing your ideas to life.

Discover the designer in you by playing the world's first graphic design education game, DESIGN EYE. 

 

My name is Deon Mixon. I'm a graphic designer, author, poet, and design educator from Detroit, MI. Growing up as the only creative in my family, I wondered what career I'd get into to make a happy, good living. It was in middle school when a counselor told me about graphic design, showing me different examples of what could be created to get someone's idea or message out in the world. I thought what I saw was the dopest thing ever and realized that using my creativity to help bring people's ideas to life was something I'd definitely be passionate about doing.

So, in 8th grade, I chose to become a graphic designer. 

And then 10 years later: I found myself having graduated from Western Michigan University with my BFA in Graphic Design, designing letterpress books and prints in Italy, Switzerland,  and the Netherlands, working in New York at two reputable design studios,  Landor and Beardwood&
column2:
Co, going back home to work as a brand identity designer at my new studio, Gyro, and now teaching Detroit youth about graphic design and how pursuing it as a passion could bring one a lot of blessing.

 

But one thing I never failed to notice was: (1) I'm one of a very few African-American graphic designers in my immediate community and (2) no one really knows what graphic design is!

 

The Research

According to the 2019 Design Census, a survey developed by AIGA (the professional association for design) and Google on different aspects of the design industry, less than 25% of graphic designers are people of color: 9% are Asian, 8% are Latinx, 5% are Mixed, 3% are Black, and less than 0.4% are Native American or Pacific Islander.

As it is with many industries, having a diverse and inclusive community is extremely important because it acknowledges and invites the genius of people from various backgrounds. For this reason, I wanted to create something that would solve this problem of the design world lacking diversity, especially in urban communities, but also of the general public lacking design awareness.

Design Eye came as the solution to this problem. It makes learning fun (a game), introduces and teaches design quickly, and it inspires people to engage with each other creatively and motivates them to bring their ideas to life—an all-around enriching hands-on and social experience.

 

The Game

Design Eye teaches players about the six main disciplines of graphic design: branding, print design, package design, experiential (or environmental) design, web design, and motion design, showing examples of work in each discipline. It also teachers players a few design fundamentals: color theory, form theory, typography, and design history.

You are a student competing for acceptance into a prestigious design school called The Haas, and you must build a portfolio to show for an interview.

Learn about the major disciplines and fundamentals of graphic design. Sketch your own ideas and present them to your opponents for critique or speed test your design knowledge. Doing both earns you points to gain Portfolio Cards (cards that represent each work in your portfolio).

The first to finish building their portfolio wins—gets accepted into The Haas.

 

The Impact: Knowledge is Power, Creativity is Priceless

Not only are you getting an inexpensive, comprehensive introductory crash course on graphic design, but you're also taking away all of your original sketches that you did from playing Design Eye. These sketches are your big ideas—ideas that, one day, could turn into the next big thing!

For teachers, here's how having your students play Design Eye will sharpen their life skills:

Playing Design Eye:

• increases knowledge base

• increases design awareness

• improves critical thinking, creativity, and ideation skills (from sketching, critique)

• improves presentation and articulation skills (from critique)

• increases level of empathy, honesty, and respect and the like (from critique)

• improves reading skills (Studio Booklet, Instructions)

• improves drawing skills (from sketching)

• increases motivation to ideate and turn ideas into business or innovation endeavors (from sketching, critique, and Studio Booklet)

• exposes graphic design as a career path for youth not knowing they can make a living out of being creative

 

Great Design Costs, but Great Ideas Pay.

Game manufacturing, for the most part, is expensive. But I'm willing to pay the price for a well-designed, high-quality-made board game that packs a punch of knowledge and prompt of innovation, socialization, and generational motivation to produce generational wealth!

It'll cost me near $20,000 to mass produce enough units of Design Eye to fulfill pledges and then to have some leftover for general sale. About 90% of funding will go toward manufacturing Design Eye and 10% will go toward shipping those units to backers. 

Because I'm my own designer (like you should be), I obviously don't need to pay a dime for graphics. My small team and I are on our own with marketing and advertising, so if you're down to help us, hit me up! Thanks!

 

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

Money. Having enough money to mass produce Design Eye is my current barrier since game manufacturing is expensive.

Marketing: simply helping spread the word, especially to teachers and designers, artists, and other creatives would help a ton.

 

Share and Get Design Eye!

You know you have ideas, and you know you'll have a lot of fun sharing those ideas with your best friends (your to-be *cough cough* worst enemies). But all jokes aside, whether you win or lose in Design Eye, all of your ideas can come together to bring the best out of your collaboration and critique. Because no one likes to see their dreams come true alone.

Best for the classroom, great at home, and amazing with friends, tell everyone to get Design Eye Game, so we can get to creating our future.

 

Thank You

Deon Mixon

","OVERVIEWHave you ever had a great idea you just really needed to jot down?Better yet, have you ever struggled to find a graphic designer to bring your idea to life? Well, what if the graphic designer you were looking for was you? There's a creator in everyone and realizing you have a good eye for design and big ideas is the first step toward bringing your ideas to life.Discover the designer in you by playing the world's first graphic design education game, DESIGN EYE.  My name is Deon Mixon. I'm a graphic designer, author, poet, and design educator from Detroit, MI. Growing up as the only creative in my family, I wondered what career I'd get into to make a happy, good living. It was in middle school when a counselor told me about graphic design, showing me different examples of what could be created to get someone's idea or message out in the world. I thought what I saw was the dopest thing ever and realized that using my creativity to help bring people's ideas to life was something I'd definitely be passionate about doing.So, in 8th grade, I chose to become a graphic designer. And then 10 years later: I found myself having graduated from Western Michigan University with my BFA in Graphic Design, designing letterpress books and prints in Italy, Switzerland,  and the Netherlands, working in New York at two reputable design studios,  Landor and Beardwood&Co, going back home to work as a brand identity designer at my new studio, Gyro, and now teaching Detroit youth about graphic design and how pursuing it as a passion could bring one a lot of blessing. But one thing I never failed to notice was: (1) I'm one of a very few African-American graphic designers in my immediate community and (2) no one really knows what graphic design is! The ResearchAccording to the 2019 Design Census, a survey developed by AIGA (the professional association for design) and Google on different aspects of the design industry, less than 25% of graphic designers are people of color: 9% are Asian, 8% are Latinx, 5% are Mixed, 3% are Black, and less than 0.4% are Native American or Pacific Islander.As it is with many industries, having a diverse and inclusive community is extremely important because it acknowledges and invites the genius of people from various backgrounds. For this reason, I wanted to create something that would solve this problem of the design world lacking diversity, especially in urban communities, but also of the general public lacking design awareness.Design Eye came as the solution to this problem. It makes learning fun (a game), introduces and teaches design quickly, and it inspires people to engage with each other creatively and motivates them to bring their ideas to life—an all-around enriching hands-on and social experience. The GameDesign Eye teaches players about the six main disciplines of graphic design: branding, print design, package design, experiential (or environmental) design, web design, and motion design, showing examples of work in each discipline. It also teachers players a few design fundamentals: color theory, form theory, typography, and design history.You are a student competing for acceptance into a prestigious design school called The Haas, and you must build a portfolio to show for an interview.Learn about the major disciplines and fundamentals of graphic design. Sketch your own ideas and present them to your opponents for critique or speed test your design knowledge. Doing both earns you points to gain Portfolio Cards (cards that represent each work in your portfolio).The first to finish building their portfolio wins—gets accepted into The Haas. The Impact: Knowledge is Power, Creativity is PricelessNot only are you getting an inexpensive, comprehensive introductory crash course on graphic design, but you're also taking away all of your original sketches that you did from playing Design Eye. These sketches are your big ideas—ideas that, one day, could turn into the next big thing!For teachers, here's how having your students play Design Eye will sharpen their life skills:Playing Design Eye:• increases knowledge base• increases design awareness• improves critical thinking, creativity, and ideation skills (from sketching, critique)• improves presentation and articulation skills (from critique)• increases level of empathy, honesty, and respect and the like (from critique)• improves reading skills (Studio Booklet, Instructions)• improves drawing skills (from sketching)• increases motivation to ideate and turn ideas into business or innovation endeavors (from sketching, critique, and Studio Booklet)• exposes graphic design as a career path for youth not knowing they can make a living out of being creative Great Design Costs, but Great Ideas Pay.Game manufacturing, for the most part, is expensive. But I'm willing to pay the price for a well-designed, high-quality-made board game that packs a punch of knowledge and prompt of innovation, socialization, and generational motivation to produce generational wealth!It'll cost me near $20,000 to mass produce enough units of Design Eye to fulfill pledges and then to have some leftover for general sale. About 90% of funding will go toward manufacturing Design Eye and 10% will go toward shipping those units to backers. Because I'm my own designer (like you should be), I obviously don't need to pay a dime for graphics. My small team and I are on our own with marketing and advertising, so if you're down to help us, hit me up! Thanks! Risks & ChallengesMoney. Having enough money to mass produce Design Eye is my current barrier since game manufacturing is expensive.Marketing: simply helping spread the word, especially to teachers and designers, artists, and other creatives would help a ton. Share and Get Design Eye!You know you have ideas, and you know you'll have a lot of fun sharing those ideas with your best friends (your to-be *cough cough* worst enemies). But all jokes aside, whether you win or lose in Design Eye, all of your ideas can come together to bring the best out of your collaboration and critique. Because no one likes to see their dreams come true alone.Best for the classroom, great at home, and amazing with friends, tell everyone to get Design Eye Game, so we can get to creating our future. Thank YouDeon Mixon",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: |","Detroit, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/design-eye-the-graphic-design-education-game/pica

About Our Team and Mission

We’re a group of hardware engineers and also board game fans.

We envision the LED and IoT technology can be a good fit with traditional chess game, making it easily hands on and fun to play. So, we invented this revolutionary board game, Smart Chess!

Our mission is to make playing chess entertaining, enlightening and affordable. We also try to bring people from screen and back to the old ways of playing board games with people, while still enjoying the fun. 

 

About Smart Chess

Smart Chess is a chess board built with sensors and LED lights under it. It also has Wi-Fi module communicating with internet server. The sensor can sense the piece move on the board and transmit the signal to the server for processing. The LED lights on the board track every move of the piece. The lights also showing AI’s moves, guiding the game. All the moves will be sent back recorded in the server for future game review. 

Different from other electronic chess game on the market, we applied LED and IoT technology, a more reliable and mature technology. And it is relatively easy to realize all the features from engineering perspective, and more affordable for customers. 

 

There are 4 Great Play Mode of Smart Chess
• Play Against AI Opponent
• Play Against Human Opponent
• Solve Puzzles with AI
• Review Played Games
Smart Chess is good for
• First time player
• Beginner learning to play chess
• Intermediate/advance player to improve their skills
• People can’t find one to play with chess
• Chess game tournament for playing and recordin keeping purpose

column3: >In the past 2019,  our team has developed this concept and finally built the prototype. And
column4:
> now both hardware and software are 95% ready.

We target to raise $50,000 to kick start our production. This is trying to reach the factory MOQ (minimum order quantity) to lower our product cost. So that we can pass the saving to our customers. 

For each backer, you’ll receive this new Smart Chess Game Set after donating $129  to our campaign. And we promise the shipment by end of Apr, 2020

We're also keen to hear your feedback once you receive your product so that we can keep improving this product. 

 

About this Campaign and Next Step

We hope to raise enough money to kick start our production, making it accessible to all chess fans or anyone who is interested to play chess at a reasonable price, while taking advantage the latest technology. 

Our next step to further shred our cost and improve the software.

We’ll keep updating the progress of this product and shipment. Thank you.

Hi, I’m Sasha, a work-from-home Mom to two amazingly intelligent kids. After working for over a decade as a successful Interior Decorator, my life, and priorities changed with the arrival of my children. All of a sudden I was spending a ton of time playing with toys that I felt lacked any kind of intelligence… and, I wondered..
If we want smart kids, why don’t we give them smart toys?

So I started creating toys made from the fabrics I knew and loved from my decorating days, and those toys that I created were a big hit with my kids, and their friends.. and all of a sudden my Playmats and Quiet Books were in demand.

So, I created TinyFeats, so that I could build toys that inspired and motivated kids. But we need your help to make it happen. Will you help us fill orders for our already popular City Driver Activity Mat? Show your support for the next generation of kids and awesome toys, by funding our Indiegogo campain today.
What makes a TinyFeats Activity Mat so awesome?..

The difference is in the design, our activity mats include more things for your little one to do, snaps, slots, and pockets all help a kid develop and refine their fine motor skills. Going to the car wash or gas station are real life activities that kids long to master, these car themed activities gives kids the opportunity to practice and hone their creative and dramatic play skills. Preparing  them take those vitally important first steps towards independence.
The City Roads Activity Mat is designed to be both fun, and practical too..
<ul>
<li>
PORTABLE - It rolls up neatly and fit into a diaper bag, making it a perfect on-the-go toy for church, waiting rooms, or playdates at Grandmas house.
<li>
NO LOOSE PIECES - All the pieces are securely fastened, even the matchbox cars fit into pockets that seal shut. So nothing dangles or gets left behind.
<li>
HOURS OF FUN - Both my son and daughter will happily sit and play for hours with this activity mat.
<li>

MADE FROM FABRIC! - Soft fabric toys cause less damage to siblings, parents, walls and furniture.. plus, the notable absence of screens, buttons and lights make these toys an ideal quiet time toy, in fact the only sounds you are likely to hear is the heartwarming squeal of delight, or weeeeee, as a car races over the overpass!
We Need Your Help To Make it Happen!
Myself and my little sewing machine just can’t keep up to the demand.

I need your support to expand our production capabilities, the entire $2,000 from this campaign will go directly to purchasing inventory, any additional funding (if we get there) will go towards marketing and creating our next design (a mini car mat).
We need 500 City Driver Activity Mats ASAP. I have found a workroom that can produce our Activity Mat to my exacting standards
column2: using their team of craftsmen we can produce more play mats, faster, and more affordably than I can alone. That means that more kids get more awesome playmats, and parents don’t have to spend as much money for a top quality educational toy for their kids. It’s a win-win for everyone!

column1: Starting with YOU..
We’ve got some fantastic perks for you, our kind and generous supporters, including, Indiegogo exclusives that are not available to anyone else… just you, when you donate.

$10 - The YOU’RE AWESOME PERK - You’ll receive a personalized thank you note, expressing my heartfelt gratitude for your contribution. PLUS, an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.
$25 - The GENEROUS SUPPORTER PERK - A hand written thank you note, expressing my heartfelt gratitude for your contribution
column2: snail mailed to you anywhere in the world. PLUS, an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.

column1: $55 - The MATCHBOX CAR FANATIC PERK - Your own brand new City Roads Activity Mat PLUS 3 matchbox cars included! A personalized thank you note from me and an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.

$88 - The PERSONALIZED PERK - Your own brand new City Roads Activity Mat with 3 matchbox cars included, PLUS, a personalized iron-on name plate for your new activity mat! A personalized thank you note from me and an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.

$150 - The GRAND-DADDY PERK - A 25% discount on any and all TinyFeats Quiet Books or Activity Mat FOR LIFE. Plus you’ll also get, your own brand new City Roads Activity Mat with 3 matchbox cars included, PLUS, a personalized iron-on name plate for your new activity mat! A personalized thank you note from me and an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.

$500 or More - The LEGACY PERK - We’ll create a brand new Activity Mat design inspired by you (or a little on that you love), name it after you (or the little one you love), AND you’ll receive the very first one we produce. PLUS, you’ll also get a 25% discount on any and all TinyFeats Quiet Books or Activity Mat FOR LIFE. And right now you’ll also get, your own brand new City Roads Activity Mat with 3 matchbox cars included, PLUS, a personalized iron-on name plate for your new activity mat! A personalized thank you note from me and an invitation to join the VIP Toy Club which grants you access to new designs and exclusive discounts before they are available to anyone else.
Only your support can make this possible

No joke, the toy industry can be vicious. There’s a lot of competition for space on toy store shelves, and simply having an awesome product like ours is no guarantee of success. So we are taking a different approach and building a community of fans and supporters to help raise awareness about the TinyFeats brand, and, the next generation of toys for smart kids. With the help of my husband Mark (a successful Amazon Seller) and your contribution, we will also use a portion of the inventory (that you’ll help to purchase) to launch TinyFeats products on Amazon.com, the wildly successful, 43 billion dollar a year platform. But before we can do that, we need stock, and your support.

So please contribute to our Indiegogo Campaign by purchasing a perk and/or spreading the word on Social Media. And, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for your time and contributions, together we can make smarter toys for smarter kids.
Help plant the seeds of change with toys that inspire greatness in this next generation of kids.
Warmest Wishes,
Sasha

Short Summary

Hello!

My name is Massimo Macaluso and for more than a year I've been thinking and working with my brother Alberto on this board game. I took care of the game design while my brother followed the whole graphic part.

In my life I deal with marketing in the energy sector and I am passionate about electric mobility.

Together with Luca Secco, CEO of DRIWE SRL (www.driwe.eu), we have invented and designed this game to make it easy and fun to learn the concepts of energy efficiency and electric mobility, because we believe and hope that no city will have to be covered by smog in the future.

During the brain storming phase and the first prototype testing, with family&
column2:
friends around us, we discovered an amazing intereset of such game experience and some in advance game bookers, too!

One of the most interested one has been the founders of http://www.greenenergypark.it/en/ , a wonderful educational center (for schools and professional training) based in the north east of Italy. Thousands of people every year come there to learn in new ways how to improve our world.

They already asked us to be the first receivers of The Game and... a giant version of it for the school training next year !!

So this would be the first place where tens of families and children could play on it.

 

A better, more beautiful and cleaner world is possible by starting to play our part!

 

What We Need 

We need some thousand euros to cover the development costs already incurred and to be able to produce the final version of the game.

We need also your support to diffuse it as a brand new nice edu-game for the schools and public cultural centers. Some of them have been already approached by us with wonderful feedback and they are very interested in it for teaching many adults and children with new friendly communication ways.

What You Get

What you see in the photo is the ALPHA version, the result of more than a year of development.

Driwe: The Game is an easy to learn but, at the same time, a deep game, too.

It's an educational game that teaches that you can improve the quality of life in cities by using less polluting cars and more efficient homes.

The happiness of the city depends on the individual choices we make every day.

GAME IS BILINGUAL: ITALIAN &
column3:
ENGLISH

Game was tested since the beginning even by a very very expert game player with 8+ years of experience:

Other photos from the first prototype (2016):

NEW PHOTOS (10 - Jan - 2018)

CARDS!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your support!

Any idea, suggestion, remark? Well accepted!

Customization required? If we reach the goal we have some amazing idea to share and develop together.

Please help spread the word, share and Back  us!

Passionate about Painting! 

I love collecting playing cards and 2 years ago I created my first deck with huge support from the crowdfunding community. (thank you!!) The deck featured 52 unique original artworks created in Ink, Tea and Alcohol, the stuff you drink not any kind of painting material!

Have a look at the images below - these are my selected 52 images for the new deck. 

I have also shown some visuals of how the finished decks will look. 

There are 2 variations - a standard limited edition deck - made by USPCC with a standard tuck and numbered seal

A collector's deck with a gilded deck Made by USPCC with a custom tuck produced by Gamblers Warehouse complete with foiling embossing and a custom foil seal

As well as being available in the deck these paintings are available as prints in a playing card format in very limited editions!

10 years ago I left a career as an embroidery designer to follow my passion - drawing and painting. At the time it was a huge gamble but over time I realised that I could actually make a living doing what I loved most and to be fair haven't looked back since.. I mainly exhibit work and get involved with projects that excite me and give something back. My work has been exhibited in galleries and fairs all over the world and I am fortunate enough to have had solo exhibitions in London, Brighton, Germany, Hong Kong, Italy and Dubai.

Risks &
DISTRIBUTION:
Getting this game to you is straightforward as it's just a simple card game. Working on a box to put the cards in is a challenge, but other than that, it's pretty easy.

That’s why we’re leaving out the usual T-shirt and rewards tier promo goodies to ensure a speedy distribution. We're keeping it short and sweet: support our project and we'll send you the card game to play, right away.
PRODUCTION:

In order to meet the high demand we are hoping for, we have found a production partner with a great track record for quality and production in China (Denise speaks fluent Mandarin) who is ready to go into production immediately.
GAME DESIGN &
This game was developed during the beginning of lockdown, where we had nothing else to do except for work on game dynamics.
We made it a priority to consult with health professionals and game designers to bring this project to life. Our product is fully designed and production ready. So, that’s why we need your support!
Help us by pre-ordering a game, so our printers can start printing! Our project aims to give 12% of all profits raised to COVID initiatives to stay safe during this crazy time.
SHIPPING &
We appointed a global fulfilment agency that has delivered many other successful Kickstarter games. This way, no matter how many people pledge, everyone gets their Bye Bye Virus game in July.

We have also accounted for potential time delays in production and fulfilment due to COVID-19, however just like we didn’t expect the coronavirus in our lives that’s why we will update you along the way.
TRANSPARENT COMMUNICATION

We are in this situation together, that's why we created this game to help more people learn and adopt behaviours to keep them safe. We are committed to regularly updating you through Kickstarter during and after the campaign. We will also be active in the comments section of our campaign page.

As backers of other games ourselves, we know the importance of being in contact, so for all further queries and questions, do contact us at hello@byebyevirusgame.com and we will get back to you in 24 hours or reach out to us on instagram @byebyevirusgame or @yasminekhater
Other Ways You Can Help
If you know a distributor who wants to help us spread this message, do get in touch :)

It’s almost here! We’ve completed writing and editing the Tome of Spirits and will be sending the remaining text to InDesign soon. Our goal is to deliver the best supplement we possibly can, with more content, deeper lore, and (of course) more original artwork! Why Indiegogo? After a successful Kickstarter campaign, we wanted to bring our project to even more gamers and fantasy lovers around the world. By launching the Tome of Spirits on Indiegogo, we can make it available to those who missed the original launch campaign and allow late pledges. This campaign isn’t just for the Tome of Spirits. We know our backers want more adventures and campaigns to run in the Endless Realms universe, so we hope to produce a number of adventures from this campaign that will be revealed along the way.

Endless Realms Runs off of a D10 system and this book contains everything you need to start exploring the world of Endless Realms, including: 9 Intriguing New Races: For players who are tired of fantasy standards like dwarves, elves, and orcs, the Corebook gives insight into unique races like the honorable lupine warriors, the Ulvar Kyr, or the rabbit-eared, all-female race, the Al'Miren. Learn about each race's history, culture, characteristics, and special abilities so you can build your own character within the world of Endless Realms.

10 Distinct Classes: From silver-tongued and sword-wielding Dandies, to Judicars, the enforcers of order, our 10 classes give players 10 wildly-different combat styles and the framework to build a one-of-a-kind character. 

Unique Setting &
column2:
Gameplay: The world of Lumis provides an immersive setting and gameplay that focuses on player interaction and rewards creativity for endless replay-ability and memorable experiences. 

Vices &
column3:
Virtues: Things aren't always as simple as good and evil in our world. Every character you encounter or create is going to be defined in part by virtues such as Loyal and Courageous, as well as at least one vice, like Narcissistic or Lazy.

Easy to Learn: The simple, yet elegant game mechanics are easy for newcomers to learn but offer enough depth to enrich your storytelling and create a seamless and enjoyable combat experience. 

Engaging Design: Full-color and lavishly illustrated, each Endless Realms book is a stunning addition to any gamer's collection, and the thoughtfully-curated art is bound to catch any fantasy lover's eye. 

 

 

This Creature Compendium contains full-color illustrations of over 250 creatures. This book contains everything you need to encounter, battle, hunt, and even create the creatures of Endless Realms, including: Unique Creature Design: Inside, players will find completely new creatures as well as familiar favorites with an imaginative twist, all creatively designed and skillfully illustrated. 

The Creature Compendium contains a wide variety of creatures, all complete with lore, stats, and gorgeous illustrations. In-Depth Lore: Every creature comes with a wealth of knowledge about its behavior, habitat, abilities, and physical traits so that every creature encounter is fully fleshed out. Easy-to-Create Custom Creatures: In case 250+ creatures isn't enough for you, the Creature Compendium include rules for creating your own beasts, or for adjusting the strength of an opponent to fit any scenario or group of adventurers

The MOKURU CARD GAME is a new type of board game. It not only challenges your skill and tactics, but often also your teamwork with other players!

Two years ago, MOKURU - the amazing desk toy was funded on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. This simple wooden stick has endless possibilities, players can come up with their own tricks or master the existing ones. MOKURU is easy to pickup, yet challenging to master as new tricks are always invented!
column4:
>

 

After contacting the MOKURU team, we learned that they have already collected a number of popular tricks from fans and have ranked them from the easiest to the most challenging into “Basic”, “Advanced” and “Master” difficulties. Instead of just publishing a book, we have suggested to turn it into a full board game with complete rules and tokens. With character designs aided by Italian graphic designer and illustrator Valentina Fabbri, MOKURU CARD GAME was born.

column10: >
column11:
>

 

MOKURU is an amazing desk toy. It has a simple design with endless possibilities that will test your creativity and dexterity. Play with MOKURU for fun or sharpen your skills and style to become a master. You can even play MOKURU with friends. It’s totally up to you!

MOKURU was created upon traditional Japanese wooden toy. After years of development, MOKURU was launched on Kickstarter in 2017 and successfully funded. It has since been distributed worldwide, delivering to over 1 million players in over 100 countries.

Today, we are teaming up with the MOKURU team to relaunch as the MOKURU CARD GAME. MOKURU is remodeled once more, this time molded in strong and light plastic, so you can play them at home or at your favorite cafe anytime!

Shipping fee will be charged as you place your pledge, based on the actual costs. We will collect the delivery information after the end of campaign. We will ship your rewards from our warehouse once production is completed.

Shipping fee is sorted into 3 zones. Zone A will include most countries including the US, much of EU and Asia, while countries classified into zone B and C will cost a little more for shipping. All customs fees will be billed to us, no extra payment apart from the pledge is required. Bear in mind that these are just estimates and that costs may based on weight increases due to your final pledge selection.

Zone A ($10): USA, France, United Kingdom, Japan, China, Macau and Hong Kong

Zone B ($10): Europe: Germany, Republic of Ireland, Belgium, Luxembourg, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Switzerland, Austria, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Czech Republic, Canada and Australia

Zone C ($10-15): Rest of the world.

We cannot delivery to PO Box.

column11:
>

 

The rulebook for the game will be available in both English and French ! You will be able to access other language rule books we have translated in pdf after the campaign ends.
column14:
>

 

 

 

 

MOKURU was born in 2010. After extensive testing with different designs, materials and sizes
column15:
the MOKURU team was able to bring out MOKURU - a traditional Japanese desk toy reborn with modern design.

Each MOKURU is crafted out of a single piece of natural wood with abrasive rubber pad attached on each side. Its unique shape allows you to roll and flip it on most flat surfaces. It looks as good as a decoration as it is fun to play, which is essential for minimalists.

With a minimal yet instantly recognizable design, MOKURU was funded on Kickstarter with great success. The craze took off soon afterward, over a million MOKURU were sold to worldwide! Soon videos of MOKURU flooding the social media like Instagram and Facebook. As the team thought we had already recorded all possible tricks, fans have invented dozens more, submitting them for more inspiration.
column16:
>

We approached the MOKURU team and suggested the idea of adding game cards to MOKURU and create a table game. Turns out the team was already planning to publish new tricks (excluding the one requiring the use of your mouth) on a book. MOKURU team liked the idea, so we immediately collaborated as the new MOKURU team. While we were at it, Italian illustrator Valentina helped us to add an European touch for MOKURU CARD GAME by creating all illustrations in her style. For the game set, MOKURU is redesigned, this time injection-molded in engineering plastic such that it is light to carry around and quiet enough to be played in door (but still not a good idea to play at library).

We want to put this project on crowdfunding because it’s the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make the improvements as a MOKURU community. Please back this project and help us build this game.
