<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline
Experience the belly-busting laughter game! Connect with your favorite people! Unleash the actor within and discover a side of yourself that you didn’t even know you had!

Improv Against Normality (patent pending) was created by actor-improviser, Julie Cotton, with an intent to connect the world through laughter and play. Break out of what's ""normal"" and be a part of creating the extraordinary!
Contributions to our campaign will support a world where Connection, Creativity, Play, and Laughter are celebrated and championed!
<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline
The maker of the game asked two questions - ""How can I make Improv a household name?""
And, when working with groups or corporate teams, ""How can I leave something behind that will allow people to continue to practice the culture of Improv after our workshop/event is over?""

Improv Against Normality was the answer that came through in a mediation late November 2018. It felt like a calling to steward these cards into ""being"". Since then, it's been a flurry of momentum creating a prototype, touring the nation for market research and for playability while now shifting into capital raising in order to make the cards a reality for the world!
The goal is to bring a simple and basic version of Improv to as many people as possible.
These cards are made up of 5 color decks Black, Blue, Green, Yellow and White with 101 cards in each deck, 505 total (why not 100/500? Why be normal?)
<ul>
• Black - Scenario Card
• Blue- Character Card
• Green- Location Card
• Yellow- Object/Activity Card
• White- Secret/Want Card

Start with a Scenario, then add in the 4 most common pillars to a good scene - The WHO, the WHAT, the WHERE and the WHY. And see what you and your favorite people can bring to life through live action role play.
<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline
<ul>

• All funds raised will go directly to the printing, design, and production of Improv Against Normality Cards themselves. We are keeping commerce in America and printing with a company based in Battlecreek, Michigan. The amount of funding raised will determine the number of cards we can print.

• Exciting future-pacing- we have a video-capable app version of the game in the works which would allow people to play from anywhere in the world (and save some trees)! Design and development costs for the app are upwards of $15K on top of our initial printing costs.

• In the event that we do not reach our collective funding goal, all funds will still go towards the printing and fulfillment of the cards for those who contributed. The shipping date would simply push back until we are able, as a company, to generate the necessary funds.
UNIQUE and FUN perks for our contributors are:
(*depending on the level of contribution)
<ul>
• Receive a copy or copies of the GAME itself (obviously ?)!
• Bulk orders at deeper discounts
• Cool Improv Against Normality T-shirt swag
• Video Trainings of Top Improv Games to Facilitate any group
• Live, Virtual Facilitator for an Improv Against Normality Game Private Event for your group
Yes, and...
Stay tuned into the Campaign for opportunities to contribute at higher levels and receive these great perks:
<ul>
• Live, In-Person Facilitator for an Improv Against Normality game private event for your group.
• White Labeled Custom version of the Improv Against Normality game designed for your specific group, company, or event.
• White Labeled App version to match your custom designed game.
<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline

""This game is perfect for shy people. It is simple to get a hang of, build confidence, smile, laugh, move around, improvise! All core skills for sales! Need a boost in sales? Play this game. Most valuable game ever!"" — Bonnie Manhattan
Do you want to...
<ul>
• Improve Customer relations?
• Increase in Sales?
• Increase Client and Employee retention?
• Improve Confidence?
• Improve Team Work/Collaboration?
• Enjoy time with people you spend most of it with?
...then play this game!
<ul>
• Celebrate risk-taking
• Embrace Change
• Befriend fear of the unknown
• Step out of your comfort zone
• Give yourself and others permission to fail
• Know you cannot get it wrong, and it's never done.
• Kick what it means to be ""Normal"" to the curb!
Connect, Play, Laugh, Repeat.
Now, what if we live our ""real"" lives like that?
* Additional Impact *

10% of all funds raised will go to benefit our local Girls on the Run non-profit organization in lower Michigan/Northern Indiana! Find out more about how they use the experience-based curriculum to inspire girls to be Joyful, Healthy, and Confident, visit GirlsOnTheRunMichiana.org
<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline
Next Level Improv strives to deliver quality products and services with quick turn around.

One challenge we foresee in this endeavor is having so much support that we exceed our man-power capacity to deliver interactive responses, engage as fully with our contributors as we would like throughout the campaign, and/or delay printing/shipping of games due to exceedingly high volumes. Potential solution(s)- attract volunteer support, interns, new teammates to support the execution of these tasks.

Another risk could be not reaching our funding goal and needing to delay production of the games and t-shirts beyond the May 2019 projection potentially disappointing our supporters. Potential solution- seek outside funding options- increasing in-person pre-sale events, trade shows, investors, angel investors, loans etc.
<h3 style=""text-decoration: underline

column2: >I have been an Actor/Improviser for over 30 years, I've had the pleasure of playing with the best at iO Chicago, Sick Puppies Comedy, Just the Funny, Improv U, Nickelodeon, Rutgers MGSA, local Phoenix area Theaters, GratitudeTrainings, FL and Trainer Designs Global. I absolutely love applying Improv into everyday life so that everyone can benefit! Find out more about me and the company at NextLevelImprov.com

column1: CASANDRA TANNENBAUM - GRAPHIC DESIGNER

column2: >Casandra Tanenbaum is an artist, educator, and entrepreneur.  Creator of Flow Fests- festivals of play in major cities nationwide

column1: JONY CHAGAS - Designer at ZIPP PRINTING

Originally from Brazil, Jony was raised as a missionary kid in Senegal (West Africa). In sixth grade, he decided to give graphic design a try just for the fun of it. Nine years later, he is now working at Zipp Printing as one of the designers putting his creativity and love for design at work on a daily basis. Jony was pivotal in getting our initial prototype designed to bring to market testing events. You can find out more about them at team@zippprinting.com, 574-256-0059, ZippPrinting.com located at 235 E. McKinley Ave. Mishawaka, IN 46545.

Contributions to our campaign will support a world where Connection, Creativity, Play, and Laughter are celebrated and championed!

Welcome to our Page!
Hi, my name is KC
column2: I am the founder of NIBCARD Games - a publishing, manufacturing and promotional tabletop games company in Nigeria, Africa.  With the help of my team, we have designed and published 17 boardgames, hosted the first Boardgame convention in Nigeria (annually since 2016), opened the first Boardgame cafe in Nigeria and introduced the world of boardgaming to over 15,000 Nigerians directly and more indirectly.

column1: I invite you to back our boardgame project. But before I tell you why, please meet WAN WAN TOUCH: The boardgame.

Wan Wan Touch is a dexterity soccer game from Nigeria. The game is a version of a popular street soccer game where players can only touch/play the ball once. It can be played by 2-4 players and takes between 30-60 minutes to play and is suitable for anyone from the age of 7 years and above.

The game idea came up during a boardgame hangout we hosted. One of the players jokingly talked about the football game we usually played on the street when we were still younger and players had to only touch/play the ball once until someone else have done the same.

The journey of developing this game has truly been worth it. The process has brought back a lot of feelings from the past - memories I thought were forgotten. Also, this game has been a force for better design and production from everyone in the team.
This is also our first 3D boardgame. And we are really excited about it. Really excited.
​
Wan Wan Touch Rule Book
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/ruCVJLQU3MQ?autohide=1&amp
<div>
<div class=""""><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/u2gATphVLkc?autohide=1&amp
Why Back Us?

Reaching our goal will be a huge WIN for us and the Tabletop Gaming community because it will help increase our everyday activities to see a growing interest in the hobby accross Nigeria and hopefully other African countries. Imagine the many joy that boardgames could bring to homes, the smiles, the memories and the relationships it could established (see our daily activities on our Instagram handle)
We are asking you to back us so that we can continue what we are doing and even better! As well as send you our Nigerian and African experience on a board!

Funds from this campaign will help us bring in more competent and motivated people to help us reach more people in Nigeria - a country of over 200 million people (in fact, the largest black country in the World). To have better equipment and software, to make better art works and to see our games globally accepted - perhaps win the Spiel des  Jahres, Boardgame Geek and/or Dice Tower awards.
But this can only become achievable if we reach our goal of producing and shipping at least 1,321 copies of Wan Wan Touch boardgame at the current perk ($40).

If we don't reach our goal, we will get the products and/or service we need the most (and able to afford). However, we are not stopping. We take solace in knowing that there was once a time when we thought about setting up the first Tabletop Games Cafe in Nigeria and the Global gaming community (YOU) believed and backed us. We are not resting until we see an active gaming community that involves every household in Nigeria. Boardgames are too amazing not to be in homes and played.
Extra Reward

For every backer, we will play a game with anyone (in the cafe or outside the cafe)  in honour of you. We will of course post an evidence such as pictures, quotes or videos. The boardgame community have taught us how priceless it is to introduce new people to the hobby. So yes, we will be doing this in your honour.
The Impact

This will be our biggest project. And it will create our most impact yet. Having a full active structure will give us the leverage to focus on supporting game lovers and designers to work on their ideas and to try out new ideas ourselves. This will increase ownership from different 'independent' individuals and/or groups who will in turn promote their own games and the entire boardgaming industry in Nigeria.

Also, it will help create sustained employment opportunities for people (Youth Unemployment Rate in Nigeria averaged 23.63 percent from 2014 until 2018, reaching an all time high of 38 percent in the second quarter of 2018 and a record low of 11.70 percent in the fourth quarter of 2014.). I strongly believe the Tabletop Gaming Hobby has the potential to create value chains of work.
<ol>

<li>In the past, I believed I could design a game back in 2013 at a time when everyone around me said it has never been done and could't be done. <span style=""font-family: benton-sans, Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: >We have gone on to publish 18 of them (this will be our 19th and also working with 3 different individuals to release their own games). See current video of our activities from 2017.

column1: • In 2016, we started the African Boardgame Convention (AB Con) in Nigeria when none was existing and we were told it couldn't be done. We also introduced a yearly Award to recognize and honour everyone who is supporting the growth of the industry in Nigeria.
• We also crowdfunded to start a boardgame cafe in Nigeria even when I was told it couldn't be done.
These successes has helped us introduced over 15,000 people to Tabletop Gaming directly and even much more through our online activities (and in different countries too).

We have also  HANDMADE  and distributed more than 7,000 games since 2016.  With your backing, we hope to make better tabletop games and inspire more people in Nigeria to join the hobby , we can never do it alone.
We can only rely on you to continue and even become better and more effective.

We will be shipping the games to all countries in February 2020 and this are the cost per country for 0-2kg worth of commodity. Wan Wan Touch weighs 1.7KG. Countries not mentioned are considered as rest of the World.
<ul>
• United States 31USD
• United Kingdom 35USD
• European Union 35USD
• Canada 31USD
• France 35USD
• Denmark 35USD
• Brazil 38USD
• South Africa 37USD
• Rest of the World 40USD

Our last Indiegogo campaign taught us a valuable lesson. We spent an extra %45 on the shipping cost. This was because our shipping partners increased their tariff just as the campaign ended. It was a global decision and we had no signed document to claim our former agreement with them. This time around, we have a better and concrete agreement
column2: so we do not see such problem happening anymore.

column1: We have also given ourselves enough time to finish production should we reach our goal or extend it twice as much.
Other Ways You Can Help

Join us in spreading this love across everyone. From Social media to gaming conventions, game nights, groups, cafes and on the streets. We also welcome opportunities to talk about our project and/or collaboration (you can reach us directly on this platform or email us on info@nibcardgames.com)
Thank you soooooooo much and we hope you get to play our games soon!

Dragons of Afterlands - an exhilarating Augmented Reality board game

Relying on the familiarity of a physical board game, the magic of Dragons of Afterlands comes to life by projecting Augmented Reality 3D characters and environments directly onto the board through your tablet or smartphone as you dive deep into the Afterlands.
column3:
rid=giphy-downsized-large.gif"" src=""""/>

 

Cutting-edge technology for a unique board game experience

Player location on the board, player mission progress and game stats are tracked in real-time using innovative technology, automatically activating Quests, Natural Disasters and Monster Battles. No more pens and paper needed! In addition, innovative application of speech recognition technology enables players to compete, collaborate and storytell by solving voice-activated Challenges.
column5:
rid=giphy.gif"" src=""""/>

 

Play in-person or remotely with your friends

Come together and have fun with your friends, even when far apart! If you can’t meet-up with your friends, play Dragons of Afterlands remotely with anyone who also owns a board through synchronised gameplay and recreate the social experience of a traditional board game, wherever you are.
column7:
rid=giphy-downsized-large.gif"" src=""""/>

 

Personalised gameplay customised to each player

By tracking your progress in-game, your personal character development and player progression persist across game sessions, creating levelling-up options over time. Dragons of Afterlands delivers customised content and customises challenge difficulty levels based on your previous performance, meaning you can play with friends and have a personalised experience each time you play! New challenges and levels encourage you to develop new strategies, making every game a unique experience. Further game upgrades and personalised content is also available through ongoing free app updates!
column8: >
column9:
rid=giphy-downsized-large.gif"" src=""""/>

 

Skill development through cooperative Challenges

Dragons of Afterlands improves communication skills and enhances wellbeing through the unique cooperative Challenges designed by psychologists. These provide players with opportunities to challenge themselves, developing critical skills associated to personal development, all whilst having fun!

 

Dragons of Afterlands, the perfect game for:

column1: • Friends and families
• People aged 13 and above
• Board game lovers
• Those who wish board games were more like video games!
• Anyone wanting to focus on personal development and improving communication skills!

Embark on exciting quests, training dragons and attempting to save Earth.

 

 

Dragons of Afterlands will take you to an exciting world where you will encounter dragons and other magical creatures in your quest to find legendary Dragon Eggs, restore harmony to Earth and save humanity.

Witness the board come to life through the use of Augmented Reality (AR) on your phone or tablet as you progress along intricately decorated realms, interact with the environments, vanquish monsters and cooperate and compete with other players to progress through the game.  

The result is a fantastic blend of traditional board game dynamics with an exciting digital world that will plunge you deep into a universe of suspended belief where reality and fiction blur. Vanquish the monsters, avoid deadly natural disasters and skilfully travel between realms to help the Dragon Witch and save the world!
column4:
> 

           

With the world devastated by the climate crisis, humans live in the central neutral territory, with the rest of the world uninhabitable, struggling to survive in their limited territory. They are visited by a Dragon Witch, who promises brave adventurers exciting rewards and the power to restore harmony to Earth who help her raise her dragons. 

Adventurers must travel to the Dragon Realms to achieve their mission by completing storytelling challenges to win Dragon Eggs and help humanity survive. Guided by the avatar Dragon Witch, players use storytelling and roleplay to collaborate and compete to complete the challenges. These challenges help players develop communication and wellbeing skills associated with improving mental health. 

The first player to complete their Egg Mission, build wellbeing energy and make it back to the start wins!
column5: >
column6:
rid=giphy-downsized-large.gif"" src=""""/>

                                       

 

This is a 2-8 player game that offers a unique hybrid gameplay experience, combining physical elements such as the board, dice, cards and player tokens with virtual components that track player progress and bring life to the story and characters thanks to the versatility of technology.

column1: • Set-out the board, player tokens, cards and other items
• Download the Dragons of Afterlands app and create a game. Your friends can then join your game through the app
• See your player avatar magically appear through your phone on the board as your progress is tracked through the four magical Dragon Realms
• Complete personalised challenges with the help of a chosen ally, collecting Dragon Eggs and gaining Strength points. These challenges increase in difficulty across game sessions
• Encounter a myriad of different characters, interacting with them both on-screen and on the board
<li>Guided by the Dragon Witch avatar, fight monsters, flee from natural disasters and navigate Opportunity &amp
column2: Threat scenarios to gain Strength Points and acquire Dragon Eggs

>

 

                                      

​

column1: • An app (Android and iOS) - easy to download and install, the app manages all game mechanics, player tracking and scoring. By pointing your device towards the board, cards and player tokens, AR animations will appear on your screen, giving life to the realms, characters and battles.
<li>Physical components - beautifully produced and packaged, these serve as support for all 3D animations projected in Augmented Reality through your smartphone or tablet. These include:<ul>
• the board, with AR animated realms, monsters, characters and player progression
• the cards, displaying through AR the various Challenges and Opportunity/Threat scenarios
• the player tokens, showing each player's AR avatar and used to move on the board
• the dice.

Dragons of Afterlands has already come a long way, but we still have a lot of work to do to bring this game to its full potential. With your backing, we can take Dragons of Afterlands to the next level, pushing forwards with the next stages of development. 

 

Immediate goals – up to £50k
• Create and animate 3D models for dragons, monsters and environments
<li>Develop comprehensive bank of in-game challenges
column2: these will be continuously added to over time

column1: • Perfect automatic player tracking and event triggers
• Ensure high-quality UK-based production of all physical assets (board, cards, player tokens...)
• Launch game on Android and iOS
Stretch goals – £80k
• Create and animate additional 3D models of player character avatars
• Expand player personalisation features and customisation
• Introduce levelling-up features of environments, monsters and characters across game sessions
• Implement player performance feedback dashboard
Stretch goals – £120k+
• Create and expand quests, characters and challenges
• Develop and implement speech-recognition and voice-activation technology to drive gameplay

We want to assure you that we will handle everything from manufacturing to shipping with the highest level of professionalism. We are using expert manufacturers specialised in game-production to ensure the final product has high quality components and will be manufactured on time.

For shipping, we cooperate with well proven, UK-based fulfilling centres.

With our hard work and dedication together with the professionalism of these manufacturing and fulfilment partners, we fully intend to deliver the promised rewards to all backers on time. 

If an issue does occur, however, we are committed to informing you and being transparent on how we intend to provide a swift and efficient resolution, responding to questions and concerns in a timely manner throughout the campaign and thereafter. 

 

                       

We are a small indie games studio that creates great games that also develop important life skills, focusing not only on the fun and creative aspects of games, but also on the value they can provide to players. 

The positive emotions we experience when playing games provide people with a safe place to try new things and challenge themselves. This relaxed and comfortable state of mind is perfectly suited for learning and developing skills, which is why we infuse our games with a layer of purpose and opportunity for personal growth.

That being said, we also realise that games must above all be fun and bring joy to people in new and exciting ways. That is why our game development team has over 20 years experience in the games industry, in order to bring you a truly great game!

 

                        

We offer our backers fantastic rewards to thank them for their support. All of these are designed to offer extra value, ranging from simple discounts on the game to limited edition items that generate Dragons of Afterlands AR in your home!

For larger contributions, we offer fabulous customisation options to make your version of the game unique, allowing YOU to personalise Dragons of Afterlands!  Design your own character to use as your player avatar, or let us include your pet as a 3D animation on the board, and augment the Afterlands with a little bit of YOUR reality!

Please see details of our rewards for all the information! 

 

                               

We understand that backing a crowdfunding campaign is not possible for everybody. To those who can contribute to our project, we thank you. To those who can’t, fear not!  You can still help us by spreading the word about Dragons of Afterlands, sharing our campaign page with those around you and making noise on social media.  You can even use the sharing tools on this page, it only take a couple clicks!

For a small start-up like ours, every little bit of support helps, and we are grateful to all of you for checking-out our page and the interest you show us, regardless of the form it takes!
column3: >From everybody at PWFL, thank you!

• UK - £10
• EU - £15
• USA - £20
• Canada - £20
• Australia - £20
• Most other countries - £20-£30

What is this game?!

All or One is a hidden role, social deduction card game. It could also be described as a tabletop escape room where the puzzle is not the room you find yourself trapped in but rather the people sharing the room with you, each of them a secret character as unique as yourself.

The game begins with the players waking to discover they have been abducted and imprisoned in an empty room, virtually exitless except for a trapdoor in the center of the floor with the words ""Feed Me"" scrawled upon it. A malevolent voice from an indeterminable source soon instructs the players that they must select one among themselves to be sacrificed in order for the others to be set free. A hidden timer begins counting down, and if the group can not reach an agreement before it expires, gas will flood the room, killing them all.

At its core, All or One is a game of conversation and compromise. The puzzle presented to the players lies hidden in the role cards, each a unique character with their own thematic motivations and goals
column2: as players work toward meeting their own victory conditions, they begin to share information, both through their choices of action and verbally, whether speaking honestly or otherwise, and a picture of potential outcomes begins to form. Players can strike bargains, make alliances, protect each other, betray each other, discover and reveal information about one another
column3: steal, injure, intimidate, coerce, possibly kill
column4: or perhaps assist, encourage, confide, maybe even discover a means of escape
column5:
or maybe just simply gang up on one poor soul if the majority so desires. Through purposefully freeform, emergent group dynamics, no two games of All or One will ever play out the same.

How far will you go to ensure you get out alive... if that's even the personal end goal you are trying to achieve.
column7:
showinfo=0"">
 

 

What are these add-on packs?

During our Kickstarter campaign, we offered two separate expanded content packs as add-ons.

The Community Content Pack is a Limited Edition pack, which will consist of five unique characters and five unique special items submitted by select Kickstarter backers. As submissions are still works in progress, we do not have character or item details to share at this time
column8:
however, rest assured that any and all submissions will be properly integrated into the existing game. Due to the limited nature of this pack, we may choose to cut off all Perks which contain this add-on at any time.

The Cat Pack is a Special Edition pack, which will consist of five unique characters based on the purrsonalities and likenesses of our own five cats. We hosted a ""Meet Our Cats"" live stream during our Kickstarter campaign, you can find the archived links in the collected videos section further down. As this pack is special edition, it will not be limited in any way.

As can be seen, as long as the limited CCP remains available, you can choose to add on both packs for a discounted price! Also, please note, the add-on packs will not increase your shipping charge above the flat rate for the base game (as detailed in the shipping section further down).

SPECIAL NOTE: For any Kickstarter backers who missed out on the add-on packs during the campaign and have come to this page specifically to pre-order them, a special backers-only update on Kickstarter will detail how to get the packs without the base game attached.

Our final art is not yet completed because we are in the midst of using select Kickstarter backers to literally model for our character art. Shown here is a sample of what that means and the style Sarah will be applying as the character artist:

Here's a static look at the potential and hidden cards for the mock Witch role. Because this character has not been included in the current iteration of the prototype, the icons and wording are loosely used just for example purposes

Base Game Components:

column1: • Two piece game box
• One deck of 21 potential character cards
• One deck of 21 hidden character cards
• One deck of 20 special item cards
• One deck of 12 mark cards
• One set of action reference cards
• Five 6-sided action dice
• 60 double-sided tokens
• One instruction booklet

How to Play:

For those already familiar with the game, or those who simply prefer information presented through video, feel free to skip ahead to the collected campaign videos and live streams presented in the next section.

Provided here is brief description of how to play along with some card samples. Whether before or after reading this section, we strongly suggest you watch either the How to Play video tutorial or the PAX West Demo which includes rules being explained to a live group who then are able to play out and enjoy their first game.

Please Note: All samples shown are prototype placeholder art and will be replaced with final art
column2:
the style and layout are also subject to change.

First, a set of ""Potential Role"" cards are dealt face up in the center of the table. These represent potential characters that any given player might hold and which would be in play within the room. The players themselves are only a subset of these potential roles.

These are just a small sample of the Potential Role cards. As you can see, they display a character name and two icons
column3: the icon on the upper left offers a hint at what that character's main victory condition or goal is, and the icon on the upper right offers a hint at that character's bonus score roll conditions -- what this means is at the end of the game, any players who have achieved their victory condition and then also fulfilled bonus roll conditions, get to roll a number of dice to score themselves
column4:
the player with the highest score is considered the true winner of the game.

This becomes more clear when you see the ""Hidden Role"" cards. Each player will receive two of these, allowing them to choose which role to play
column5:
some roles are much more challenging to play than others.

As you can see viewing the sample hidden role cards, they offer much more depth about the character, the victory condition, and the bonus roll objectives.

The players are also each dealt two ""Special Item"" cards from which they can choose one to bring into the room with them
column6:
typically they would want to choose one which compliments their selected character, provided they've been fortunate enough to have been dealt one.

The special items aim to be self explanatory and most are allowed to be willingly shared without requiring use. During the game, players can reveal, activate, trade, and/or steal items.

Finally, each player also receives one ""Mark"" card, which designates a player seated one or two seats to the left or right, but should not be interpreted as that player must die. The mark is only contextually relevant if the player's selected role or item card use the word Mark
column7:
if neither card says Mark, the mark card is meaningless, but all players must hold one.

As can be seen in the case of the Protector, the player seated two the left must actually be protected and survive in order for this player to win the game.

In addition to these hidden cards, players will each have access to Action Reference cards. These cards are color coded to match mental states which players will be increasing throughout the game: green is for Trust based actions, and red is for Aggression based actions. The actions are tiered, requiring increasing the given state to the level designated in order to unlock a specific action.

The game is split into and could last up to six rounds -- provided the players don't make choices or take actions which could end it earlier. At the beginning of the game and in between each round the players receive one double-sided mental state token
column8: everyone privately chooses which mental state to increase, reveals simultaneously, and the next round immediately begins. The tokens are not currency that is spent to attempt actions, rather they simply designate the level of each player's respective mental states and which state specific actions are available for that player to use. Each player is allowed one trust based action and one aggression based action per round
column9:
any actions not listed on the card are considered free actions and players may attempt as many of those as they wish.

Whenever a player attempts an action against another player who does not want that action to be successful, they each roll a six-sided action die against each other: highest roll wins, any ties go to a defending player.

The game ends in one of three ways: If a body is on the trap door -- quick reminder that the players are all trapped together in an exitless room except for a trap door in the center of the floor -- the moderator (or a player acting as moderator) will ask, ""Do all players who are able to speak agree to this sacrifice?"" If the answer is a unanimous ""Yes"" then the trap door opens and the game immediately ends
column10: if any player answers ""No"" the game continues. If the game timer expires on the last and final round, gas floods the room killing everyone inside and ending the game. Alternatively, at the bottom of the Trust based actions, there is one named Escape
column11:
if all players manage to escape the room, the game immediately ends, but if only some escape, then the game continues for any left behind.

Once the game has concluded, players reveal their hidden role and mark cards and discover who achieved their victory conditions and then who also earned bonus score rolls to determine the game's winner.

Again, we highly recommend you watch either the How to Play video tutorial (embedded in the following video section) or the archived PAX West Demo where you can hear the full instructions as explained to a live group and then witness a game play out.

Shipping:

Going into our original Kickstarter campaign, we announced we would be handling shipping ourselves
column10:
should this pre-order campaign put us outside of our ability to feasibly accomplish this, we will then seek out the aid of third party fulfillment.

Due to the uncertainty of shipping rates for a yet to be produced final product, we have made use of various estimation services to determine what we can reasonably expect them to be. This following shipping rates match what we offered Kickstarter backers, and will remain set for as long as we will be handling shipping ourselves.

US = $6
Canada = $12
Rest of the World = $22

Note that the add-on packs do not increase the shipping charge.

Also, please note, the add-on packs will not increase your shipping charge above the flat rate for the base game (as detailed in the shipping section further down).SPECIAL NOTE: For any Kickstarter backers who missed out on the add-on packs during the campaign and have come to this page specifically to pre-order them, a special backers-only update on Kickstarter will detail how to get the packs without the base game attached.  Final Character Art Sample:Our final art is not yet completed because we are in the midst of using select Kickstarter backers to literally model for our character art. Shown here is a sample of what that means and the style Sarah will be applying as the character artist: Image has been compressed to meet site upload requirements.Here's a static look at the potential and hidden cards for the mock Witch role. Because this character has not been included in the current iteration of the prototype, the icons and wording are loosely used just for example purposes
column16: however, this character will be refined and included in the final production copy of the game. Base Game Components:

column1: Two piece game box
One deck of 21 potential character cards
One deck of 21 hidden character cards
One deck of 20 special item cards
One deck of 12 mark cards
One set of action reference cards
Five 6-sided action dice
60 double-sided tokens
One instruction booklet

How to Play:For those already familiar with the game, or those who simply prefer information presented through video, feel free to skip ahead to the collected campaign videos and live streams presented in the next section.Provided here is brief description of how to play along with some card samples. Whether before or after reading this section, we strongly suggest you watch either the How to Play video tutorial or the PAX West Demo which includes rules being explained to a live group who then are able to play out and enjoy their first game.Please Note: All samples shown are prototype placeholder art and will be replaced with final art
column2: the style and layout are also subject to change.First, a set of ""Potential Role"" cards are dealt face up in the center of the table. These represent potential characters that any given player might hold and which would be in play within the room. The players themselves are only a subset of these potential roles.These are just a small sample of the Potential Role cards. As you can see, they display a character name and two icons
column3: the icon on the upper left offers a hint at what that character's main victory condition or goal is, and the icon on the upper right offers a hint at that character's bonus score roll conditions -- what this means is at the end of the game, any players who have achieved their victory condition and then also fulfilled bonus roll conditions, get to roll a number of dice to score themselves
column4: the player with the highest score is considered the true winner of the game.This becomes more clear when you see the ""Hidden Role"" cards. Each player will receive two of these, allowing them to choose which role to play
column5: some roles are much more challenging to play than others.As you can see viewing the sample hidden role cards, they offer much more depth about the character, the victory condition, and the bonus roll objectives.The players are also each dealt two ""Special Item"" cards from which they can choose one to bring into the room with them
column6: typically they would want to choose one which compliments their selected character, provided they've been fortunate enough to have been dealt one.The special items aim to be self explanatory and most are allowed to be willingly shared without requiring use. During the game, players can reveal, activate, trade, and/or steal items.Finally, each player also receives one ""Mark"" card, which designates a player seated one or two seats to the left or right, but should not be interpreted as that player must die. The mark is only contextually relevant if the player's selected role or item card use the word Mark
column7: if neither card says Mark, the mark card is meaningless, but all players must hold one.As can be seen in the case of the Protector, the player seated two the left must actually be protected and survive in order for this player to win the game.In addition to these hidden cards, players will each have access to Action Reference cards. These cards are color coded to match mental states which players will be increasing throughout the game: green is for Trust based actions, and red is for Aggression based actions. The actions are tiered, requiring increasing the given state to the level designated in order to unlock a specific action.The game is split into and could last up to six rounds -- provided the players don't make choices or take actions which could end it earlier. At the beginning of the game and in between each round the players receive one double-sided mental state token
column8: everyone privately chooses which mental state to increase, reveals simultaneously, and the next round immediately begins. The tokens are not currency that is spent to attempt actions, rather they simply designate the level of each player's respective mental states and which state specific actions are available for that player to use. Each player is allowed one trust based action and one aggression based action per round
column9: any actions not listed on the card are considered free actions and players may attempt as many of those as they wish.Whenever a player attempts an action against another player who does not want that action to be successful, they each roll a six-sided action die against each other: highest roll wins, any ties go to a defending player.The game ends in one of three ways: If a body is on the trap door -- quick reminder that the players are all trapped together in an exitless room except for a trap door in the center of the floor -- the moderator (or a player acting as moderator) will ask, ""Do all players who are able to speak agree to this sacrifice?"" If the answer is a unanimous ""Yes"" then the trap door opens and the game immediately ends
column10: if any player answers ""No"" the game continues. If the game timer expires on the last and final round, gas floods the room killing everyone inside and ending the game. Alternatively, at the bottom of the Trust based actions, there is one named Escape
column11: if all players manage to escape the room, the game immediately ends, but if only some escape, then the game continues for any left behind.Once the game has concluded, players reveal their hidden role and mark cards and discover who achieved their victory conditions and then who also earned bonus score rolls to determine the game's winner.Again, we highly recommend you watch either the How to Play video tutorial (embedded in the following video section) or the archived PAX West Demo where you can hear the full instructions as explained to a live group and then witness a game play out. Video & Live Streams:

column1: PAX West 2017 Demo Live Stream (includes player instruction)
Designer Q&A Live Stream (mentions elements of the Kickstarter campaign)
Game Night w/ Friends Live Stream (mostly game play only)
Meet Our Cats! and Meet Our Cats part 2 (non-game related)
One Last Chat (mostly prototype iteration & design discussion)

OMSI Mini Maker Faire Demo (game play only) Another OMSI Mini Maker Faire Demo (game play edited) How to Play (instructional tutorial) PAX West 2016 Game Play (final round snippet only)Please Note: This was from an earlier build of the prototype, some mechanics mentioned have since been altered. Shipping:Going into our original Kickstarter campaign, we announced we would be handling shipping ourselves
column2: should this pre-order campaign put us outside of our ability to feasibly accomplish this, we will then seek out the aid of third party fulfillment.Due to the uncertainty of shipping rates for a yet to be produced final product, we have made use of various estimation services to determine what we can reasonably expect them to be. This following shipping rates match what we offered Kickstarter backers, and will remain set for as long as we will be handling shipping ourselves.US = $6Canada = $12Rest of the World = $22Note that the add-on packs do not increase the shipping charge.",12.0,6,"1 Campaign

This project is already funded in Kickstarter, this is an in demand!
Randice is a dice system with eight dice that define alligment (chaothic evil, legal neutral, neutral bad...), race (between the D&
column2: D 3.0 races), gender, social class, worst and best skill (between the 6 in D&amp
column3: D) for  creating easy and quick random characters for tabletop rol games like Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, Discworld, Anima, etc.The general aesthetic of the dice, the packaging and all the extras are inspired by the old school Dungeons and Dragons logos, guidebooks and illustrations.

column1: This set is a lovely creation by two young goblins who studied product design, used to work as  illustrators and graphic design freelancers and also are dice collectors (uh, nerds.) They were talking about DnD and Discworld campaigns anecdotes  and suddenly and idea striked, what if dices could help us even more? how cool it would be if a dice could help us to create and define our characters? We already have different shapes (PolyHero awesome dice, anyone?), colors, textures and even glitter in our dice collections but we don't have any of that! Later we discovered a few business that made some amazing dice that will define aligment, race and social class for rpg characters but we wanted even more, a dice set that will create our full defined characters AND npcs ready to be played. Our product developer Carlos Rodas started setting the most definitory aspects about a character in a fantasy world and playing with drawings and shapes for the dice, our basics were alligment, race and gender, they need to be there. Later we decided that class and job is also a fun essential to limit the present and past of our character and for more fun we added best and worst skill. The Skill Duo is the most innovative and it will be the game changer in all the campaigns.

We want to make Randice come to life not only for us but for a loving and fun community, after the campaign and the delivery to our amazing backers we want to reach the market with an online shop and have deals with our local tabletop game stores here in Galicia, Spain. Also it woud be even more awesome to reach to other countries stores.
The dice set can be used altogether for creating a whole character or individually for specify only one characteristic. Each set includes 8 dices and a glossary:
Social class dice: with this two dices you will define the character place in society, economic situation and what they do for a living.
Race and gender dice: shows which race you have (between the D&
column2: D 3.0 races) and what is your gender as well including male, female, none and other for non-binary identities.

column1: The alligment dice: shows your possition in the D&
column2: D table of alignments (chaothic evil, legal neutral, neutral evil...)

column1: Worst and best skill dice: Which could be your worst and your best skill between the 6 in D&
Check the glossary below to see all the possibilities with Randice:
About the packaging

The packaging  design will vary between these two options depending on the amount of money collected. Our idea is make a blister, but if we haven't enought founds we will make the second option with a transparent plastic bag and cardboard.
Are Randice Balanced?
They are normal d6 so... Yes, they are! But at a 100%? We don't think so, we can't guarantee high precision and statistical clarity, that isn't our goal with Randice.
*UPDATE*
The Social Class dice duo is now redesigned to easy understanding, the final product look is in the glossary (we changed the arrows for a minus and a plus signs).
Also we deciden to change the two letter abbreviation for the three letter Dungeons and Dragons standard.

Do you want a complete definded character?  Grab the 8 dice in your hands and yeah, shake and roll! There you go, easy peasy, you have a complete character now. We tested this method with our best Dungeon Master and local artist Daniel Corrada Rodríguez, IG: @s_laighe (he loves the dice set!) and he created this awesome drawings with the results:
A very rich chaotic neutral elvish scammer with a lot of intelligence.
Lumberjack elf who was banished for murdering a dryad.
An exiled halfing king with a very good heart
You also can define individual characteristics by rolling the dice duo or the individual you want. With Randice you can create full NPCS, individual traits about them and reactions!

The shipping price is already set (sadly we can't do free shipping but all the prices are reasonable, please, understand that we ship all from Spain), we taked the final product and the final packaging and consulted our post office. If something happens (lost package or damages) you are going to be compensated, we will send you another package with no additional cost. WE DO WORLDWIDE SHIPPING.
(UNLOCKED!) As second goal if we get to 6.250€ (7.105$) we will upgrade the quality even more and we will be able to manufacture the moulds for Randice with solid colors and engraved sides.
We are a starting tabletop games company based en Galicia, Spain who loves fantasy, rol games, D&
column2: D and cool ideas to have fun. This is our second project with Kickstarter!

column1: We want to say thank you to our amazing beta testers:
Daniel Corrada, Iván Chapela, Anxo Piñeiro (Chuco), Anthony Álvarez (Tony), Iván Argibai, Juan José Vázquez, Marisa Troncoso and you, for your time and support.
And thank you to our best cameraman Martín Rodas.
Credits to www.freepik.com for the shipping box image and Peter Crowley's Fantasy Dream for the background music.

Treasures of Singapore is created by Lawrence and Li Fong, who are self-proclaimed Singapore cultural ambassadors. Both of us are always proud of what can be found within Singapore. For example, our delicious food  and The Changi Airport. And, we are usually not shy about promoting these treasures we have to our friends, far and near.

Treasures of Singapore is not the first project about Singapore that both Lawrence and Li Fong have worked on together. Our first one is The Nation Building Animation that we have produced together, supported by The SG50 Celebration Fund. With the support of many, it won the Best Animation Award in The Delhi Shorts International Film Festival 2015.
You see, most of us Singaporeans are unusually humble and do not go out in a loud and obnoxious way to show how proud we are of Singapore, even in the presence of our children.
For instance, when different parts of the world express their awe of our Changi airport and things that we have achieved, we may just click a “Like” button though we are extremely proud of it.

Hence, through this project, we want our younger generations to appreciate and remember that Singapore has a lot of treasures within, some of them we might have been taking for granted until we are far and away from our homes (when Li Fong is now residing in Texas while Lawrence is in China).

So, we have decided to work together again to develop a playing card set with illustrations of Singapore culture, integrated with an app, augmented reality (AR) and a traditional game component. These, in their own ways and in different occasions, can serve as a tool for us to tell our children more about Singapore and how hard it was for Singapore to achieve what it has today. It can also serve as a gift for our overseas friends who have visited Singapore or would like to know more about Singapore.
<h3>What We Need &amp
We have set a goal of USD4,560 for the followings which we hope you can give us your support:
<ol>
• Production of the cards and their packaging as well as the inclusion of 1 traditional game, that is, a chapteh in it.
• Development of interactive videos to be embedded as Augmented Reality (AR) in the cards using HP Reveal Augmented Reality Studio.
• Development of an app that consists of extensive information on Singapore, for children and families.
At the end of the campaign, we will start the above processes and you will receive:
<ul>
• The card set with the chapteh by March 2019.
• The instructions to view the embedded videos on the card set by March 2019.
• The app by May 2019
Impact

With this integrated card game, our children will know the significance of the treasures Singapore has in different ways. They will also be able to share proudly these treasures with their overseas peers and say, “We are from Singapore. This is where we belong. These are what we have!”
<h3>Risks &amp

As Lawrence and I are not residing in Singapore now, we may not be able to pack these orders and send them out personally to our contributors. However, we have good support in terms of logistics in Singapore to fulfil these orders. Nevertheless, we are only able to fulfil the orders to be delivered to Singapore and United States of America.
Other Ways You Can Help
If  for some reasons that you are not able to contribute, do help us to share the words around! This will help us greatly!

Spirits of the Scent Oracle card deck

In 2014 I embarked on my journey in aromatherapy training. I didn’t really know what to expect, I just enrolled myself in the course, listening to my instinct and following the flow of life as I have always done. Exceeding all my expectations the study of the essential oils brought me closer to Mother Nature and opened up my spirituality. I started looking deeper in the world of woo, getting into crystals, daily meditations with essential oils, connecting with my angel guides and animal spirits. Naturally, Tarot and Oracle decks became part of my daily practice. After a lot of trial and error, I realised that cards have a lot to offer on spiritual growth and understanding of the self.

I consider myself to be very lucky to get into the whole woo thing with my sister, Space Odetty, the illustrator of this amazing deck, as this world can be so lonely for some…  Together we studied the cards, give readings to each other and learning the ways of understanding this spiritual tool. Soon enough, I had a big collection of Tarot and Oracle cards, themed with angels, spirit animals, crystals, fairies, herbs and so on. Somewhere down the line, we came up with the idea of creating our very own essential oil deck, depicting the spirits of the essential oils. I would put my essential oil knowledge and Space Odetty her amazing artwork.

It took about two years for the deck to be completed, spending hours over Skype working on the cards (I live in UK and she lives in Greece). Throughout the process we could feel the magical impact of the cards in our lives as well as our relationship. With great love for what we do, and most importantly for each other, we managed to bring this project to life: 36 cards-36 essential oil spirits, to support emotional and spiritual transformation.
About Aromatherapy and essential oils

Aromatherapy is a complementary therapy that uses essential oils to promote and maintain the well-being of the body, mind and spirit. Essential oils can help with various ailments and physical problems, as well as emotional discomforts and energetic blockages. They are extracted from the blossoms, leaves, fruits, roots and wood of plants, including herbs, grasses, trees and flowers. The aromatic molecules enter the nose through special smell nerves, travel to our limbic system and regulate the nervous system and soothing the emotions. When applied topically, essential oils enter our body through the tiny blood vessels under the skin to offer their healing properties.
Chamomile Card Original painting
Roman Chamomile | 30x20cm | watercolour &

The gentle energy of Chamomile brings peace and calmness to the space, being a perfect addition to the bedroom. This unique and fabulous perk comes in a classy simple frame along with 1 deck of the Spirits of the Scent Oracle and a 3 card reading via email.
Legal Disclaimer

Spirits of the Scent Oracle is not a substitute for medical diagnosis and treatment. No medical claims are made regarding this deck and people with medical conditions should consult their doctor  and a qualified aromatherapist before using essential oils. We cannot give any guarantee as to the accuracy of the deck. You are responsible for your own actions and decisions.
<h3>Risks &amp

The project is already finished from our part, so any possible delays would be due to external causes, such as post, printer company, graphic design etc. We hope that all orders will be posted within two months after the end of the campaign.
Other Ways You Can Help
• We welcome any share and post of our campaign in your social media to spread the word!

The project is already finished from our part, so any possible delays would be due to external causes, such as post, printer company, graphic design etc. We hope that all orders will be posted within two months after the end of the campaign.
Other Ways You Can Help
We welcome any share and post of our campaign in your social media to spread the word!",8.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Surbiton, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/spirits-of-the-scent-oracle-deck/pica

0,"

Premium playing cards

         The first pack of playing cards from a series of 12 different identities designed and made as a jewel. Starting from an idea from childhood, that of having a unique package of playing cards, more special than the others, we have now made the first package made entirely of a metal alloy.

               Why alloy?

          From a young age I was attracted to the things with the soul, those things that keep your warm and touching. Choosing brass, copper, bronze and maple wood, elements with high density and strong transition, I managed to create a product with a soul.

               How did I manage to give it soul?

          Choosing my own vision, creating the design down to the smallest detail, choosing vibrant materials that make you feel touching, the whole mastery and passion of the artist who created it. The premium materials used offer a superior quality of finishes and processing and a very pleasant feeling to the touch.

          Each book is made of a brass sheet with a thickness of 0.3 mm, thus maintaining the feeling of naturalness, but also a good maneuverability for different schemes.

 

The story behind it

          I translated this idea into a collection of 12 editions, each with a different topic. The first collection, called Destiny, has as its central element the Yin-Yang emblem.

          I chose it as the first edition, because since I was little, being a more independent person, I tried to trace my destiny alone. Of course, life has reserved many obstacles for me, each of which has directed my life in a different direction. Seeing that with the passing of the years, my destiny was shaping in a completely different direction than the one I wanted, I finally managed to start shaping my true destiny. This is the significance of the two central elements, destiny and yin-yang.

          I hope that this pack of playing cards will symbolize the same thing for you and that you will believe again that no matter how many joys or troubles you will encounter, you can write the course of your destiny for yourself.

 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

          The project is in the final stage, that of being launched on the market. But for its mass production, we need external funds. All the money raised from the campaign will be used to support the investment in processing equipment, but also in raw materials. Being a premium product, all production materials are of the highest quality. 

          Let's see what you receive in exchange for your contribution!

         Each deck of playing cards contains 54 cards from a superior brass alloy. Each card has a different design, different from the classic playing cards. The cutout is made with laser, thus maintaining a perfect contour for each piece. The engraving is performed mechanically, with the help of a cnc machine. By mechanical engraving I wanted to obtain a special design, but also resistant in time, no matter how much you will play with these cards.

          We also wanted our product to be a top one. Thus, we continued the series of innovations, the 2 covers with 3D engravings that cover the package give a plus of style and elegance to each deck. By combining brass and copper alloys, we obtained a three-dimensional image of the logo, as well as the name of the first edition. 

          Front cover

         

          Back cover

          The fastening of the 2 covers is made with a twisted leather cord, creating an embossed design on the edge of the package.

 

 

          Continuing the series of innovations, we created the design of a truly magical brass bottle. With a fluid shape and copper inserts, each bottle will contain 10 ml of polishing solution.

          With the help of the 3 suede cloths you will be able to polish and restore each time the initial shine of the books, these remaining the same as at the beginning.

          But the most special innovation consists in the box made of maple wood and treated in a mahogany color. Each box is cut from a single block of maple, the outer and inner cuts being also made on a cnc machine. The finishes are made by hand for a superior fineness.

          The 2 lids are also made of the same material and are attached to the box by 2 special brass rivets, which allow them to rotate up to an angle of 270 degrees.

 

          

What is the item ""Reserve next edition"" ?

          Through this item you can be the first to receive the release date of the next edition of playing cards. Also, at the launch of the next campaign, you will receive the film with the creation of the new package of playing cards.

          A strong point when purchasing this item is that when you purchase the next package, you will be among the first to receive it.

 

What is the item ""Custom deck"" ?

          The customized package includes all the items that contain them and the standard package. The differences consist in:

column1: • custom logo after the buyer's name engraved on the back of each playing card
• custom logo after the buyer's name engraved on the two covers
• custom logo after the buyer's name engraved on a brass medallion embedded in front of the box
• custom logo after the buyer's name engraved on the polishing bottle
• two-tone leather cord for tying covers
• limited series engraving
• free reservation for the next edition

What bonus will the item ""10 decks of playing cards"" bring?

          By purchasing this item, you will receive, in addition to the corresponding discount, a free reservation for the next edition.

 

Why do we want to give life to this project?

          We can say that every child had a pack of playing cards at one point. Being among the first things that brought us with our childhood friends, we are currently trying to bring back those beautiful moments.

 

A difficult project? Yes, but beautiful.

          Being a premium product, the attempts to make it were difficult. From choosing the best alloy to meet several conditions: clarity, touch feel, processing but also making drawings by mechanical engraving, all required a lot of testing.

          Finally we managed to create a product that meets all our expectations. From new, unique and beauty to which I transposed it to this product, you will find in it a gift for you but also for those close to you.

 

You can help make this dream come true

          You can also help us make this project a reality by promoting it on various social platforms. A simple share can mean for us a step closer to realization.

                          With appreciation,

                                          the leader of the Destiny team!

Short Summary

Hello, I am Amy Holzeard and when I was 13, I picked up role-playing dice for the first time and since then all I've wanted to do was to have a place where people who also love gaming can gather to enjoy our games and each other company. For year I have used my home to accomplish this but that limits the amount of people and what we can do.

What I intend to do is open a premier gaming establishment her on Indianapolis's south side. A place where there's plenty or room (both public and private) a large selection of games (to play and buy) and plenty of snacks.

One way or another we will be opening, what I need your help to do is to make out game library bigger,  increase the stock we have in store and if we're lucky increase the overall size of the store! So we can have even more space for the local community!

To make this dream a reality we will need about $25,000 the good news is: We can cover most of it. All we need from this campaign is $10,000. If manage to get more than that it will make the whole process easier and allow us to put more in the game room.
If we unfortunately don't make it to the $10,000 any money that we do raise will go to the store getting what ever we can to make it the bast gaming place we can.

Remember no matter who you are you can help us out by getting this out into the world. Even if your normally not in Indianapolis, you can still share this with any gamers you know because we will have special events during Gen-Con and all the other cons The we host here in the Hoosier State.  So please share with everyone one you can. You never know who might be part of the community or may want to join our community!

<h3 style=""text-align: center

Escape from Darkmoor Keep (EFDK) is the second title in the Legorian Kings Saga, with the first being Labyrinth: The Lich Lord's Lair. A multi-quest gamebook written in the style of the Choose Your Own Adventure and Fighting Fantasy gamebooks, YOU (and/or your party, if you are playing with multiple players) determine the outcome of the story by the choices that you make! In fact, sometimes, your very fate(s) will even depend on the roll of the dice themselves!

The second title in the Legorian Kings Saga finds you, the adventurer, trapped on the mysterious and savage island of Darkmoor Keep with no memory or knowledge of how you got there, or even why. But can you survive long enough to solve the mystery, or will you become just another one of the island's many casualties?
EndGame Gaming is also excited to announce that fantasy artist, Ilya Shkipin, will be returning to do the artwork for EFDK. These are samples of the incredible work he did for our first gamebook.

You awaken with a start, still lost in the lingering haze from a restless and tormented sleep. As your eyes gradually adjust to the dim light of your surroundings, you realize that you are in a strange and unfamiliar place. A quick surveil of your environment tells you everything in an instant. You are in what appears to be some sort of holding cell, a prisoner no doubt within the dark and dank confines of some unknown dungeon. Rough-hewn brick and mortar-daubed walls greet you on all sides, and other than the one single, wooden door with a small barred window at eye-level, there is no other means in, or out of your place of confinement.
Even more disturbing are the nagging questions now flooding your mind. ‘How did you get here?’ And, ‘Where exactly is HERE?’

Groggy and still somewhat disoriented, you make your way over to the door, and much to your surprise, find that it is ajar. The door groans reluctantly as you swing it open upon its rusty hinges, and step out into corridor beyond.

You find yourself in a wide corridor, its entire length lined on both sides with the very same holding cells like the one you awoke in. Your first instinctive reaction is to be on the lookout for the inevitable arrival of the guards, for most certainly they must have heard your cell door opening. But even after an indefinite amount of time has passed, no one comes, and except for the flickering of the torches and the occasional squeaky chatter of the rats, the dungeon hall is as silent as a tomb. A few randomly-placed torches throughout dispel the darkness.
A cursory scan of your surroundings helps you to quickly determine your next move, with you immediately making for the flight of stairs at the far end, and heading up them.

The stairway spirals upward, terminating at a large wooden door. Placing your ear to the wood, you listen closely, but are unable to hear anything through the heavy, oaken panel. Quietly and cautiously, you open the door, but only just wide enough to see what lies beyond.

A dimly lit chamber greets you on the other side, and other than a large wooden chest in one of the corners, the room is completely empty. There is another door directly opposite of you on the far facing wall.

Making your way to the chest, you discover that it is unlocked, and carefully raise the lid, knowing full well that there might be traps. You are astonished by what you find, for inside of the chest, is an incredible assortment of weapons, and with the only exception being the mage’s staff, every one of them has been forged out of silver.

(From the list below, and based on the CHARACTER CLASS that you elected at the start of the game, you must now choose your weapon. If you chose to be a WARRIOR, you must select ONE of the melee weapons below. If, however, the CHARACTER CLASS you chose to be was a mage, your weapons by default will automatically be the mage’s staff and the silver dagger. The shield may be used in conjunction with any of the one-handed weapons.
You do have the option to change your CHARACTER CLASS now, if you would like to do so.
SILVER TWO-HANDED BROADSWORD
SILVER TWO-HANDED BATTLE AXE
SILVER TWO-HANDED MACE
SILVER ONE-HANDED SWORD
SILVER ONE-HANDED BATTLE AXE
SILVER ONE-HANDED MACE
SILVER DAGGER
SHIELD
MAGE’S STAFF
The chest also contains several TORCHES and a SATCHEL (which from here on out, will represent your INVENTORY(s).
Add the weapon(s) you chose, as well as the torch, to your INVENTORY(s) now).
After arming yourself, and listening for a brief moment at the other door, you cautiously open the door and exit the chamber.
Go to 66
66

The door introduces you to a long and narrow corridor, which eventually finds its end at yet another door, this one much larger than the previous two. With your weapon in hand and ready for whatever might await you on the other side, you open the door.
Dazzling sunlight immediately floods in, and for more than a moment, you are temporarily blinded by the unexpected, and sudden brightness, as you step through the open doorway and outside.

You are standing on a massive shelf of rock that juts out from the precipitous face of a cliff. Below you, gigantic waves crash violently and relentlessly against its rocky base, with the thundering impact of the pounding surf punctuated only by the stuttering squawks of seagulls.

Doing a quick visual scan of the jagged cliff’s exterior, you discover what appear to be hand and footholds carved into the cliffside, starting right where you are standing, and going all the way to the very top.
To your right, you can see a pathway that precariously hugs the precipice as it descends, gradually making its way down the side of the cliff until it reaches a sand-covered beach at the very bottom.

On your immediate left, and disappearing over the edge of the shelf of rock on which you are standing, is a crude ladder constructed out of rope and driftwood. Peering downward, you see another outcropping of rock a short distance below, and what looks like the entrance to a small cave.
If you decide to try and scale the cliff face, go to 172
If you want to head down the path, go to 27
Maybe the rope ladder is the safest bet. If this is your choice, go to 111
And so begins the next chapter of the Legorian Kings Saga!
PLAYING WITH MULTIPLE PLAYERS

Not only can this gamebook be played as a single-player, solo adventure, but it can also be modified to create a multiplayer co-op experience for up to 4 PLAYERS for you and your friends. This especially comes into play when facing an opponent. In order to make these encounters more challenging for you and your party, you may be asked at times to INCREASE the NUMBER OF OPPONENTS you are fighting to accommodate the number of members in your party. In other instances, you may be told to INCREASE the HEALTH score(s) of your opponent(s).

In addition, when doing a co-op, unless otherwise specified, whatever items you and your fellow adventurers may discover during your quest are MULTIPLIED as well by the NUMBER OF PLAYERS in your party. Each one of you can then add these items to your own individual inventories.
Items in your INVENTORY(s), including potions and even gold pieces, may also be given to your teammates, but must be removed from your INVENTORY(s) when you do so.
COMBAT
The combat in this RPG fantasy adventure gamebook is a TURN-BASED, DICE ROLL system.
WHO ATTACKS FIRST?

Who attacks first, whether it is you and your partner(s), or your opponent(s), can be based on a number of factors. For example, in some scenarios, if you surprise your opponent, then by default, you would get to attack first, and vice versa, the same would apply if a monster gets the jump on you. There may also be instances where you perform a sneak attack. Otherwise, in most cases, you will have to roll to see who will be attacking first. To determine who, roll ONE die for you (and your party), and then roll ONE die for your opponent(s). The person/party that has the highest roll gets to attack first.
THE BATTLE MECHANICS
(The 3d6 attack, defense, and damage roll system)

If you are the one attacking, roll ALL THREE dice for your attack and then ALL THREE dice for your opponent. If you are doing a co-op, each one of you, in turn, gets an attack roll. If your roll is the HIGHER of the two, then your attack is successful. If your opponent’s roll is EQUAL TO or HIGHER than your roll, your attack either missed, or was deflected by your opponent. If your attack is successful, roll ALL THREE dice to determine the AMOUNT OF DAMAGE that was inflicted by your attack, and subtract that amount from your opponent’s HEALTH score. If you are doing a co-op, each member of your party, in turn, also get an attack roll, and your opponent(s) must counter roll to defend against each one of those attack(s). You can keep a tally of that damage on a separate sheet of paper.

The sequence of combat is exactly the same when your opponent is attacking you. Roll ALL THREE dice for your opponent(s)’ attack and then roll all THREE dice for your defense roll(s). If you are doing a co-op, each one of you individually will have to do defense rolls and roll individually for damage.
Typical COMBAT encounters will look something like this:
ROUND 1
YOU:  Roll an attack roll of 5+5+4 for a three dice total of 14
ORC:  Rolls a defensive roll of 6+3+3 for a three dice total of 12

(Because your attack roll of 14 is GREATER than the orc’s defensive counter roll of 12, your attack is successful! All three dice are then rolled to determine how much DAMAGE was inflicted by your attack, and is then SUBTRACTED from the orc’s HEALTH score)
ROUND 2
ORC:  Rolls an attack roll of 3+5+3 for a three dice total of 11
YOU:  Roll a defensive roll of 6+2+3 for a three dice total of 11
(Because your defensive roll was EQUAL to the attack roll of the orc, the orc’s attack either missed or was successfully deflected by you, so no damage was taken by you this round).
MULTIPLE PLAYERS VERSUS MULTIPLE OPPONENTS
YOU:  Roll a 3d6 attack roll
PARTY MEMBER: Rolls a 3d6 attack roll
PARTY MEMBER: Rolls a 3d6 attack roll
GOBLINOIDS: Roll a 3d6 defense roll as a SINGLE opponent
Combat continues until you and your party, or the opposing side are eliminated!
MULTIPLE OPPONENTS
Multiple opponents are treated as a SINGLE MONSTER, and only get one attack roll because in real-life scenarios they would attack simultaneously. They also defend as ONE with a SINGLE roll.
MULTIPLAYER ATTACK AND DEFENSE ROLLS

When doing a multiplayer co-op, when it is your turn to attack, each player in your party gets an individual attack roll, but your opponent(s) roll a SINGLE defensive roll against each one of those attacks. The same holds true if your party is being attacked. Your opponent(s) roll a SINGLE attack roll, but each member in your party gets to do a counter roll.

Both the paperback and hardback editions of the book will be approximately 6"" x 9"" and will be between 250 and 300 pages in total length, depending on the final number of illustrations. The book will have a total of 30 black-and-white interior illustrations, with more to be added if the Stretch Goal is unlocked. Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon.
Rewards include:
digital wallpaper featuring exclusive art by fantasy artist, Ilya Shkipin, from Escape from Darkmoor Keep
PDFs of both Labyrinth: The Lich Lord's Lair and Escape from Darkmoor Keep
signed copies of the EFDK paperback, and signed copies of both the original and new cover editions of our first gamebook, Labyrinth: The Lich Lord's Lair*
four exclusive bookmarks featuring exclusive art from EFDK
a SET OF SIX EndGame Gaming custom dice (one set of 3 HERO dice and one set of 3 ENEMY dice)
signed limited-edition, hardback copies of Escape from Darkmoor Keep
and finally, limited-edition artwork by Ilya Shkipin that WILL NOT be in the book, or featured anywhere else, including promotional use!

* Both EFDK and Labyrinth will have brand new cover designs where Ilya's artwork is featured more prominently on each one on both the front and back of both books' covers! Both covers have been posted below.
All rewards will be shipped from our base of operations in beautiful Colorado Springs, CO in the United States.
Thank you in advance for your support!
Be sure to join our Facebook group to stay up-to-speed on all things Savage Realms:
Savage Realms Multi-Quest Gamebooks
https://www.facebook.com/groups/240797886828681/
Follow us on Twitter: Savage Realms Gamebooks @SGamebooks
And on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gamebook_adventures/
Please message us with any feedback, questions, or concerns at: endgamegamingcompany@gmail.com or savagerealmsgamebooks@gmail.com
