You find yourself in a wide corridor, its entire length lined on both sides with the very same holding cells like the one you awoke in. Your first instinctive reaction is to be on the lookout for the inevitable arrival of the guards, for most certainly they must have heard your cell door opening. But even after an indefinite amount of time has passed, no one comes, and except for the flickering of the torches and the occasional squeaky chatter of the rats, the dungeon hall is as silent as a tomb. A few randomly-placed torches throughout dispel the darkness.
A cursory scan of your surroundings helps you to quickly determine your next move, with you immediately making for the flight of stairs at the far end, and heading up them.

The stairway spirals upward, terminating at a large wooden door. Placing your ear to the wood, you listen closely, but are unable to hear anything through the heavy, oaken panel. Quietly and cautiously, you open the door, but only just wide enough to see what lies beyond.

A dimly lit chamber greets you on the other side, and other than a large wooden chest in one of the corners, the room is completely empty. There is another door directly opposite of you on the far facing wall.

Making your way to the chest, you discover that it is unlocked, and carefully raise the lid, knowing full well that there might be traps. You are astonished by what you find, for inside of the chest, is an incredible assortment of weapons, and with the only exception being the mage’s staff, every one of them has been forged out of silver.

(From the list below, and based on the CHARACTER CLASS that you elected at the start of the game, you must now choose your weapon. If you chose to be a WARRIOR, you must select ONE of the melee weapons below. If, however, the CHARACTER CLASS you chose to be was a mage, your weapons by default will automatically be the mage’s staff and the silver dagger. The shield may be used in conjunction with any of the one-handed weapons.
You do have the option to change your CHARACTER CLASS now, if you would like to do so.
SILVER TWO-HANDED BROADSWORD
SILVER TWO-HANDED BATTLE AXE
SILVER TWO-HANDED MACE
SILVER ONE-HANDED SWORD
SILVER ONE-HANDED BATTLE AXE
SILVER ONE-HANDED MACE
SILVER DAGGER
SHIELD
MAGE’S STAFF
The chest also contains several TORCHES and a SATCHEL (which from here on out, will represent your INVENTORY(s).
Add the weapon(s) you chose, as well as the torch, to your INVENTORY(s) now).
After arming yourself, and listening for a brief moment at the other door, you cautiously open the door and exit the chamber.
Go to 66

The door introduces you to a long and narrow corridor, which eventually finds its end at yet another door, this one much larger than the previous two. With your weapon in hand and ready for whatever might await you on the other side, you open the door.
Dazzling sunlight immediately floods in, and for more than a moment, you are temporarily blinded by the unexpected, and sudden brightness, as you step through the open doorway and outside.

You are standing on a massive shelf of rock that juts out from the precipitous face of a cliff. Below you, gigantic waves crash violently and relentlessly against its rocky base, with the thundering impact of the pounding surf punctuated only by the stuttering squawks of seagulls.

Doing a quick visual scan of the jagged cliff’s exterior, you discover what appear to be hand and footholds carved into the cliffside, starting right where you are standing, and going all the way to the very top.
To your right, you can see a pathway that precariously hugs the precipice as it descends, gradually making its way down the side of the cliff until it reaches a sand-covered beach at the very bottom.

On your immediate left, and disappearing over the edge of the shelf of rock on which you are standing, is a crude ladder constructed out of rope and driftwood. Peering downward, you see another outcropping of rock a short distance below, and what looks like the entrance to a small cave.
If you decide to try and scale the cliff face, go to 172
If you want to head down the path, go to 27
Maybe the rope ladder is the safest bet. If this is your choice, go to 111
And so begins the next chapter of the Legorian Kings Saga!
PLAYING WITH MULTIPLE PLAYERS

Not only can this gamebook be played as a single-player, solo adventure, but it can also be modified to create a multiplayer co-op experience for up to 4 PLAYERS for you and your friends. This especially comes into play when facing an opponent. In order to make these encounters more challenging for you and your party, you may be asked at times to INCREASE the NUMBER OF OPPONENTS you are fighting to accommodate the number of members in your party. In other instances, you may be told to INCREASE the HEALTH score(s) of your opponent(s).

In addition, when doing a co-op, unless otherwise specified, whatever items you and your fellow adventurers may discover during your quest are MULTIPLIED as well by the NUMBER OF PLAYERS in your party. Each one of you can then add these items to your own individual inventories.
Items in your INVENTORY(s), including potions and even gold pieces, may also be given to your teammates, but must be removed from your INVENTORY(s) when you do so.
COMBAT
The combat in this RPG fantasy adventure gamebook is a TURN-BASED, DICE ROLL system.
WHO ATTACKS FIRST?

Who attacks first, whether it is you and your partner(s), or your opponent(s), can be based on a number of factors. For example, in some scenarios, if you surprise your opponent, then by default, you would get to attack first, and vice versa, the same would apply if a monster gets the jump on you. There may also be instances where you perform a sneak attack. Otherwise, in most cases, you will have to roll to see who will be attacking first. To determine who, roll ONE die for you (and your party), and then roll ONE die for your opponent(s). The person/party that has the highest roll gets to attack first.
THE BATTLE MECHANICS
(The 3d6 attack, defense, and damage roll system)

If you are the one attacking, roll ALL THREE dice for your attack and then ALL THREE dice for your opponent. If you are doing a co-op, each one of you, in turn, gets an attack roll. If your roll is the HIGHER of the two, then your attack is successful. If your opponent’s roll is EQUAL TO or HIGHER than your roll, your attack either missed, or was deflected by your opponent. If your attack is successful, roll ALL THREE dice to determine the AMOUNT OF DAMAGE that was inflicted by your attack, and subtract that amount from your opponent’s HEALTH score. If you are doing a co-op, each member of your party, in turn, also get an attack roll, and your opponent(s) must counter roll to defend against each one of those attack(s). You can keep a tally of that damage on a separate sheet of paper.

The sequence of combat is exactly the same when your opponent is attacking you. Roll ALL THREE dice for your opponent(s)’ attack and then roll all THREE dice for your defense roll(s). If you are doing a co-op, each one of you individually will have to do defense rolls and roll individually for damage.
Typical COMBAT encounters will look something like this:
ROUND 1
YOU:  Roll an attack roll of 5+5+4 for a three dice total of 14
ORC:  Rolls a defensive roll of 6+3+3 for a three dice total of 12

(Because your attack roll of 14 is GREATER than the orc’s defensive counter roll of 12, your attack is successful! All three dice are then rolled to determine how much DAMAGE was inflicted by your attack, and is then SUBTRACTED from the orc’s HEALTH score)
ROUND 2
ORC:  Rolls an attack roll of 3+5+3 for a three dice total of 11
YOU:  Roll a defensive roll of 6+2+3 for a three dice total of 11
(Because your defensive roll was EQUAL to the attack roll of the orc, the orc’s attack either missed or was successfully deflected by you, so no damage was taken by you this round).
MULTIPLE PLAYERS VERSUS MULTIPLE OPPONENTS
YOU:  Roll a 3d6 attack roll
PARTY MEMBER: Rolls a 3d6 attack roll
PARTY MEMBER: Rolls a 3d6 attack roll
GOBLINOIDS: Roll a 3d6 defense roll as a SINGLE opponent
Combat continues until you and your party, or the opposing side are eliminated!
MULTIPLE OPPONENTS
Multiple opponents are treated as a SINGLE MONSTER, and only get one attack roll because in real-life scenarios they would attack simultaneously. They also defend as ONE with a SINGLE roll.
MULTIPLAYER ATTACK AND DEFENSE ROLLS

When doing a multiplayer co-op, when it is your turn to attack, each player in your party gets an individual attack roll, but your opponent(s) roll a SINGLE defensive roll against each one of those attacks. The same holds true if your party is being attacked. Your opponent(s) roll a SINGLE attack roll, but each member in your party gets to do a counter roll.

Both the paperback and hardback editions of the book will be approximately 6"" x 9"" and will be between 250 and 300 pages in total length, depending on the final number of illustrations. The book will have a total of 30 black-and-white interior illustrations, with more to be added if the Stretch Goal is unlocked. Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon.
Rewards include:
digital wallpaper featuring exclusive art by fantasy artist, Ilya Shkipin, from Escape from Darkmoor Keep
PDFs of both Labyrinth: The Lich Lord's Lair and Escape from Darkmoor Keep
signed copies of the EFDK paperback, and signed copies of both the original and new cover editions of our first gamebook, Labyrinth: The Lich Lord's Lair*
four exclusive bookmarks featuring exclusive art from EFDK
a SET OF SIX EndGame Gaming custom dice (one set of 3 HERO dice and one set of 3 ENEMY dice)
signed limited-edition, hardback copies of Escape from Darkmoor Keep
and finally, limited-edition artwork by Ilya Shkipin that WILL NOT be in the book, or featured anywhere else, including promotional use!

* Both EFDK and Labyrinth will have brand new cover designs where Ilya's artwork is featured more prominently on each one on both the front and back of both books' covers! Both covers have been posted below.
All rewards will be shipped from our base of operations in beautiful Colorado Springs, CO in the United States.
Thank you in advance for your support!

The Legends Card Game: A Fun Way For Kids To Learn

Dear Friend,

Let's face it, teaching children can be difficult. In this age of Social Media, YouTube and Online Gaming, it can be almost impossible to separate kids from their screens. Wouldn't it be nice if there was a way that children could have fun AND learn at the same time?

Sounds like a dream? It’s actually a reality.

Our team of eight created the Legends Card Game, which teaches children (or teenagers) about history as they play. They’ll learn about history's greatest scientists, artists, and other historical figures, all while focused and engaged in friendly competition. It is our hope that by exposing kids to the greatest people from humanity's past, they may find inspiration. After all, children are the future.

Here’s the good news.

For only $19, you can have your own set.

The Legends Card Game is seeking your support so we can spread our game onto the global market. With your help, we can make our dream a reality. Thank you for your support!

Children Learn Best When Having Fun

The Legends Card game is the world’s only game which gives your children an in-depth history lesson as they play along. You can play with family, friends or even at school.

Here Are The Benefits Of Playing The Legends Card Game:
• Develop memory and information retention skills.
• Playing games helps develop focusing skills.
• Have fun while developing social skills (something that is sometimes lost in our online world).

column2:
>And much, much more!

Parents and Educators: when you invest in a copy of our game, you are not just providing you children years of entertainment - you're also investing in their future.

It’s our mission to change education forever. Let's do it together!

RULE BOOK

column1: • Open the game and select 5 of the 10 categories of cards. Take all of each category and shuffle them together. (This means to grab all character and info cards in a category and shuffle them together.)

• There are four different types of card decks used in the game. Character cards are cards that hold the image of a certain famous person. Info cards are a matching type of card for each famous person that gives in-depth info. These are used to make a pair. When a character and info card are paired together, it’s considered a match! You may then place them on the play pile and collect a matching coin token as a reward. Scissor cards are special cards that allow you to steal a player’s match reward--provided you use them properly. Finally, Legend cards are a special type of card with unique use.
<li><span style='font-family: ""Benton Sans"", Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: '>As mentioned shuffle these five categories of Character/Info cards together, then deal each player 6 cards from the shuffled deck.

column1: Place the remaining cards in the center of the table. These cards can be pulled from at your leisure -- or switched out in order to make proper matches as you play.
• The dealer goes first in a clockwise direction. Each player’s goal is to eliminate all of the cards in your hand. This is done by matching an info card with a Character card.
• To do this, you can draw from the deck. In addition to this, you may also grab from the last 2 cards placed on the table by any other player.
• You can hold any number of cards, however since your goal is to get rid of cards you want to focus on matches, using legend cards or steals to get rid of the cars in your hand.
•  When you’ve emptied your hands of cards, place your final match on the table and say “Eureka”! This will signal the end of the game.
• Once a player at the table has shouted “Eureka” and placed their cards down, that player may draw 2 additional coin cards
• If no other players have scissor cards to play, then the sum each player’s coin cards are tallied. The player with the highest coin card count wins the game.

• On the chance that another player uses a Scissor card then -- a played Scissor Card at the game’s end allows you to postpone the ending of the game by forcing up to 2 cards of your choice from your own hand on the player who initiated the game’s end. If a scissor card is played against another player after they say “Eureka” a couple of things happen:
• a)They may NOT collect 2 coin cards.
• b)Doing this will cause the game to begin again with the next person in the turn order.
The player with the highest coin count wins the game.
column2:
>Using Special Cards:)

Scissor Cards:

Scissor cards cannot be traded between players and there exists 3 cards of this type in the whole game. Using one will allow you to steal coin rewards from another player’s match. In addition, you also can place up to 2 of your cards down (any two of your choosing).

If you manage to collect more than one scissor card at a time (very hard to do!) you can perform special actions!

You may play multiple scissor cards at one time. This means, for instance, if you play 2 cards against one player you can collect card rewards twice, and get rid of 4 cards at once 

Likewise, if you have at least 2 cards you can sacrifice both cards at the same time in order to collect coin rewards. This can be done at any time with no requirements to fulfill.  For each card you sacrifice in this manner you can draw 2 coin tokens.

There is a restriction to using Scissor Cards, there are symbols on each card that match the categories of cards. You must match the symbols in order to play a card against another player.
column3: >To play a scissor card, shout “Cut!” and place the card down before they can collect their coin token!

column1: • Legend Cards are special cards that can match up with ANY Character or Info card. So for example, if you have 1 card remaining in your hand, and you draw a Legend card, you can immediately pair it in order to form a match and initiate the end of the game as an example.
• Another benefit of a Legend card is that matches made with them cannot have Scissors played against them.
Challenges:)

• Challenging a player involves betting 1 or more of your coins. When you challenge someone you place up to 5 (and no less than 1) coin face down in front of you and point to the player you’re challenging.
• The challenged player HAS to respond. If they refuse your challenge, you get to choose 1 of their coins (your choice).

• If they accept your challenge then that player also has to decide on up to 3 coins to wager, then both of you draw a card from the center and place it face down in front of you. At the same time, both of you flip the card. If either of you can match the other person’s card--that person wins the challenge, at which point they take all their coins, all of the coins of the player you challenged and you get to get rid of one extra card in your hand without fulfilling the match condition.
• If you find yourself with 0 cards in your hand after completing a challenge, yell Eureka to initiate the game’s end.

column3: >55 Clue Cards

column5: >3 Scissor Cards

>One Instruction Manual

 

Risks and challenges

This is our second Campaign, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to making a physical product, such as production delays, shipping delays, customs delays.

The estimated delivery date is April 2019, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Our Website:

https://pepalworks.wixsite.com/thelegends

Thank You For Supporting The Legends Card Game!

Every donation helps us bring Legends to the worldwide marketplace. We want to enhance the way children learn, starting at an early age.

Children learn best while they are having fun. Your contributions directly contribute to our vision of helping children around the world.

Thank you for your generosity.

Until Next Time,

The Legends Card Game Team

P.S. If your child is old enough to read, they’re old enough to learn history while playing the Legends Card Game!

Open the game and select 5 of the 10 categories of cards. Take all of each category and shuffle them together. (This means to grab all character and info cards in a category and shuffle them together.)

There are four different types of card decks used in the game. Character cards are cards that hold the image of a certain famous person. Info cards are a matching type of card for each famous person that gives in-depth info. These are used to make a pair. When a character and info card are paired together, it’s considered a match! You may then place them on the play pile and collect a matching coin token as a reward. Scissor cards are special cards that allow you to steal a player’s match reward--provided you use them properly. Finally, Legend cards are a special type of card with unique use.
As mentioned shuffle these five categories of Character/Info cards together, then deal each player 6 cards from the shuffled deck.
Place the remaining cards in the center of the table. These cards can be pulled from at your leisure -- or switched out in order to make proper matches as you play.
The dealer goes first in a clockwise direction. Each player’s goal is to eliminate all of the cards in your hand. This is done by matching an info card with a Character card.
To do this, you can draw from the deck. In addition to this, you may also grab from the last 2 cards placed on the table by any other player.
You can hold any number of cards, however since your goal is to get rid of cards you want to focus on matches, using legend cards or steals to get rid of the cars in your hand.
When you’ve emptied your hands of cards, place your final match on the table and say “Eureka”! This will signal the end of the game.
How To Win:)
Once a player at the table has shouted “Eureka” and placed their cards down, that player may draw 2 additional coin cards
If no other players have scissor cards to play, then the sum each player’s coin cards are tallied. The player with the highest coin card count wins the game.

On the chance that another player uses a Scissor card then -- a played Scissor Card at the game’s end allows you to postpone the ending of the game by forcing up to 2 cards of your choice from your own hand on the player who initiated the game’s end. If a scissor card is played against another player after they say “Eureka” a couple of things happen:
a)They may NOT collect 2 coin cards.
b)Doing this will cause the game to begin again with the next person in the turn order.

The player with the highest coin count wins the game.Using Special Cards:)Scissor Cards:Scissor cards cannot be traded between players and there exists 3 cards of this type in the whole game. Using one will allow you to steal coin rewards from another player’s match. In addition, you also can place up to 2 of your cards down (any two of your choosing).If you manage to collect more than one scissor card at a time (very hard to do!) you can perform special actions!You may play multiple scissor cards at one time. This means, for instance, if you play 2 cards against one player you can collect card rewards twice, and get rid of 4 cards at once Likewise, if you have at least 2 cards you can sacrifice both cards at the same time in order to collect coin rewards. This can be done at any time with no requirements to fulfill.  For each card you sacrifice in this manner you can draw 2 coin tokens.There is a restriction to using Scissor Cards, there are symbols on each card that match the categories of cards. You must match the symbols in order to play a card against another player.To play a scissor card, shout “Cut!” and place the card down before they can collect their coin token!Legends Cards:)

Legend Cards are special cards that can match up with ANY Character or Info card. So for example, if you have 1 card remaining in your hand, and you draw a Legend card, you can immediately pair it in order to form a match and initiate the end of the game as an example.
Another benefit of a Legend card is that matches made with them cannot have Scissors played against them.
Challenges:)

Challenging a player involves betting 1 or more of your coins. When you challenge someone you place up to 5 (and no less than 1) coin face down in front of you and point to the player you’re challenging.
The challenged player HAS to respond. If they refuse your challenge, you get to choose 1 of their coins (your choice).

If they accept your challenge then that player also has to decide on up to 3 coins to wager, then both of you draw a card from the center and place it face down in front of you. At the same time, both of you flip the card. If either of you can match the other person’s card--that person wins the challenge, at which point they take all their coins, all of the coins of the player you challenged and you get to get rid of one extra card in your hand without fulfilling the match condition.
If you find yourself with 0 cards in your hand after completing a challenge, yell Eureka to initiate the game’s end.

ABOUT THE MODELS:

Ive designed the models based on my experience creating stl files for 3d printing and the work I maintained with a close friend of mine

These Pieces would fit any table of Gaslands - Warhammer 40k - Fallout - Warmachine - Malifaux

here you can follow a link to check the quality of the models

https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/stl-samples-1-a...

https://sketchfab.com/models/34108f9c3cef4dad9f...

Models list:

-7 kinds of barricades 2 of them modular that can be used as trench

-5 pipes pieces

-6 tire wall pieces

-3 barrel objects

-2 boxes 

-2 gas cylinders types

-1 large power capacitor

-6 types of modular wall

-2 types of tunnel hallway roof

-3 modular roof pieces

-3 types of floor

-1 floor support

-1 stairs module

-1 engine crane

-1 fuel pump

-1 concrete block

-1 anti tank barricade

-1 door module with removable door

-3 types of auto turret

-1 auto turret base

-1 large power battery

-1 large gas container

-1 flag pole

-1 marking pole

-1 old shack

-1 large container unit

The math might not add up but some models are in 2 pieces. 

 

 

 

REWARDS:

I have stablished a reward system asside from the paid perks 

there are social stretchgoals, for every stretchgoal on the social area that is met, you will unlock a model that will be available for free to everyone, this models will be unique and not belong to the base STL files set.

each unlocked social goal will release a link that will be posted below.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Xx1cuxM...

free models preview front and back image.

","ABOUT THE MODELS:Ive designed the models based on my experience creating stl files for 3d printing and the work I maintained with a close friend of mineThese Pieces would fit any table of Gaslands - Warhammer 40k - Fallout - Warmachine - Malifauxhere you can follow a link to check the quality of the modelshttps://sketchfab.com/3d-models/stl-samples-1-a...https://sketchfab.com/models/34108f9c3cef4dad9f...Models list:-7 kinds of barricades 2 of them modular that can be used as trench-5 pipes pieces-6 tire wall pieces-3 barrel objects-2 boxes -2 gas cylinders types-1 large power capacitor-6 types of modular wall-2 types of tunnel hallway roof-3 modular roof pieces-3 types of floor-1 floor support-1 stairs module-1 engine crane-1 fuel pump-1 concrete block-1 anti tank barricade-1 door module with removable door-3 types of auto turret-1 auto turret base-1 large power battery-1 large gas container-1 flag pole-1 marking pole-1 old shack-1 large container unitThe math might not add up but some models are in 2 pieces.    REWARDS:I have stablished a reward system asside from the paid perks there are social stretchgoals, for every stretchgoal on the social area that is met, you will unlock a model that will be available for free to everyone, this models will be unique and not belong to the base STL files set.each unlocked social goal will release a link that will be posted below.https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Xx1cuxM...free models preview front and back image.STRETCHGOALSonce we have reached a stretchgoal new models will be unlocked and developed most of them based on your own feedback. been the first one already developed and to be released upon reaching the first 300usd.",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

 

Do You Realize How Much? is an engaging and fun card game that deals with a subject that we are passionate about and believe is important: OUR HUMAN FOOTPRINT. In other words, how much we consume, how much we generate and how much time we spend on our different daily activities in the course of our lives. In short, all those little big details that define us as one of the most peculiar species on the planet, among all the particularly strange species that exist.

 

 

If you have ever wondered which is the footprint you leave on the planet simply by existing, this game may bring you some answers, while also providing you with some good laughs with your friends and family.

 

 

If you are familiar with our previous projects, you may know that we are a publishing house which specializes in flipbooks, so we couldn't help including a fun little flipbook feature into the card deck. To discover the animation that we have hidden for your entertainment, you just have to arrange the cards in the right order, slide your finger as if it were a flipbook and that's it! Magic Flipboku style! :)

 

 

The animated sequence was created by our great friend and incomparable animator Nacho Rodriguez. An animation genius with a hypnotic and organic style. The sequence is also in a loop, so it doesn't matter when you start turning pages, in the end it will work as long as you keep the cards in the correct numerical order. The sequence is based on a continuous transformation of elements from different illustrations that you will find in the cards. A real treat for the eyes and thumb. ?

 

 

 

It's very easy. The player in charge of asking the question in each round takes the first card from the deck, chooses one of the two questions and reads it out loud. Then, he/she and the rest of the participants have 1 minute to write down their answer. When the time is up, each player reveals his/her bet. The person in charge of that round reads the answer on the back of the card, and the player with the closest number to the correct answer, wins.

 

 

Obviously, you will sometimes be way off track with your guess, but what is better than laughing at yourself (except of course laughing at others :D). There are detailed instructions offering variations of the game and score, although the objective is always  the same: to come nearest to the correct value to win each round.

 

 

To allow as many humans as possible to play, Do You Realize How Much? will be available in 3 languages: English, Spanish and German. You will be able to choose the version you want after the campaign, when leaving us your shipping details in our pledge manager.

 

 

We do not rule out developing possible future editions in other languages, as this would allow us to reach even more humans. :)

 

We affectionately call them Human Zero. They are the result of a match between a man and a woman, inhabiting a developed Western country with a life expectancy of 79 years. All numbers correspond to an average of this Human Zero, the Frankenstein of Do You Realize How Much?.

 

 

Since humans are not the center of the universe (or at least shouldn't be), we have designed 2 more fabulous extension packs that can be perfectly combined with the Human Edition: The Animal Edition and the Space Edition. Each edition contains 200 more questions and answers: together the 3 editions make 600 questions and answers - a real number madness!

The ANIMAL EDITION includes 200 questions and answers from the animal world, all kinds of interesting data, incredible facts and extraordinary curiosities, in short, everything the amazing world of the animal kingdom has to offer.

 

 

 

If you are a space lover or would like to know more about its incredible mysteries and dimensions, then this is for you. The SPACE EDITION is all about spaceflight, rockets, galaxies, moons and stars, planets and the amazing facts and conditions with which man went to the Moon for the very first time.

 

 

 

Both the Animal Edition and the Space Edition are not only fun and entertaining but also very informative and great learning tools for both, adults and kids (recommended minimum age is 12 years).

 

All the numbers that you will discover in this game are the result of the investigation and research of multiple sources, which were reviewed, compared and processed until we reached the most accurate result possible. Therefore they are approximations or averages based on statistical data. They do not represent an absolute truth, they are figures that reflect the footprint of an average human (the Human Zero exposed above) and obviously can vary over time (hopefully they will change for the better).

Each answer is complemented with additional information such as an equivalence, fun facts, shocking revelations or comparisons that help you visualize the magnitude of the numbers in our human footprint and their impact on the planet.

 

 

Through this comparison, the number, which at first is merely abstract, takes on another meaning and we can picture the distance in our minds since we have a reference to compare it with.

As we know that not all countries use the same units of measurement, to facilitate the understanding of the game and avoid you having to make tedious conversions, all the answers are expressed in the two most important units of measurement: pound-kilograms, inches-centimeters, yards-meters, miles-kilometers, gallons-liters, etc. 

 

 

48 years later we are looking for the same thing, but instead of wanting to be discovered by aliens we are hoping to rediscover ourselves! And what better than to have the fearless couple of the Pioneer probes as reference models in this journey of discovery of our own human footprint.

Good design and packaging are always of great importance in our projects. So we have developed an attractive and handy box that, apart from helping you to arrange the cards while you play, will protect them when you take the game on the road.

 

 

All three editions include 100 cards each, featuring two questions and answers as well as two unique illustrations per card. Each card has a small number in the upper left corner. More about that in the next chapter
column2:
)

 

 

Our fascination with the human footprint goes back years, and we have always had  the idea of making these breathtaking numbers visible through different formats. Over time we have come to the conclusion that the best way to do this is through a card game. A unique card game that will make you think, take a wild guess, discover, imagine, estimate, laugh, reflect, marvel at and become aware of the astonishing numbers that our nature and human footprint reveal!

In addition to having a great time with friends or family, our ultimate goal is to help raise awareness of our human footprint. And who knows, maybe push you to modify some consumption habits, make better decisions and thus become better and more sustainable human beings. And if we are lucky, contribute a tiny little bit to building a better planet for future generations, because the way we are going, we will clearly not get very far.

A card game is an excellent learning tool
column3:
it’s portable, handy and in this case, it’s a game with very simple rules that does not require any complex instructions.

 

 

Flipboku is a publishing house located on the beautiful island of Mallorca, specializing in one-of-a-kind flipbooks. The project is the brainchild of animator and designer Jossie Malis and film music composer Julie Reier. We have both been working in the world of animation for many years now and love all things related to animation, books and design. We loved the idea of having our own flipbook publishing house, so we started the project in 2016 and it has grown steadily since then.

The Flipboku team is completed with our illustrators and graphic designers Noemi Aiolo and Erika Godino, besides our irreplaceable production team lead by Gustavo, Tomás and José Ramón. Our last addition to the team is Ricardo Espinosa, writer, old friend and collaborator in the development of this game project. We also thank Nacho Rodríguez, Andy Bernstein, Victoria Amengual and Matías Arévalo for their continuos support!

 

 

This is our 4th Kickstarter campaign with Flipboku, and we have successfully completed 3 more with our studio Zumbakamera, so you could say we are already Kickstarter veterans. Crowdfunding allows us to finance the production of our publications in advance - which is a huge advantage for us. Kickstarter is also a great platform to reach more people all over the world and to make our project known internationally. Not only have we been able to make our dream a reality, but we have also gained a loyal and growing community that has been supporting us over the last few years. We think this is the best gift you could ever imagine.

Do You Realize How Much? is our first card game after having published 10 flipbook editions, however the goal is the same: to create unique formats that are not only fun, but also useful whether in a creative, artistic or educational way. To learn more about our flipbooks, check out our website www.flipboku.com or our previous Kickstarter campaigns: Molecularis, Apollo 11 and Dots &

Who we are

The designers of this product are Allen Cooperrider and his son Sid Cooperrider. Allen is a conservation biologist/writer/organic gardener/muckraker and Sid is a designer/music guy/geek/treehouser/muckraker. Together they host a website, docyale.com, that is devoted to their diverse interests.
Why we're doing this

We are living in a special time in the United States. We have put a president (POTUS) in the White House with no experience or even much interest in government. He got to the position by ridiculing and and insulting all his opponents and promising the world.
Our Federal Government is now in a crisis mode. Robert Reich former Secretary of Labor has written:

column2: >“America is in a crisis of governance. There is no adult in charge. Instead, we have as president an unhinged narcissistic child who tweets absurd lies and holds rallies to prop up his fragile ego, whose conflicts of financial interest are ubiquitous, and whose presidency is under a “gray cloud” of suspicion (according to the Republican chairman of the House Intelligence Committee) for colluding with Russian agents to obtain office in the 2016 election.” - Common Dreams, March 22, 2017

column1: We are both concerned about the damage that this POTUS is doing to our country. In fact we are worried that our country is moving toward a totalitarian state. We are therefore dedicated to doing our part to resist this trend. Our Trump Cards are part of this effort.
What we want the deck to do
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hf1qxRSgJu0?autohide=1&amp

This deck of cards illustrates the people who are now in charge of your Federal government in the administration of Donald Trump. It is intended to be both practical and educational. On the practical side the deck is a standard 52 card deck with two jokers. You can use them for your bridge club or your weekly poker game.
On the educational side each card gives a few facts about the person in the stated position. You may notice a pattern to what people are featured in each suit.
<ul>
• The Hearts in the deck are all members of the Congress, the legislative branch of the Federal government or ancillary organizations set up to provide support for the Congress.
• The Clubs in the deck are all members of the military/security apparatus of the country and all of them are appointed by the POTUS (with the advice and consent of the Senate).

• The Diamonds represent the executive branch of the Federal government. They include the POTUS who is elected by the people and eleven members of his cabinet that he appoints with the advice and consent of the Senate.

• The Spades represent the “shadow government” men and women who have exceptional influence on the POTUS and the rest of the federal government but are not directly accountable to the people of the country. All of the spades in the deck are appointed by the POTUS but only three of them require Senate confirmation.
• The two Jokers represent the nine members of the Supreme Court, the judicial branch of the Federal government. They are appointed by the POTUS for life terms with Senate confirmation.

Our goal is that these decks will be widely disseminated and available to be viewed and used including in schools. We include with each deck a few potential exercises that teachers can utilize to help students understand how our Federal Government operates and how it is now populated.
Franklin Roosevelt said: “Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.”
We are optimistic that these decks can make a substantial contribution to the resistance by helping to educate citizens of all ages so they can choose wisely.
Other reasons we're doing this

We live off the grid, with solar panels, a generator, and batteries. We seriously need new batteries for our system. We hope we can make enough to buy them (and then, we'll have power to make our next project.)

Short Summary

Robinson Crusoe: Escape from Despair Island is a fast-paced, family-friendly game for 1-4 players, ages 14 and up. Offering a new game play experience every time, with vibrant art on 160 cards, push-your-luck mechanics, and the age-old theme of survival and escape, it will leave you wondering if you have what it takes to make it home alive.

In 1651 a young man leaves home for an adventure at sea, shipwrecked on an island 40 miles out, he spends the next 28 years gathering food, resources, tools, and battling against insurmountable odds to stay alive. He hunts, raises animals, reads the bible, and begins to turn his focus and attention inward. His faith grows and he becomes a man of God, learning to accept his fate, growing spiritually, and realizing that he has everything he needs to survive and live in peace.

Combining themes of hope, strength, and resiliency, this strategic, multi-layered game will test your skills in more ways than one, as you navigate through cannibal attacks, deadly storms, and your own inner turmoil.
The deck is shuffled, and every player is dealt five cards face down. These cards represent the players’ food supply, with one card being equal to one day's worth of food.
The game proceeds in a clockwise direction and includes two phases of play during each player’s turn - the exploration phase, and the market phase.

During the exploration phase the active player draws cards from the deck in order to take either food cards or camp cards. The market phase opens for other players once the active player has chosen what card to take.
At the beginning of every turn, a player must discard one food card into the discard pile. This is the cost of playing the game and represents one day's food supply being used up.
Players take turns flipping cards to find the resources they need. You can think of each flipped card as a new resource or ability your character has uncovered.

During the exploration phase the active player draws cards from the deck in order to take either food cards or camp cards. The market phase opens for other players once the active player has chosen what card to take.

During the exploration phase a player can flip up to 10 cards. The aim of the exploration phase is to find food and resources and to build the camp and character. Ultimately the goal is to escape from the island.
After a maximum of ten cards have been flipped, the active player chooses which card(s) they are going to keep, leaving the remaining cards on the table for the other players to buy.
There are two ways to take cards from the drawn cards

1) Harvest food cards i.e cards with a green palm tree symbol on the top left and a food icon on the bottom right. When harvesting, take the indicated amount of food from the draw deck and place the food card on the discard pile.
2) Take camp cards such as
<ul>
• construction cards with a brown upper left corner symbol,
• character cards with a blue upper left corner symbol, or
• resource cards with upper left corner green palm tree symbol, other than food cards (if you meet the requirements).

The camp can consist of items like a hut, palisade, box or boat, as well as resources such as a rifle, an axe or gunpowder. Character growth and actual character cards are also placed in the camp. When a player builds an item in their camp, the card is placed image side up on the table in front of the player.
A player can continue flipping cards until either:
<ul>
•  they have flipped a total of ten cards, in which case the player is forced to decide what card to take, or
• they decide to stop and take some of the flipped cards to their camp, or alternatively harvest food when the food card is discarded and food cards are taken from the draw deck, or
• they flip a total of two threat cards and cannot defeat the more difficult one

If a second threat card is flipped, the player must then defeat the greater of the two threats (denoted by 1, 2, or 3 skulls in the top right corner of the card) if they want to take some flipped card(s) from the table to their camp.

The threat is defeated by having the cards listed on the card’s ""requirement row"". Each card has its own symbol. In the above example, the player does not have any cards in their camp, so the exploration turn is over for that player and they do not get to keep any of the cards they have flipped.
If the player is able to defeat the threat, the card is placed on the discard pile, and they can either continue the exploration phase and drawing cards, or

• take the indicated amount of food cards and add them to their pile. The options available after defeating the threat are visible on the bottom of the card where there is either a card deck icon OR a food icon with a number.
In this example food can be harvested as it has no requirements.
When building a construction unit like a boat using an axe and wood, the wood is discarded (it has the finite symbol '1') while the axe is not discarded (it has the infinite symbol ∞).

After each player has done his exploration turn, the market phase starts. Moving in a clockwise direction, all other players are now given the opportunity to buy any cards that are left from the exploration phase.

The cost of each card is denoted by a number in the top right corner, which represents the number of food cards the buying player must then discard to acquire the card. On top of this number, the buying player must also give one food card to the selling player.

If there is no number in the top right corner (as with the goat card) then the buying player does not need to discard any food cards, but they do still need to give the selling player one food card as payment.

The market phase continues until all the cards have been bought or the players do not want to buy any more. Any cards left on the table at the end of the market phase are then placed in the discard pile.

It will take more than just food and shelter to keep you alive. Players will need to teach, pray, and read to build up character, and better the odds of escaping alive. By collecting character growth cards, a player can get characters, which give effects and open up paths to victory.
Characters are needed to enable the following paths to victory
<ul>
• Beacon Campfire victory path, either with the Man of God character card or with a camp of 18 victory points
• Escape the Island victory path, either with the Teacher character card or with a camp of 18 victory points
• Victory point strategy, by having the Wise Man character plus 25/20/17 VPs (4/3/2 players)
You could draw the attention of a rescue ship, but you will need to become a Man of God OR build a camp with at least 18 VPs and find wood and gunpowder to build a fire.
You can set your sights on building a boat, but you will need to find Friday and teach him how to help you.
Finally, you can pray and read to become a wise man and build up your victory points to beat the other players.
The game ends in either of the following situations:
<ul>
• When the draw deck has been played through twice, in which case the player with the most victory points (VPs) wins.
• When any player achieves one of the three winning strategies: Beacon Campfire, Escape the Island or Victory points.
Our campaign has already reached its goal in Kickstarter, so the product is ready for production in November 2019 and the game ships in January 2020.

The benefits of backing this campaign include much faster access to the game and roughly 25% savings compared to the retail cost. With high quality art and a compact and sturdy box! Take it with you wherever you go and enjoy it for many years to come.

Every Robinson Crusoe fan will be able to enjoy the definitive highest quality version of the game, made from high-quality materials, and revised to include all the new content we have created since it was first developed.

330gsm card stock is made by sandwiching a black opaque adhesive core between 2 layers of paper. Black core is an extra black layer sandwiched right in the middle of the cards, this layer blocks light rays from shining through your cards.

We employ a professional fulfillment partner that will take care of the reward deliveries. All shipping costs will be calculated and added to your pledge automatically after selecting the country of residence. Our fulfillment service provides a tracking number for each parcel shipped from our premises to anywhere in the world.

We currently have agreements with our fulfillment partners to ensure that no custom taxes will be charged for shipments in the USA, EU, and AU. There will be no import tax and custom duty for shipments to US addresses. There will also be no import tax and custom duty for shipments to Australia (on orders of up to $850.00 excluding shipping costs), and to UK and EU countries (on orders of up to $300.00 excluding shipping costs).
Note that there might be slight chance of custom and taxation policies to be changed during the campaign in which case we are not responsible for the added costs.

If you live outside of the USA, EU, and AU customs taxes may be added to the pledge amount. Please check your country's rules and regulations regarding any custom duty or taxes which may be imposed upon delivery.

Team
Niko Huttu - Game Design

Founder of Old Novel Games and the designer of Robinson Crusoe: Escape from Despair Island, Niko loves games (both PC and tabletop) and he is passionate about old novels. But since the birth of his two children, Niko’s relationship with games has changed. His ideas often come to him when he is reading to his children, and that is where the things he is the most passionate about in life come together. He believes every good book deserves to be transformed into a game, and that every avid reader deserves the opportunity to relive their favourite stories.
Adrian Liza Clares- Art &
Adrian is an astonishing 2D artist who can turn any idea into a stunning piece of 2D art, very quickly. And talk about an honest and humble person!

""I’m Adrian Liza, a Spanish concept artist based in Gothenburg, Sweden. During these years I’ve been developing visual ideas for video games and recently I had the chance to be part of the board game “Robinson Crusoe: Escape from Despair Island”, where I was in charge of creating the total visual aspect of the game. This project was fun and really challenging, because it was nothing like I’ve ever done before. Even so, it was easy to keep up the motivation thanks to Niko Huttu, who made  this production a marvelous experience that I’ll never forget.""
Pablo - Iconography &
Pablo knows what it takes to be a great card game layout and icon designer. His professionalism is top notch.
Simon Mora - Video Production

Simon helped this project take off with his unique ability to envision the end result and bring it to life. His Venezuelan video editing team made the animation film possible. It has been a such a great honor to work with these guys!

While we are doing everything we can to manage any logistical issues, there is a potential for problems to arise during the manufacturing process. Such issues could impact our ability to meet our backer commitments. These may include (but are not limited to):
* Production delays
* Shipping and customs related delays

However, we employ a professional manufacturing and fulfillment partner who has done similar campaigns before, so every aspect related to manufacturing and fulfillment will be handled in the best possible way.
Delivery dates

All announced delivery dates are estimates. While we are doing everything we can to mitigate these risks, backers may receive their rewards at different times depending on their location and the exact reward items selected.
Subject to changes
Final product will be subject to changes and improvements from what is presented here.
Deliveries

All parcels that we ship out are boxed, insulated and packaged in a way that should withstand normal bumps during transit. In very uncommon cases where there are damages to the product itself, we will assist in the investigation as to where and how the product was damaged.
Every package leaving our manufacturer's facility is carefully inspected and they guarantee the goods to be free of defects and manufacturing errors.
We will give you a full refund, no questions asked within 14 days of the campaign end and upon request.
Returns
If you find any quality issues with your order, please contact us within 3 days from the arrival date.
If your game arrives with missing or damaged parts, provide us with appropriate proof and we will substitute them once we have verified the damage.
We will not accept complaints related to the game box contents of this campaign (missing components, damaged components, etc.) that are coming after 30 days from the delivery date to your door.
Mistakes in deliveries

If the game fails to arrive because of the mistake made by the backer (wrong address, recipient absent, failure to pick up at courier/postal warehouse, etc.), any additional shipping/warehousing cost for us to re-send/re-deliver your game will be at backer's expense. This also includes the costs associated with returning the game. If after investigation it becomes clear that the error was on our part, we will resend your package at our expense.
Additional information
The Robinson Crusoe: Escape from Despair Island is made in China.
In some prototype images there may be an age label with an 8+ mark. Officially this is game for people of ages 14+, however younger people can learn to play this game as well.
","Short Summary

Robinson Crusoe: Escape from Despair Island is a fast-paced, family-friendly game for 1-4 players, ages 14 and up. Offering a new game play experience every time, with vibrant art on 160 cards, push-your-luck mechanics, and the age-old theme of survival and escape, it will leave you wondering if you have what it takes to make it home alive.

In 1651 a young man leaves home for an adventure at sea, shipwrecked on an island 40 miles out, he spends the next 28 years gathering food, resources, tools, and battling against insurmountable odds to stay alive. He hunts, raises animals, reads the bible, and begins to turn his focus and attention inward. His faith grows and he becomes a man of God, learning to accept his fate, growing spiritually, and realizing that he has everything he needs to survive and live in peace.

Combining themes of hope, strength, and resiliency, this strategic, multi-layered game will test your skills in more ways than one, as you navigate through cannibal attacks, deadly storms, and your own inner turmoil.
The deck is shuffled, and every player is dealt five cards face down. These cards represent the players’ food supply, with one card being equal to one day's worth of food.
The game proceeds in a clockwise direction and includes two phases of play during each player’s turn - the exploration phase, and the market phase.

During the exploration phase the active player draws cards from the deck in order to take either food cards or camp cards. The market phase opens for other players once the active player has chosen what card to take.
At the beginning of every turn, a player must discard one food card into the discard pile. This is the cost of playing the game and represents one day's food supply being used up.
Players take turns flipping cards to find the resources they need. You can think of each flipped card as a new resource or ability your character has uncovered.

During the exploration phase the active player draws cards from the deck in order to take either food cards or camp cards. The market phase opens for other players once the active player has chosen what card to take.

During the exploration phase a player can flip up to 10 cards. The aim of the exploration phase is to find food and resources and to build the camp and character. Ultimately the goal is to escape from the island.
After a maximum of ten cards have been flipped, the active player chooses which card(s) they are going to keep, leaving the remaining cards on the table for the other players to buy.
There are two ways to take cards from the drawn cards

1) Harvest food cards i.e cards with a green palm tree symbol on the top left and a food icon on the bottom right. When harvesting, take the indicated amount of food from the draw deck and place the food card on the discard pile.
2) Take camp cards such as
construction cards with a brown upper left corner symbol,
character cards with a blue upper left corner symbol, or
resource cards with upper left corner green palm tree symbol, other than food cards (if you meet the requirements).

The camp can consist of items like a hut, palisade, box or boat, as well as resources such as a rifle, an axe or gunpowder. Character growth and actual character cards are also placed in the camp. When a player builds an item in their camp, the card is placed image side up on the table in front of the player.
A player can continue flipping cards until either:
they have flipped a total of ten cards, in which case the player is forced to decide what card to take, or
they decide to stop and take some of the flipped cards to their camp, or alternatively harvest food when the food card is discarded and food cards are taken from the draw deck, or
they flip a total of two threat cards and cannot defeat the more difficult one

If a second threat card is flipped, the player must then defeat the greater of the two threats (denoted by 1, 2, or 3 skulls in the top right corner of the card) if they want to take some flipped card(s) from the table to their camp.

The threat is defeated by having the cards listed on the card’s ""requirement row"". Each card has its own symbol. In the above example, the player does not have any cards in their camp, so the exploration turn is over for that player and they do not get to keep any of the cards they have flipped.
If the player is able to defeat the threat, the card is placed on the discard pile, and they can either continue the exploration phase and drawing cards, or

take the indicated amount of food cards and add them to their pile. The options available after defeating the threat are visible on the bottom of the card where there is either a card deck icon OR a food icon with a number.
In this example food can be harvested as it has no requirements.
When building a construction unit like a boat using an axe and wood, the wood is discarded (it has the finite symbol '1') while the axe is not discarded (it has the infinite symbol ∞).

After each player has done his exploration turn, the market phase starts. Moving in a clockwise direction, all other players are now given the opportunity to buy any cards that are left from the exploration phase.

The cost of each card is denoted by a number in the top right corner, which represents the number of food cards the buying player must then discard to acquire the card. On top of this number, the buying player must also give one food card to the selling player.

If there is no number in the top right corner (as with the goat card) then the buying player does not need to discard any food cards, but they do still need to give the selling player one food card as payment.

The market phase continues until all the cards have been bought or the players do not want to buy any more. Any cards left on the table at the end of the market phase are then placed in the discard pile.

It will take more than just food and shelter to keep you alive. Players will need to teach, pray, and read to build up character, and better the odds of escaping alive. By collecting character growth cards, a player can get characters, which give effects and open up paths to victory.
Characters are needed to enable the following paths to victory
Beacon Campfire victory path, either with the Man of God character card or with a camp of 18 victory points
Escape the Island victory path, either with the Teacher character card or with a camp of 18 victory points
Victory point strategy, by having the Wise Man character plus 25/20/17 VPs (4/3/2 players)
You could draw the attention of a rescue ship, but you will need to become a Man of God OR build a camp with at least 18 VPs and find wood and gunpowder to build a fire.
You can set your sights on building a boat, but you will need to find Friday and teach him how to help you.
Finally, you can pray and read to become a wise man and build up your victory points to beat the other players.
The game ends in either of the following situations:
When the draw deck has been played through twice, in which case the player with the most victory points (VPs) wins.
When any player achieves one of the three winning strategies: Beacon Campfire, Escape the Island or Victory points.

WHAT THE WHAT?! is a hilarious 3-10 person party game where players compete to pitch outrageous new uses for genuine old time inventions.
Featuring audacious attempts, fantastic fails and clever contraptions from the world's patent archives.
There are Self Saluting Hats, Rocking Chair Bathtubs, Flying Machines and a few that would likely kill you.
Researchers from the Smithsonian and White House Historical Association have spent hours curating 100 inventions from circa 1581 to today.
We brought this game to Indiegogo because its curious community rises up to support the bold, outlandish creators today. We believe many of you would have backed these incredible inventions.

Whether it was a lack of access to funding, cultural constraints or an inability to share their message widely, the majority of these inventions, never got past the patent or prototype stage. With your help we can now bring them to life!
Our beautifully illustrated Digital Booklet deep dives into the journey and motivations of some of the Inventors who, in our opinion, didn't fail, but inspire us with their try.

column1: Risks and challenges

With over 6 years of growing my first card game I co-created called Not Parent Approved from a friends and family Kickstarter to becoming a best seller card game on Amazon, I understand what it takes to bring this game to market. Production of the game is simple: it's just a card game, so other than building the box it's a relatively straight forward product to make. We recognize that COVID or shipping issues cause some logistic challenges. We are committed to keeping you updated! We're keeping this as simple as possible: support our project and in return we will send you this game to help you create laughs, stress relief and good times with your people.

Remember when the iconic MP3 players first came out, and we were so excited about carrying a thousand songs in our pocket? Here is a toy figure that will make you feel nostalgic about that time
Say Hello to iBoy

A heartfelt homage to the must-have device that transformed everyone's listening habits in the early 2000s, iBoy toy figure is the brainchild of  Classicbot’s designer, Philip Lee. The end result is an eye-catching talking point that’s sure to brighten up homes and offices everywhere.
iBoy doesn't play any music, but it is still lots of fun.
iBoy is 100% free of electronic parts or functions, but each iBoy’s arms and legs with magnetic joints are infinite fun to move around and play with.
Magnetic joints
<div><div>
<div>
There’s even a detachable lifelike headphone that ensures effortless switches between the unit’s robot and MP3 stylings.
Transformable
iBoy comes with mock-up wire and headphones. So you can display iBoy in different ways.
Two color options

iBoy comes with two colors. The regular one with the white body. And the 2U Special Edition with the black and red body. They are of the same price. So you can just decide the number of iBoy you want to back and decide the color later.
The perfect fiddle toy
Each unit comes with an easily rotatable control wheel and easy-on-the-ear clickable button, making it the perfect fiddle toy. Pick it up when you’re bored or stressed!
Rewards
When you back us now, you will get iBoy at a great price.
Craftsmanship and durability

To ensure ultra-clean lines and detailing, iBoy is precision-engineered from top quality ABS plastic via a state-of-the-art molding machines. Unit backs are beautifully chromed while all white parts are finished in durable glossy paint. Each unit’s buttons will also reward owners with a satisfying click and post-press bounce back. Besides looking and feeling every bit as sophisticated as a real MP3 player, iBoy also incorporates a metal weight that gives it the satisfyingly substantial and sturdy feeling shared by all quality toys.
Features
• Crafted from high quality ABS plastic
• Glossy white painted body and limbs
• Mirror-like chrome rear finish
• Easily posable magnetic-jointed limbs
• Ultra-fine silk-screened details
• Added weight ensures satisfying heftiness
• Realistic wired headphone connection
• Clickable buttons and turnable wheel
• Stands some 10 cms tall and weighs approx. 100 gms in robot mode
* iBoy contains small part and is not suitable for kids aged under 14
Manufacturing

Since 2017, we have worked with the same reliable factory that adheres to our high quality standards and delivers our products in the most timely manner. We will continue to work with this factory to ensure iBoy with the same high quality.
Shipping and delivery:

To ensure prompt and timely delivery, all orders will be shipped worldwide via the Hong Kong postal office’s fast and easily trackable E-express service. We will ship in November. While exact delivery times will vary from country to country, shipments will usually reach US customers within 7 to 14 working days.
We promised to ship in November. And that is already included a few months buffer in case the factory is affected by the virus. Please check ""Risks and Challenges"" section for more detail.
About Classicbot

We really love old product designs, which is why we started Classicbot. Over the years, Classicbot’s creativity has been acclaimed by fans all over the world. In 2017, the company’s  Classicbot Classicbot was selected by the authoritative industry blog, Toysrevil, as the Top Toy of 2017. Philip was also selected as a finalist in the coveted Designer Toy Awards’ Breakthrough Artist of 2019 award.
Let’s bring iBoy to life together

Classicbot and its partner factory, have been perfecting iBoy for more than a year. Right now, the tooling for iBoy’s mold is done and paid.  But we need your help for the next step: sourcing materials for mass production. We’d be grateful if you could help us take the next step.  Let’s bring iBoy to life together, shall we?
Risks and challenges

Potential risks and challenges: Having extensively evaluated the challenges and opportunities inherent in similar Kickstarter projects, Classicbot founder, Philip Lee, is 100% committed to iBoy’s success! A proven manufacturing partner: Classicbot began working with its production partner factory in 2017 and has consistently been praised for exceptional product quality. The headquarter of the factory is located in Hong Kong people so we work closely together all the time. The effect of the Coronavirus Of course, no one can estimate how the virus will affect everyone. But we have built a lot of buffer in our delivery time. Since the mold is finished, we only need two months for production after the funds arrive. Supposedly we can ship everything in July. But we want to give ourselves a 4 months buffer for any unexpected event. At this moment the factory has reopened and started production in a cautious manner. Order fulfillment processes: Having long added to his small design team’s effectiveness by leveraging the superior shipping and delivery facilities of renowned fulfillment centers, Philip is confident distribution will never be a problem. Design and molding: iBoy has been designed as a single unit and tooling for its master mold is done. All the company needs to fast-track into full-scale production is to secure funding to finish the mold and cover production costs.

column2:
Challenges

Our main challenge is our packaging. We haven't got custom boxes so the games will arrive shipped in bubble satchels.
When we have the money we will change that but we thought it would be better to get them sent out so you can enjoy your games rather than worry about what the packaging looks like. 

All we need is for you to tell us a little about yourself and we’re good to go!

Short text

",Short text,0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Tartu, Estonia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cardboard-game/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Burglar is a whole new twist on family board games.
It's a game involving skill, chance, memory and tactics as you hunt for loot and get the chance to block opponents from reaching their own target items or escaping undetected.
The game board and tiles themselves have the simple elegance of 1920s sophistication and it's one of those games that's simple to learn but different every time you play.
It's a family friendly game that lasts around 30 minutes which gets more devious every time  as you learn tactics to frustrate opponents and use your best negotiating skills to gang up on players.
What's in the box....
The board - which is a plan view of a sumptuous country manor house living room.
18 valuable ""target"" cards - which clearly identify the items you're looking for.
18 valuable cards and 2 dog tiles -  which are hidden in the room at the start of game play.
7 furniture tiles - which are moved around by players during the game.
6 people counters
1 dice
How do you play...
In essence it's a simple turn taking game.  But the skill is in remembering where your objects are and in blocking your opponents.

How good are your friends poker faces when their valuable is found?  Can you move the furniture to make it as awkward as possible to get to their targets while making it as easy as possible to get to yours or escape?
It's a little addictive and children love it because it's so easy to understand.
Taking a turn
· Youngest goes first
· Roll the dice and move your playing piece around the room. You may not land on or jump over furniture. You can move up, down, left,right, or diagonally.
· If you roll a 1 or 2, you can either move 1 or 2 squares, or move an item of furniture (see below).
· If you land on a treasure tile, turn it over for all the players to see.

- If it’s a piece of treasure you’re trying to collect, show your ‘Burglar’ tile to the other players, and remove the treasure tile from the board. Keep the treasure tile with your burglar tile and leave your Burglar tile face up in front of you to show that you’ve found it.
- If it’s not a piece of treasure you’re trying to collect, turn it back over and leave it in the same place on the board.
· Play then passes clockwise to the next player.
Moving furniture
· If you roll a 1 or 2 you can choose to move 1 piece of furniture instead of moving your playing piece.
· You can put furniture anywhere on the board but it must not be put on top of treasure tiles, other furniture, or other players.
· Furniture must not be positioned so that it creates a complete barricade across the room or around a player. There must always be a way around (even if it’s the long way round!).
Landing on a guard dog
· If you land on a guard dog, you’ve woken him up!

· Ask a player of your choice to return 1 treasure tile back to the board (anywhere they choose). Turn your own burglar tile back over. You must now go back to that item on the board and find it again.
· Turn the guard dog tile back over but put it back in a different place on the board (this can’t be on top of furniture, another treasure tile, or another player).
· If none of your Burglar tiles are face up when you wake up the guard dog, put the dog back face down somewhere else on the board and return to your entry point. It’s then the next player’s turn.
Winning the game
· The winner is the first player to find all their items and exit through their colour coded Enter/Escape point.
What are the rewards?
Well, first and foremost the game itself! These games make a great present for families of all ages.
We also have some nifty crime scene socks, and a swag bag to keep your tiles in.
This is a brand new game, with new game mechanics.  Let's face it - there are very few ""new"" games for families.   It's 2020 next year and this is a great 1920s themed game to celebrate 2020!

My own kids loved this game when they were 7 and 9 but it's taken so long to get it to market that they've grown up into grumpy teenagers.  I'd love to see this board game out in time to please my nephews and nieces!
Delivery estimate?

It takes 35-40 days to manufacture a board game - we've had a revised estimate on delivery as January 18th since the end of Kickstarter - and will keep you up to date on the delivery schedule as it changes.  The Swag card game and other rewards will be available for shipment as early as the 18th - so we can split ship if you prefer.
SUPPORTERS:
Matt Knott [Illustrator and Game Consultant]

Matt is trusted with top visitor attractions and the worlds most popular gaming and entertainment brands because he cares that fans, audiences and players get exactly the experience they deserve. He designs and produces creative, interactive and immersive playful experiences with best-in-class creative and Hollywood production values.
Matt runs the Game Creation Accelerator programme, working with game designers and publishers, turning their ideas into beautifully illustrated, toy-fair ready products.
Risks and challenges

As with all items going into production for the first time there are the risks of delay in shipments. We have worked with Ingenium games during the development and to act as our advisers throughout the process to make sure we pick the right manufacturers to ensure delivery is on schedule and to specifications.  This game was fully funded on Kickstarter at the end of November and is now in production.

Changing out one game for another is as easy as selecting another game on your Xbox or PlayStation. Plus you can use BEAD GAME open platform www.beads.games/games to discover and share infinite amount of exciting board game variations form players across the world
column9:

  The game boards are highly modular allowing you to use many different kinds of layouts. With the XL SET you can make board layouts that are up to 18x18 squares or 19x19 grid in size allowing you to play a huge number of different games.

column1:
Have you ever experienced a situation when there is one game and multiple rule suggestions from your friends? Thats called - the game variations. Sometimes players tweak rules just for fun or out of curiosity. The App at www.beads.games is open resource to add and share your creative ideas. By adding variations, you can develop a new style of game.

 
In fact, using Game Canvas on the accompanying app, you can invent a new game altogether complete with your own rules.

Once you do that, you can publish it for others to discover and play. This adds a unique social aspect to analog games. Say you post a new game and someone in Europe picks it up to test it and suggest new rules. Now your game is global.

THE BEAD GAME story and solution is inspired by great German-Swiss poet, the author of futuristic novel ""The Glass Bead Game"" (Das Glasperlenspiel), the 1946 Nobel prize winner in Literature. Great literature is inspiring the innovation.

With the XL SET you can make board layouts that are up to 18x18 squares or 19x19 grid in size allowing you to play a huge number of different games.With the Expansion packs you'll get high quality laminated game prints. If you choose only the base set, you can download Print&Play game wireframes at App www.beads.games/games

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Hello, My Name is Samuel

I am a game designer who has been designing a board game called Void: Planets Unbound for about 5 years now. Even as a kid, I would always be inventing and imagining board and card games to play with my friends and parents. I have been spending the majority of my adulthood creating a game experience that I have always felt was missing from the market. However, along with the freedom of adulthood came the responsibilities, meaning that I have had to place my passion on the back burner.
Then, I had an idea! Why don't I just give away my artwork online for donations in the form of unique trading cards? It's perfect! I can do what I love everyday and make more board games.
That's where you come in.
What You Get
I am attempting to raise $500 to pay for prototyping costs for my board game. Whenever you donate you will be helping me come closer to finally releasing my game!
You can choose from the following: Single Card Pack for $5 donations, Triple Card Pack for $12 donations, or the Five Card Pack for $20 donations.

Each pack of cards will include a number of unique hand drawn trading cards, depicting scenes as far away as distant planets to landscapes in medieval kingdoms. Some cards will belong to sets, allowing you to trade with other unique trading card enthusiasts to complete the sets and add some extra value to your collection. With every card hand drawn, you can always be sure that you will be discovering something new with each one.
Please note: All cards are blank on the back signed and dated. However, if you would like me to inscribe a custom message, please let me know.
Thank you for your interest. By donating you are allowing me to do what I love everyday and getting me much closer to releasing my first board game.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money now, don't worry! You can still help by sharing this page with anybody who might be interested. I am so grateful to everyone for their time and donations! Thank you for allowing me to live my dream. It is all thanks to you.
Sincerely,
Samuel Zomerhuis
