0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

Hello and thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign for our game called Card Quest. We're Full Combo Gaming and are currently working on adding the finishing touches to our game and we would love your help.

We are a small indie game development company who enjoy playing a variety of games ranging from table top RPGs, Board games and card games. We also enjoy coming up with new ideas and using our imagination and critical thinking skills to create fun mechanics, games and worlds for people to explore.
Card Quest is a Multiplayer co-op card game where players explore a dungeon filled with monsters, loot and a nasty boss at the end. Work together and you will surely prevail.
Some core aspects of the game:

There are 4 different characters a player can choose to be. Each of these characters has a class that you can play as, level up and attain gear for throughout the game. Each character has a set of 15 different abilities that you can mix and match, creating your own play experience.

Currently players can choose to create a party using the  classes of Cleric, Thief, Warrior and Mage. We plan to introduce more characters and classes in the future to expand upon the customization of the party.
Varying difficulty based on the number of players in the game. Variances include monster stats, number of monsters spawned as well as boss mechanics.
An event deck that randomly generates your encounters so each game offers a different experience.

A focus on cooperative game play so players can work together to create a fun and balanced team of characters and abilities or everyone can make a random team of characters and try to defeat the boss.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/tkt5-5Fwjes?autohide=1&amp
What We Need

We are looking to raise $6,000 to fund this game. These funds will be split between paying out artists and other commission fees as well as doing an initial print run of the game. These are the primary things that we need to fund.

If we do not reach full funding for this project, any funds that we do get will be used for paying out artists and printing out any copies of the game that we need to. Our initial print run will be smaller, but we will make sure that any backers that get a copy of the game will do so.

If we can surpass our initial goal and reach $15,000, we will use the funds to print a larger, better quality print run from a mass printing company. We also want to include 5 exclusive alternate art foil stamped cards!
What You Get
This game includes:
An instruction booklet.
One 4 sided and one 6 sided dice.
4 playable character cards (Warrior, Thief, Cleric and Mage) and 1 boss card.

Included is 7 different decks: 
     4 different skill/spell decks (15 cards each) 
     1 Monster deck (43 cards)
     1 Loot Deck (52 cards)
     1 Event Deck (40 cards)
2 debuff token cards and 1 explorer Card
* The Image above is an early version of the game, these cards are not finalized and subject to change. This is an accurate depiction of the amount of cards within the game though.
<h3>Risks &amp

We have tried our best to make sure we won't have any problems, but you can't always account for everything. We hope to tackle and problems as they come right away and be upfront with anything that may occur which would delay production.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, don't fret! You can still help out in a big way. Share this campaign with people you know who might be able to contribute or be interested in this game. Getting the word out will really help us and we would love any and all support we can get for this project.

","Hello and thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign for our game called Card Quest. We're Full Combo Gaming and are currently working on adding the finishing touches to our game and we would love your help.

We are a small indie game development company who enjoy playing a variety of games ranging from table top RPGs, Board games and card games. We also enjoy coming up with new ideas and using our imagination and critical thinking skills to create fun mechanics, games and worlds for people to explore.
Card Quest is a Multiplayer co-op card game where players explore a dungeon filled with monsters, loot and a nasty boss at the end. Work together and you will surely prevail.
Some core aspects of the game:

There are 4 different characters a player can choose to be. Each of these characters has a class that you can play as, level up and attain gear for throughout the game. Each character has a set of 15 different abilities that you can mix and match, creating your own play experience.

Currently players can choose to create a party using the  classes of Cleric, Thief, Warrior and Mage. We plan to introduce more characters and classes in the future to expand upon the customization of the party.
Varying difficulty based on the number of players in the game. Variances include monster stats, number of monsters spawned as well as boss mechanics.
An event deck that randomly generates your encounters so each game offers a different experience.

A focus on cooperative game play so players can work together to create a fun and balanced team of characters and abilities or everyone can make a random team of characters and try to defeat the boss.
What We Need

We are looking to raise $6,000 to fund this game. These funds will be split between paying out artists and other commission fees as well as doing an initial print run of the game. These are the primary things that we need to fund.

If we do not reach full funding for this project, any funds that we do get will be used for paying out artists and printing out any copies of the game that we need to. Our initial print run will be smaller, but we will make sure that any backers that get a copy of the game will do so.

If we can surpass our initial goal and reach $15,000, we will use the funds to print a larger, better quality print run from a mass printing company. We also want to include 5 exclusive alternate art foil stamped cards!

column2: >Spirits and Songs: Tavern Heroes
column3: >Here with a Loaf of Bread beneath the Bough,  A Flask of Wine, a Book of Verse — and Thou  Beside me singing in the Wilderness —  And Wilderness is Paradise enow.
column4:
>- Omar Khayyam, The Rubaiyat (1120). FitzGerald's first edition (1859)

What it's about

Spirits and Songs is a book dedicated to taverns, inns, bars and drinks, and the heroes that use them. This book is filled with new subclasses, interesting and strange taverns, game items and spells, and even a recipe book of drinks and food.

This book also has an occasional narrator of sorts: the magical entrepreneur and borderline alcoholic Samuil Pulemet. He developed a spell that transports users to any bar in the multiverse
column5:
this cantankerous spell's published version has over a dozen safe destinations. Now he travels with the spell, reviewing strange venues for fun.

The plan is to produce a spiral-bound book, ideal for use as a recipe and reference book. Page count is expected to be around 160 pages, though layout and stretch-goals could change that.

 

Gwendolyn and fellow adventurers relaxing after a hard day's fighting. Art by Stefan Martello and coloured by Lisa Nani.

 

 ""Work is the curse of the drinking classes."" ~ Oscar Wilde

We have four subclasses on deck:

column1: • The Drunken Master: A monk that uses beer and spirits to help fuel strange new tactics and abilities. COMPLETE
• The Jester: A Rogue subclass that adds mobility powers, deadly japes, and a killer sense of humour. COMPLETE
• The Reaping Mauler: A fighter subclass that focuses on devastating unarmed techniques, chokes, and brutal tactics.
• The Anarchist: A rogue subclass that focuses on explosions, sabotage, and alchemical creations.

Gwendolyn, the iconic Drunken Master. Art by Stefan Martello.

The Drunken Master, by CJ Meikle

And the Jester, by designer Chamomile

 

Where's a murder-hobo supposed to get a drink around here?

So, your players have come to an unfamiliar town, or even a new district and you have an issue: you have no idea what the bar is going to be like. Maybe you didn't have time to prep, or maybe the players threw a curve ball: either way, we've got your back.

The minimum version of the book, should we not reach funding, will be a total of 10 books. However, this project is planned to have 19 interesting and strange venues for your players to explore,  NPCs to interact with, including quest hooks and campaign seeds.

Here's an example excerpt by designer and writer Ed Greenwood.

Here's an example Tavern, by designer and writer Mid Anwar:

THE ARCHMAGE'S BATHTUB

""It's not as bad as it sounds. But it's also not as good as you'd hope. ...look, do you want to get sloshed or what?""

If one were to manifest the old adage, ""jack of all trades, master of none"" into an establishment, The Archmage's Bathtub would be the product. Its unlikely founder was none other than a powerful gnomish wizard with a great enthusiasm for alchemy, but new patrons will be pleased to discover that no concoction was actually mixed inside of an old gnome's washroom, and on the contrary this place has the widest variety of beverages on its menu outside of the most accommodating pubs in the melting pot of a planar metropolis. The name still suits the origins and nature of the bar, however.

Gnomish mage Strekoz Tonbot had a savant understanding of all things related to alchemy. When an old friend of his brought his apprentices to meet Strekoz, a surprise revelation sparked an unexpected desire to share a round of drinks. However, they were disappointed to discover the nearest tavern closed after an explosive incident left it filled with armed guards trying to investigate. Without the most suitable spells prepared for fast travel to a farther location, Strekoz decided to bring everyone back to his home and use what he had on hand.  Mixing a curious combination of agents, the gnome prepared everyone beers made from scratch in a remarkably swift amount of time-- it was alcoholic and smelled convincingly like beer, but it was a clever imitation that spent no time brewing in any bottle or keg. For casual drinkers like his guests however, it was an amazing trick they greatly admired.

Strekoz's old friend would return but a few days later with other acquaintances wishing to show them what the gnomish alchemist could do, and while impressed with his instant beer, the halfling beguiler with them preferred fruity drinks to beer. Accepting the challenge, Strekoz used a new combination of ingredients and reagents on hand to make a similar fake. Now intrigued, his guests were now placing requests, challenging him to imitate all of their favorite refreshments.  Soon he'd attracted a troublesome infamy as word spread of this talent, between people wanting to see how it was done and others wanting drinks that weren't locally available.  Fortunately, Strekoz had documented the formulas he'd used, because when the popularity of his parlor tricks became a nuisance that both depleted precious supplies and interfered with the research he wanted to be doing, he tasked an apprentice with using such recipes to humor his unwanted ""patrons"" for a fee. The success was considerable enough that The Archmage's Bathtub was founded.

 

The Archmage's Bathtub was not without its hurdles. Guests that were more than just drunkards and casual spectators, such as the aficionados of finer brews, had noticed that the formulated drinks were not quite up to the same quality of genuine ones. However, with a growing book of formulas, that was soon simplified down enough that a ""bartender"" with more modest alchemy skills could prepare a fair facsimile of most popular beverages. Basic sugars, ethanol, and an assortment of substances and fragrances are blended together in a mystifying contraption behind the counter that not only allows the patrons to enjoy a diverse range of drinks, but gives the bartender some control over how much kick a drink will have.

BARTENDERS

The main bartender is Cressida Darbinheit, a gnome with a penchant for talking to the strange and diverse clientelle that visit the Archmage’s Bathtub. With green eyes and a thick head of long reddish brown hair, tresses of loose ringlets framing her cheeks, the three foot tall bartender wears modest clothes and keeps a professional neatness about herself. She can be seen either quietly feeling out the patrons sitting at the bar, or at her station alchemically mixing their orders from assorted liquids and powders that look nothing like ingredients for a drink-- and certainly enough, these are not at all natural flavors or ingredients.

Though Cressida only had a modest grasp of alchemy when she started out, it was by way of experience and necessity that she became a reliable bartender, learning how to synthesize the clever forgeries of popular drinks and memorizing a number of the most common formulas. That alongside a natural ability to listen to others talk and fair judgment of customer behavior made her a familiar fixture at the Bathtub.

Cressida addresses patrons with the typical hospitality one would expect from a business, humbly listening to what customers say to her while cautiously drawing out more information with carefully considered questions and remarks. Somewhat less publicly, she can be rather frank with and no nonsense with her fellow staff at the bar, with a casual relationship with Eazel Darbin, Strezok’s protege, that bears a somewhat poorly contained sense of admiration.

 

Ten Low Level Adventures

After ordering a drink, the bartender tells you...
• Kobolds just can't take a joke. A retaliatory strike against the Egon Mining Company is imminent, so you should talk to them if you'd like to make a quick buck.
• That scrawny workshop apprentice has quite the crush on his coworker, but she has eyes for another. He's probably hatching another crazy plan to win her heart...
• The manager says we're running out of Lagomzyme well before the next shipment is supposed to come in. Strekoz's protege can distill some more if you'll get us the right ingredients.

Need a Little Spice?

Are you wanting something new for your game, to help channel your inner dungeon chef or lounge lizard? We've got your back:
• 10 new spells: One of which is Samuil's Inebriated Jaunt for bar-crawl shenanigans.
• 20 magic items: Everything from magical cookware, alcohol transmutation to a new Construct Creation Manual.
• 10 alchemical or mundane items

Enjoy a multitude of drinks and food from taverns across the multiverse! Additionally, Samuil will instruct you on bar etiquette, constructing a bare-bones bar for yourself with essential spirits, and explaining various details about alcoholic beverages

Each tavern will have food and cocktail recipes tied to each location's flavour. Ideally at least 1-2 unique food per location, with a similar number of cocktails.

 

Rewards

The importance of $1 backers cannot be overstated. These sites give visibility to projects based not just on how much money they've raised, but how many backers a project has. A $1 backer in the first day or two can be worth more than a $15 backer in the final day or two. Because of the way the algorithms work, just $1 really does help a lot.

$60 backers get minor bar NPC and an associated side quest seed for adventures. Each one gets an NPC in a particular tavern, and will get a full writeup, plus a quest seed for that location in either Low, Medium or High level tiers.
• $19,000: Full illustration of the inns, inside and out! Plus floor maps for each of them. Additionally, more artwork for food and drink!
• $20,000: Four additional classes! Plus additional recipes and magic items.

The Crew

We have D&
column2: D legend Ed Greenwood taking part in the tavern and NPC writing. Ed is a prolific author and designer in the D&amp
column3: D world, having gotten into the industry in the 70s as a young man and created many D&amp
column4:
D creatures and novels, but most notably the creation of The Forgotten Realms.  Listen to our interview with Ed here.

Also contributing is Chamomile, the author of the Petals and Thorns adventures, professional game master, and hobbyist blogger about how much elves suck and Conan novels turned to shit in the 80s.

Myself, I was the project lead in our development, art director and professional cat herder for our first product Red Dawn, a Pathfinder adventure.  That experience along with years of being behind the DM screen and homebrewing gives me confidence this project will be completed satisfactorily. 

The project also includes several other contributing authors and designers, myself included as well as several artists.

Where the Money Goes

column1: • Writing and Design: Approximately $7500
• Editing, typesetting and Layout: Approximately $1500
• Class Illustrations and assorted illustrations: Approximately $7500
• Research and Incidentals: $300

Why are the costs a bit high? It's because normal industry rates for writing and art are horrendously low, stuck in the 1980s. Heartbreaker Press always tries to give its freelancers a fair shake, and we're trying to push the needle upward.

Questions or Comments?

Heartbreaker Press discord, you can get in touch with me there as @GX or @CJ, or you can email me at hbp.custserv@gmail.com

 

Want to support us directly? Try our Patreon

0,"

WARIGIN is a highly competitive, rapid boardgame. It is designed and optimized for two to three players who enjoy exciting tactical matches in everchanging asymmetric faction wars.

The game doesn't belong to a big publisher but thanks to a crowdfunding campaign ""a man and his dog"" were able to release WARIGIN in 2018. 
All units from the original campaign are sent to the initial backers already.
Via Indiegogo Indemand you now have the chance to order the exclusive First Edition in a beautiful hand-stamped box with lovingly hand-branded meeples.

A tabletop board game with additional card game mechanics, WARIGIN is perfect for a quick blast or an extended all-night session: WARIGIN generates long term excitement with its combination of fast-paced matches, high replayability and cross-match scoring.  

Every match in WARIGIN begins with a short bidding sequence to determine the challenger. He will - in exchange for unique advantages - lead his troops as an aggressor against the numerically superior defenders:

With a smart combination of hidden movements, powerful action cards and the exploitation of global events it is each player’s goal to conquer an opponent’s fortress in this asymmetric scenario.

WARIGIN - First Edition is delivered in a beautiful black box embossed with a deep black stamp.

This micro edition consists of high quality game materials (e.g. playing cards by ASS Altenburger) and is also manually improved: The heavyweight wooden hero meeples receive their concealed iron-branding in the same place as where I lovingly stamp and hand pack the boxes... my apartment.

The game contains everything that you need to enjoy WARIGIN as it is meant to be played:  

- 48 battle cards 
- 36 action cards including 12 elite cards 
- 33 heavy wooden meeples (18 soldiers, 15 iron-branded heroes) 
- 19 event cards 
- 3 faction cards 
- 3 game process overview cards 
- 2 8-sided dice 
- the manual 
- the board (high quality hex shaped acrylic glass board ~23.5cm)

Game design, illustration and manufacturing (except the US dice) has all been completed in Germany and I am proud to deliver Made in Germany quality to all players!  

Please note that pictures in other sections of this page and in the video might show an old prototype which used different materials (e.g. the board received an upgrade to acrylic glass). 
In addition, the card design was recently improved based on player feedback (a larger illustration with a smaller edge, for example). 
The final version of the heavyweight wooden meeples are each 29mm in size while the cards are 59x92mm.  

You can find all reviews, interviews, let's plays and explanations here (most of them in German currently - sorry).

Stefan, Boardgame Digger:
""Great, quick game! (...)
It is obvious that this game is ready! (...)
I think that it mixes things together in a great way!""

Martin, Austrian Board Gamer:  
""Pure excitement. This game is for Eternity.""

Michael, BrettspieleN Köln
""What an asskicking game and the creator is a great guy! 
It feels like a perfect 3 player PVP game designed by a Skat player!""

Michael, game designer of ""Rob'n'Run""
""WARIGIN is a very enjoyable game with simple rules and a short but intense play time.
The battle mechanism is my favourite. 
Congratulations to Christian for this great first project.""

 

WARIGIN is illustrated by Anna Kersten, one of my favorite fantasy artists. 
Her dark style truly brings the Eternal War between Heaven, Hell and the Void to life and makes WARIGIN a wonderful piece of art: Thank you Anna!

All illustrations - card graphics, board design etc - are based on hand painted ink skribbles before Anna digitizes and polishes them to guarantee WARIGIN’s unique look and feel.

While many PVP-oriented board games don't work very well with three factions (not at all or only with mediocre rule adjustments), in WARIGIN the inevitable 2 vs 1 situation is the perfect driving force for an asymmetric game design:

As a player you want to be the challenger and to fight alone against the combined enemy armies as often as possible - it is the route to exclusive perks and superior elite action cards... and the most efficient way of leading the inter-match, eternal ranking.  

Are you strong enough to challenge the other factions or do you forge an unholy alliance to minimize losses in the current match? 
 It might be a tiny victory point at the end of the evening that makes all the difference!

While in a three player match the challenger is up against the two other players, the two player setup represents another, very tough duel situation for both sides: 
When the second player gains control over the third faction and receives additional action cards every turn, the challenger is not only outnumbered against a better coordinated army but he must also fight against time.

If you are interested in checking out the rules in full you can find them here.

In addition, there are videos available here which explain the rules and show a complete match.

 

While WARIGIN is very easy to learn (you can jump right into the action within minutes thanks to the beginner scenario), it needs a lot of experience to master: 

With millions of potential starting hands and variable player strategies every match plays out differently: 
Although you know your own action cards and units (and after a while you might even anticipate which cards you are up against), events and enemy troops remain concealed until it might be too late.

While the original combat system uses dice for really(!) quick matches (15 minutes once you know the cards), I created - with the help of the community - a second, card based combat system: 
Although it takes a little bit more time the card system’s advantages include additional bluffing and tactical choices.

As I promised a complete game without any add-ons, the additional card deck, including the combat cards, is part of the First Edition, too.  

Due to the potential for very quick matches, the competitive bidding process, and the inter-match scoring system, WARIGIN is great for extended game sessions with multiple matches: 
Thanks to years of testing, no player who overplays his cards will win constantly. However, an aggressive approach with an above average starting hand remains the key to dominating eternity!

The offered perk contains the complete WARIGIN - First Edition.
I believe that you should encounter the full game experience if you choose to support my dream!

 

Unfortunately WARIGIN doesn't offer any gameplay related Stretchgoals and add ons because everything required for the best gaming experience is already included in the box. :)

I tried to come up with a simple shipping cost model and the result is as follows:
Shipping costs are already included with all pledge levels. 

Please note:
In general I'll ship your game within three days after your order (from December 1st, 2018).
Because I do this project alone there might be a small delay if I am abroad.

If you want to receive updates please follow WARIGIN on Twitter or subscribe to my Newsletter.

For all discussions about Warigin (either with other players or with me) visit WARIGIN on Facebook or Board Game Geek.

If you are a Let's Player, board game café or editor who is interested in WARIGIN please contact me directly via email: 
contact@3-headed-dog.com 

I will do my best to deliver a great WARIGIN experience to you.

Thank you very much for your support!

 

Legal Notice

Privacy Policy

WARIGIN ist ein konfliktorientiertes, schnelles Brettspiel. Es ist optimiert für zwei bis drei Spieler, die spannende taktische Herausforderungen in sich stets ändernden, asymmetrischen Fraktionskriegen suchen.

Das Spiel gehört keinem großen Verlag, sondern durfte dank einer Crowdfunding-Kampagne von ""einem Mann und seinem Hund"" in 2018 veröffentlicht werden.
Alle Einheiten aus der Ursprungskampagne sind bereits an die Unterstützer versandt.
Via Indiegogo Indemand hast du jetzt die Chance, die exklusive Erstauflage in einer wunderschönen, gestempelten Box und mit liebevoll gebrandmarkten Holzfiguren zu bestellen.

Als Brettspiel mit zusätzlichen Kartenspielelementen ist WARIGIN sowohl für das schnelle Spiel zwischendurch als auch für lange Spieleabende geeignet: 
Mit der Kombination aus schnellen Runden, hohem Wiederspielwert und spielübergreifendem Wertungssystem erzeugt WARIGIN langfristig Spannung.

In WARIGIN startet jedes Spiel mit einer schnellen Bietsequenz, um den Herausforderer zu bestimmen. Dieser führt - im Austausch für einzigartige Vorteile - seine Truppen alleine gegen die zahlenmäßig überlegenen Feinde. 

Mit einer klugen Kombination aus verdeckten Bewegungen, mächtigen Aktionskarten und Ausnutzen globaler Ereignisse ist es das Spielziel in dieser ungleichen Ausgangslage, die gegnerische Festung zu erobern.

Die WARIGIN-Erstauflage wird in einer schönen schwarzen Box mit einem tiefschwarzen Stempel versehen geliefert.

Die Kleinstauflage besteht aus hochwertigen Spielmaterialien (z.B. Spielkarten von ASS Altenburger), wird aber zusätzlich manuell bearbeitet:
Die Helden aus massiven Holzfiguren erhalten ihre verdeckte Wertigkeit am gleichen Ort, an dem ich auch die Boxen liebevoll stempel und per Hand packe... in meiner Wohnung.

Das Spiel enthält alles, was du zum WARIGIN spielen benötigst: 

 - 48 Kampfkarten 
- 36 Aktionskarten inklusive 12 Elitekarten
- 33 massive Holzfiguren (18 Soldaten, 15 Helden mit Brandzeichen)
- 19 Ereigniskarten
- 3 Fraktionskarten
- 3 Übersichtskarten
- 2 8-seitige Würfel 
- die Spielanleitung
- das Spielbrett (hochwertiges hexförmiges Acrylglas-Brett ~23,5cm)

WARIGIN ist zu 100% in Deutschland erfunden, illustriert und hergestellt (mit Ausnahme der US-Würfel) und ich bin stolz, allen Spielern Qualität Made in Germany zu liefern! 

Bitte beachtet, dass Bilder in anderen Abschnitten und im Video teilweise einen alten Prototypen mit anderen Spielmaterialien zeigen (z.B. hat das Spielbrett ein Upgrade auf Acrylglas bekommen), zudem wurde kürzlich das Kartendesign basierend auf Spielerfeedback angepasst (bedeutet: größere Illustrationen und kleinerer Kartenrand).
Die massiven Holzfiguren haben eine Höhe von 29mm, während die Karten 59x92mm groß sind.

Ihr findet alle Interviews, Let's Plays und ein Erklärvideo hier.

Stefan, Boardgame Digger: 
""Großartiges, schnelles Spiel! (...) 
Es ist offensichtlich, dass das Spiel fertig ist! (...) 
Ich denke, dass es Dinge großartig verbindet!""

Martin, Austrian Board Gamer:
""Spaß pur, das ist ein Spiel für die Ewigkeit!""

 Michael, BrettspieleN Köln:
""Watt n geiles Spiel und netter Autor! Es spielt sich als hätte ein Skatspieler ein perfektes 3-Spieler PVP gebaut!""

Michael, Spieleautor von ""Rob'n'Run"":  
""WARIGIN ist ein sehr unterhaltsames Spiel mit einfachen Regel und kurzer aber intensiver Spielzeit. Der Kampfmechanismus ist mein Highlight.
Herzlichen Glückwunsch an Christian zu diesem tollen ersten Projekt.""

WARIGIN ist illustriert von Anna Kersten, einer meiner liebsten Fantasy-Zeichnerinnen. Ihr dunkler Stil macht den Ewigen Krieg zwischen Himmel, Hölle und der Leere lebendig und aus WARIGIN ein wundervolles Kunstwerk: Danke Anna! 

Alle Illustrationen - Karten, Spielbrett, Titelbild etc - basieren auf handgezeichneten Tuschegrafiken, die Anna digitalisiert und dann bearbeitet, um den einzigartigen WARIGIN-Stil zu erschaffen. 

Während viele konfliktorientierte Brettspiele nicht gut mit drei Fraktionen funktionieren (überhaupt nicht oder nur mit mittelmäßigen Regelanpassungen), ist bei WARIGIN der unausweichliche 2-gegen-1-Konflikt zwischen den drei Fraktionen ein gewünschtes Element: 

Als Spieler willst du so oft es geht aus der initialen Bietsequenz als Herausforderer hervorgehen und deine Einheiten gegen die vereinten feindlichen Armeen führen - es ist dein Weg zu einzigartigen Optionen und mächtigen Karteneffekten… sowie deinem Sieg bei der spielübergreifenden, ewigen Endwertung. 

Bist Du stark genug, um die anderen Fraktionen herauszufordern oder schließt du eine unheilige Allianz, um die Verluste in dieser Runde zu minimieren?
Es mag ein einziger Siegpunkt am Ende des Abends sein, der den ganzen Unterschied macht!

Während in Drei-Spieler-Runden der Herausforderer gegen die beiden anderen Spieler und ihre Streitkräfte antritt, handelt es sich beim 2-Spieler-Setup um ein heftiges Duell für beide Seiten: 
Der zweite Spieler übernimmt die Kontrolle über die vereinten Armeen und erhält zusätzliche Aktionskarten in jeder Runde, so dass der Herausforderer nicht nur gegen eine Übermacht, sondern auch gegen die Zeit antritt.

Bei Interesse kannst du hier die kompletten Regeln nachlesen.

Zusätzlich findest du hier auch Videos, die die Regeln erklären sowie ein komplettes Spiel zeigen.

Obwohl WARIGIN sehr einfach zu lernen ist (du kannst innerhalb weniger Minuten das Einstiegsszenario starten), benötigt es viel Erfahrung um es zu meistern:

Aufgrund Millionen möglicher Starthände und abhängig von den individuellen Strategien spielt sich jedes Spiel anders:

Während du deine eigenen Aktionskarten und Einheiten kennst (und nach einer Weile vielleicht auch die Karten deiner Mitspieler antizipieren kannst), sind wichtige Informationen und gegnerische Einheiten verborgen, bis es vielleicht zu spät ist.

Während das ursprüngliche Kampfsystem Würfel nutzt für wirklich(!) schnelle Matches (15 Minuten, sobald man die Karten kennt), habe ich - mit der Hilfe der Community - ein zweites System mit Kampfkarten entwickelt: 
Auf wenn es etwas mehr Zeit benötigt, bietet es zusätzliche Bluffing- und Taktik-Möglichkeiten.

Dank der sehr schnellen Spiele, der kompetitiven Bietsequenz und des match-übergreifenden Wertungssystem ist WARIGIN auch großartig für lange Spieleabende mit mehreren Runden geeignet:
Aufgrund des jahrelangen Testens gewinnt kein Spieler fortlaufend, wenn er seine Karten überreizt, während auf der anderen Seite nur ein aggressiver Ansatz bei guten Starthänden der Schlüssel ist, um die Ewigkeit zu beherrschen.

Alle Pakete beinhalten die WARIGIN-Erstauflage: Ich denke, dass jeder die komplette Spielerfahrung erhalten sollte, wenn er meinen Traum unterstützt!

Leider bietet WARIGIN keine spielbezogenen Kampagnenziele und Addons, da bereits alles für die beste Spielerfahrung in der Box enthalten ist. :)

Ich habe nach einer einfachen Versandlösung gesucht und das Ergebnis ist: Die Versandkosten sind bereits in den Belohnungen enthalten.

Bitte beachtet:
Im Normalfall verschicke ich dein Spiel innerhalb von drei Tagen (ab 1. Dezember 2018).
Da ich das alles selber mache, kann sich dies ggf. geringfügig verzögern, falls ich unterwegs sein sollte.

Wenn du alle Neuigkeiten erhalten willst, folge WARIGIN via Twitter oder abonniere meinen  Newsletter. 

Für alle Diskussionen zu WARIGIN (mit anderen Spielern oder mir) nutze bitte Facebook und Board Game Geek.

Falls du ein Let’s Player, Brettspiel-Café oder Redakteur bist, kontaktiere mich bitte via Email: 
contact@3-headed-dog.com 

Ich tue mein Bestes, um euch eine tolle WARIGIN-Erfahrung zu liefern.

Vielen Dank für deine Unterstützung!

Datenschutzerklärung / Privacy Policy

","WARIGIN is a highly competitive, rapid boardgame. It is designed and optimized for two to three players who enjoy exciting tactical matches in everchanging asymmetric faction wars.The game doesn't belong to a big publisher but thanks to a crowdfunding campaign ""a man and his dog"" were able to release WARIGIN in 2018. All units from the original campaign are sent to the initial backers already.Via Indiegogo Indemand you now have the chance to order the exclusive First Edition in a beautiful hand-stamped box with lovingly hand-branded meeples.A tabletop board game with additional card game mechanics, WARIGIN is perfect for a quick blast or an extended all-night session: WARIGIN generates long term excitement with its combination of fast-paced matches, high replayability and cross-match scoring.  Every match in WARIGIN begins with a short bidding sequence to determine the challenger. He will - in exchange for unique advantages - lead his troops as an aggressor against the numerically superior defenders:With a smart combination of hidden movements, powerful action cards and the exploitation of global events it is each player’s goal to conquer an opponent’s fortress in this asymmetric scenario.WARIGIN - First Edition is delivered in a beautiful black box embossed with a deep black stamp.This micro edition consists of high quality game materials (e.g. playing cards by ASS Altenburger) and is also manually improved: The heavyweight wooden hero meeples receive their concealed iron-branding in the same place as where I lovingly stamp and hand pack the boxes... my apartment.The game contains everything that you need to enjoy WARIGIN as it is meant to be played:  - 48 battle cards - 36 action cards including 12 elite cards - 33 heavy wooden meeples (18 soldiers, 15 iron-branded heroes) - 19 event cards - 3 faction cards - 3 game process overview cards - 2 8-sided dice - the manual - the board (high quality hex shaped acrylic glass board ~23.5cm)Game design, illustration and manufacturing (except the US dice) has all been completed in Germany and I am proud to deliver Made in Germany quality to all players!  Please note that pictures in other sections of this page and in the video might show an old prototype which used different materials (e.g. the board received an upgrade to acrylic glass). In addition, the card design was recently improved based on player feedback (a larger illustration with a smaller edge, for example). The final version of the heavyweight wooden meeples are each 29mm in size while the cards are 59x92mm.  You can find all reviews, interviews, let's plays and explanations here (most of them in German currently - sorry).Stefan, Boardgame Digger:""Great, quick game! (...)It is obvious that this game is ready! (...)I think that it mixes things together in a great way!""Martin, Austrian Board Gamer:  ""Pure excitement. This game is for Eternity.""Michael, BrettspieleN Köln""What an asskicking game and the creator is a great guy! It feels like a perfect 3 player PVP game designed by a Skat player!""

Michael, game designer of ""Rob'n'Run""""WARIGIN is a very enjoyable game with simple rules and a short but intense play time.The battle mechanism is my favourite. Congratulations to Christian for this great first project."" WARIGIN is illustrated by Anna Kersten, one of my favorite fantasy artists. Her dark style truly brings the Eternal War between Heaven, Hell and the Void to life and makes WARIGIN a wonderful piece of art: Thank you Anna!All illustrations - card graphics, board design etc - are based on hand painted ink skribbles before Anna digitizes and polishes them to guarantee WARIGIN’s unique look and feel.While many PVP-oriented board games don't work very well with three factions (not at all or only with mediocre rule adjustments), in WARIGIN the inevitable 2 vs 1 situation is the perfect driving force for an asymmetric game design:As a player you want to be the challenger and to fight alone against the combined enemy armies as often as possible - it is the route to exclusive perks and superior elite action cards... and the most efficient way of leading the inter-match, eternal ranking.  Are you strong enough to challenge the other factions or do you forge an unholy alliance to minimize losses in the current match?  It might be a tiny victory point at the end of the evening that makes all the difference!While in a three player match the challenger is up against the two other players, the two player setup represents another, very tough duel situation for both sides: When the second player gains control over the third faction and receives additional action cards every turn, the challenger is not only outnumbered against a better coordinated army but he must also fight against time.If you are interested in checking out the rules in full you can find them here.In addition, there are videos available here which explain the rules and show a complete match. While WARIGIN is very easy to learn (you can jump right into the action within minutes thanks to the beginner scenario), it needs a lot of experience to master: With millions of potential starting hands and variable player strategies every match plays out differently: Although you know your own action cards and units (and after a while you might even anticipate which cards you are up against), events and enemy troops remain concealed until it might be too late.While the original combat system uses dice for really(!) quick matches (15 minutes once you know the cards), I created - with the help of the community - a second, card based combat system: Although it takes a little bit more time the card system’s advantages include additional bluffing and tactical choices.As I promised a complete game without any add-ons, the additional card deck, including the combat cards, is part of the First Edition, too.  Due to the potential for very quick matches, the competitive bidding process, and the inter-match scoring system, WARIGIN is great for extended game sessions with multiple matches: Thanks to years of testing, no player who overplays his cards will win constantly. However, an aggressive approach with an above average starting hand remains the key to dominating eternity!The offered perk contains the complete WARIGIN - First Edition.I believe that you should encounter the full game experience if you choose to support my dream! Unfortunately WARIGIN doesn't offer any gameplay related Stretchgoals and add ons because everything required for the best gaming experience is already included in the box. :)I tried to come up with a simple shipping cost model and the result is as follows:Shipping costs are already included with all pledge levels. Please note:In general I'll ship your game within three days after your order (from December 1st, 2018).Because I do this project alone there might be a small delay if I am abroad.If you want to receive updates please follow WARIGIN on Twitter or subscribe to my Newsletter.For all discussions about Warigin (either with other players or with me) visit WARIGIN on Facebook or Board Game Geek.If you are a Let's Player, board game café or editor who is interested in WARIGIN please contact me directly via email: contact@3-headed-dog.com I will do my best to deliver a great WARIGIN experience to you.Thank you very much for your support! Legal NoticePrivacy PolicyWARIGIN ist ein konfliktorientiertes, schnelles Brettspiel. We are a mix of professionals brought together by a shared love of football (for our American friends, we mean ‘soccer’)! Like sports fans all over the world, we enjoy making the big match into a social event – drinks, snacks and friends are mandatory!

There are different types of football fan:

Some of us are the hardcore supporters and ‘armchair managers’, and then you’ve got the more casual fans: partners and relatives and those who simply enjoy the social side. We wanted to bring everyone closer together while keeping the focus on the football.

BetField gives hardcore fans the chance to put their knowledge to the test, while the more casual fans feel more involved in the excitement. Everyone gets a stake in the game and an extra incentive to follow the action, so you and your friends have a more memorable experience together on match day!
column3: >1. Select the match-events you think will happen. Choose from a range of event-cards.
column5: >
column6:
>2. Make your predictions by placing tokens on different parts of the board.
Predictions can be added to!
(Total amount of tokens is limited)
column8: >
column9:
>3. Sit back and watch the match! Win or lose tokens as events occur.
Each correct prediction may be claimed up to a maximum of four times, in each match-half.
column10: >
column12: >4. Make further predictions​ during the match (with certain obvious exceptions, for example: you can’t make predictions on events that have already taken place!)
column15: >5. At half time, scan the results with the automatic scoring app: winners collect tokens!
column17: >
column20: >6. Before the second half, collect the event cards and make new predictions.
column23:
>7. Enjoy the second half in the same way – at full-time, scan results using the automatic scoring app, collect tokens, and announce the overall winner!

Once we have reached our first target, we will complete stage one development of our innovative scoring app. This app will then be included in ‘All-in’ purchases, via a download code (code will be emailed to those customers who have already purchased BetField ‘All-in’).

Install the BetField scoring app quickly and easily on your smartphone to enjoy these enhanced features:
column25: >Turns your phone into a QR-code reader, programmed to 'read' the BetField table and the position of tokens and cards. Instantly add up points and confirm winners and ranking.
column26: >Instant results share on social media*
column27: >Let your friends know who you are with, what match you are watching, and who among you is the football genius of the evening!
column29:
>With the app installed on your phone, you can choose to be alerted about future matches, with a function for planning watch-and-play events with your friends!

*Added app features subject to reaching second target.

*Scoring app will be included/made available for download once we reach our first target and complete app development.
column30:
>Our mission is to give football fans a brand-new and enhanced home experience watching live matches. We want to make TV football a better focus than ever before for bringing friends together around a fun and inclusive activity.

We've been working for several years now on developing the market-ready version of BetField.
column31: >Here is the development story:
column32: >
column33: >Alternative ways to support us
column34: >If you are a football fan, we hope you are now convinced that you should choose a perk immediately! :)
column35:
>Even if you are not a football fan, you probably have a friend who is, right?
Tell them about BetField, they'll surely appreciate it – we do, too!

Follow us for FREE match alerts and tips!

 https://www.facebook.com/betfield.eu/

https://twitter.com/betfield_

https://www.instagram.com/betfield_/

","We are a mix of professionals brought together by a shared love of football (for our American friends, we mean ‘soccer’)! Like sports fans all over the world, we enjoy making the big match into a social event – drinks, snacks and friends are mandatory!__________________________

column1: There are different types of football fan:Some of us are the hardcore supporters and ‘armchair managers’, and then you’ve got the more casual fans: partners and relatives and those who simply enjoy the social side. We wanted to bring everyone closer together while keeping the focus on the football.BetField gives hardcore fans the chance to put their knowledge to the test, while the more casual fans feel more involved in the excitement. Everyone gets a stake in the game and an extra incentive to follow the action, so you and your friends have a more memorable experience together on match day!1. Select the match-events you think will happen. Choose from a range of event-cards. 2. Make your predictions by placing tokens on different parts of the board.Predictions can be added to!(Total amount of tokens is limited) 3. Sit back and watch the match! Win or lose tokens as events occur.Each correct prediction may be claimed up to a maximum of four times, in each match-half. 4. Make further predictions​ during the match (with certain obvious exceptions, for example: you can’t make predictions on events that have already taken place!) 5. At half time, scan the results with the automatic scoring app: winners collect tokens! 6. Before the second half, collect the event cards and make new predictions. 7. Enjoy the second half in the same way – at full-time, scan results using the automatic scoring app, collect tokens, and announce the overall winner!Once we have reached our first target, we will complete stage one development of our innovative scoring app. This app will then be included in ‘All-in’ purchases, via a download code (code will be emailed to those customers who have already purchased BetField ‘All-in’).Install the BetField scoring app quickly and easily on your smartphone to enjoy these enhanced features:Instant results scan and calculationTurns your phone into a QR-code reader, programmed to 'read' the BetField table and the position of tokens and cards. Instantly add up points and confirm winners and ranking. Instant results share on social media*Let your friends know who you are with, what match you are watching, and who among you is the football genius of the evening!Alerts for upcoming matches*With the app installed on your phone, you can choose to be alerted about future matches, with a function for planning watch-and-play events with your friends!*Added app features subject to reaching second target.*Scoring app will be included/made available for download once we reach our first target and complete app development.Our mission is to give football fans a brand-new and enhanced home experience watching live matches. We want to make TV football a better focus than ever before for bringing friends together around a fun and inclusive activity.We've been working for several years now on developing the market-ready version of BetField.Here is the development story: Alternative ways to support usIf you are a football fan, we hope you are now convinced that you should choose a perk immediately! :)Even if you are not a football fan, you probably have a friend who is, right?Tell them about BetField, they'll surely appreciate it – we do, too!Follow us for FREE match alerts and tips! https://www.facebook.com/betfield.eu/https://twitter.com/betfield_https://www.instagram.com/betfield_/",28.0,0,"1 Campaign

TIPSY is a drinking board game for up to 6 players. Game is packed in a small can that fits in your backpack, purse, or bigger pocket. It features creative components and unique playing style.
Our goal is to get people to hangout, instead of hanging on their phones.
Tipsy in designed to travel with you everywhere you go!
<ul>
•  Tipsy is very easy to play.
<li>Open the CAN -&gt
<li>on marked place -&gt
column2: Set figures and determine who will first throw the dices (you can throw the dices and who has the biggest number, starts the game).

column1: • Combination of both dices will show you where you have to move.

• Player can go to the field Love, Drinking or Challenge. When player is on the field he/she has to take card from the defined deck and do the task. If player refuses or unsuccessfully completes the task he/she must return card under the deck and take a sip.
• Sometimes player can come to the field which does not require card withdrawal and must complete the task written on the field.
• If player comes to the DIEmond shot field, every player put a drink of his/her choice in large glass and he/she has to drink it bottom up.
<li>When two players arrive on the same field they play the game: Rock, Paper, Scissors. -&gt
column2: Winner gets one card from the opponent.

Winner of the game can determine punishment to the player with least cards.

The shipping fee is automatically added to your pledge at checkout. Shipping to USA, Australia and Canada won't incur VAT/import duties. 

This project is customs and VAT friendly because of its pricing. You may incur duties in some countries, but only if there's more than one game in your order.
We are happy to offer you worldwide shipping with one of the global market leaders in the logistics industry, DHL Express.
For more transparent prices of shipping rates you can look at the table bellow.
Two friends knowing each other from when they were born, had a strong desire to become entrepreneurs.

We come from a small European country called Slovenia. It is one of the greenest countries in Europe and her sLOVEnian heart is full of charming forests, magnificent mountains and petite seacoast that make you feel you can achieve everything you dreamed about.

This is what defined us in pursuing our goal to create something with our hands and offer it to you. However Slovenia with just 2 million people quickly became to small for our big dreams so we have decided to look for your support in order to create English version of our game.
Are you excited to hear about how our idea of creating a drinking game became reality?

""Living in times where you go to a party but everyone is hanging on their phones, having short conversations, a lot of drinking but not much laugh or funny stories. So one night hanging by the pool we were figuring out how to spice up dreamy evening, and we came up with the idea of creating drinking board game. Immediately we knew what our game would look like. That's why our game has some amazing features. It is portable, has spill-proof game boar, unique playing figures and much more...""

However our main goal is to bring people back together, make them laugh and create opportunities that you can meet a girl or a boy not just by swiping your finger on an app but actually by talking  to them and finding out about their true passions and interests.
<h3>WHAT WE NEED &amp

Our goal is to raise funds to manufacture English version of Tipsy. With your support we will be able to order all the necessary components and material for the game (Can, board, playing figures, playing cards, dices, boxes, etc.). We also need money for marketing purposes, printing and other activities needed to successfully run a business.
If we won't achieve our financial goal we will still fulfill our obligation to potential backers and create English version with our savings.
THE IMPACT

We started with our project back in 2016 and due to good feedback from Slovenian customers we decided to expand globally. With more than 700 Tipsy games sold we are confident we can manage bigger orders from all around the world. Become our supporter and help us spread Tipsy way of life all around the world.
<h3>RISK &amp

We prepared thoroughly, however there can always be some bumps on the road you don't expect. Our production and logistics are managed up front and we don't expect any setbacks. However if there will be much more supporters than we expect there could be some delays in delivery.
In any case we will do our best to inform you up to date and let you know soon enough when to expect your TIPSY.
If you will decide to show us your support we guarantee you we will do everything not to let you down. Your help and support will make our dreams come true.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Do you read this?

It means you came to the end of our story and if you like what you read but not sure to make a contribution, that's not a problem. There are other ways you can show us your support and spread the word:
- Share this campaign with the button above,
- Tell all your friends to get their own copy, as you won't be loaning yours to anyone, because we all know people never return things, right?
- Like and follow us on Facebook:
- Follow us on Instagram:
- Come and visit our website http://www.mycangames.com/en
","TIPSY is a drinking board game for up to 6 players. Game is packed in a small can that fits in your backpack, purse, or bigger pocket. It features creative components and unique playing style.
Our goal is to get people to hangout, instead of hanging on their phones.
Tipsy in designed to travel with you everywhere you go!
Tipsy is very easy to play.
Open the CAN -> Unfold the game board -> Put card
on marked place -> Set figures and determine who will first throw the dices (you can throw the dices and who has the biggest number, starts the game).
Combination of both dices will show you where you have to move.

Player can go to the field Love, Drinking or Challenge. When player is on the field he/she has to take card from the defined deck and do the task. If player refuses or unsuccessfully completes the task he/she must return card under the deck and take a sip.
Sometimes player can come to the field which does not require card withdrawal and must complete the task written on the field.
If player comes to the DIEmond shot field, every player put a drink of his/her choice in large glass and he/she has to drink it bottom up.
When two players arrive on the same field they play the game: Rock, Paper, Scissors. -> Winner gets one card from the opponent.
Winner is the player with most cards.
Winner of the game can determine punishment to the player with least cards.

For more transparent prices of shipping rates you can look at the table bellow.

It's Finally Here!

Enter the Magical Realm of Quintangled, a unique and inspiring board game of Strategy, Chance, and the mysterious element of Destiny! Not a game of war or domination, Quintangled is a thoughtful experience that offers a metaphor for life's universal journey.

Channel your inner hero and quench your thirst for adventure as you explore the enchanted World of Quintangled.  Every game experience will be different as you navigate the many opportunities and encounter twists of Fate that will craft a different outcome each time you play. This game is a fun experience that is a metaphor for the universal journey of life that transcends time and culture. In Quintangled, as in life, we are the ones who must become heroic and save the world.

Begin by rolling the eight-sided die to determine the Character you will assume: Knight, Lover, Jester, Healer, Dreamer, Sage, Monarch, or Priestess. Journey to The Wizard's Castle, meet the Wizard, and receive Magical Aid.

Step onto your chosen path to begin your adventure. The game’s unique two-part structure challenges players to see how choice changes everything and motives can make all the difference. Along the way, you'll meet Oracles of Wisdom, helpers and hinderers, and encounter perils and pitfalls. You will learn how choices, random quirks of Fate, and the landscape of the game impact your character's destiny. In the first half of the game, your character will traverse the winding paths of the World of Quintangled as you visit all four element corners and perform your Shadow Act. You will then enter The Abyss, obtain your character's talisman of power, meet your animal ally, and perform Heroic Feats as you prepare to journey home.  You will also encounter unexpected aid, gain wisdom, and earn points to become heroic and fulfill your character's quest.

In Quintangled the archetype characters are called away from their ordinary life to embark upon a journey along a five-sided path -- a quintile -- where they must encounter forces that could keep them from their destiny. Each game character must accomplish particular tasks and gather wisdom along the way as they travel their path to return home. As you and your fellow players vie to win the game, success is largely a function of your choices, your chosen strategy, the opportunities presented by your rolls of the die, and the elements of Fate and Magical Aid.
The Details
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: Up to 8 people can play Quintangled, but we recommend between 3 to 6 players to allow the game to proceed at a steady pace.
AGE:  Appropriate for adults and kids ages 14 and above.
PLAYTIME:  Depends on the number of players
column2: an average game lasts approximately one to one and a half hours.

column1: SET-UP:  Game board set-up is easy and fast: place cards and tokens in their appropriate places as marked on the game board and on the easy-to-follow rules card.

HOW TO WIN THE GAME:  Unlike most games, where the first player to arrive home wins, in Quintangled once the first player returns home, all players tally their points to learn who has earned the most points through accomplishing feats, overcoming perils, and obtaining Wisdom cards. Part of the strategy of the game is to keep an eye on what your opponents have achieved!
WHAT COMES WITH THE GAME:

1.  A colorful and visually exciting game board.
2.  An 8-sided die and the game tokens you will need as you play the game.
3.  Character cards, a deck of Magical Aid cards, a deck of Fortune cards, animal ally tokens and talisman cards -- all to be earned as players traverse the board.
4.  A two-sided Q card which provides all the instructions to easily and quickly learn to play the game.
5.  Quintangled: A Deeper Look, a short booklet written by Julie Loar. This booklet contains additional information about the character archetypes, the classic heroic journey, and other symbolic aspects of the game for anyone who wants to learn more.  Reading the booklet is neither required nor necessary but is included to provide additional depth for those who desire it.

Five years in the making, Quintangled is the 'brainchild' of esoteric scholar and author Julie Loar, and developed by Loar with author-illustrator Susan Andra Lion, and Satiama co-founder Karen Stuth. The gorgeous game board design and illustrations are the work of team member Lion, whose contribution of design and artwork have brought special magic to the game.

Our game is built on timeless and universal patterns and archetypes and is a fun way to learn -- while playing a game -- about people and experiences that are part of life. After five years of creative work we’re ready to share this with the world, but we need your help. In an increasingly digital world, board games are experiencing a resurgence, allowing people to reconnect and share. You can be among the very first to own your own copy of Quintangeld at a discounted price. Thank you for all your love and support. We loved creating this game and hope you will enjoy it as well!
What We Need

To affordably bring forward our game at a lower cost per unit, we would like to presell at least 800 games through this campaign. We are offering our game at slightly below our final retail price, plus the cost of shipping. If we don't meet our goal, we will still manufacture games, but at a much higher cost. However, we will definitely deliver our games and every campaign perk. Our game will be manufactured by Board Game Manufacturing.

Satiama has a strong history of successful performance and delivery in other crowdfunding initiatives.  Quintangled is an engaging, delightful, and strategic game that also invites players to become cognizant of their own life journey, with its many unexpected zigs and zags. For those who have deeper interest, many will even learn about the qualities of certain archetypes and how each player's quest is also the quest in search of our greater self! But others will simply enjoy Quintangled, an entertaining board game of quest and adventure.  This game is on its way!  Help us bring the magical experience of Quintangled to the ordinary world.

Our only challenge is simply getting the word out and lowering our manufacturing costs by being able to place a larger order.  Our game has been extensively beta-tested, our files are ready and we are excited to bring Quintangled forward to the world.
Want to Help?

Don't allow your friends to live a Quintangled-free life! Order extra copies for your family and friends!  After all, Christmas and birthdays are always coming.  Share our campaign URL in social media, in your newsletters, on your websites, in email, text, and through word of mouth.  Let us know of your efforts and we will show our appreciation by 'shouting you out' in our social media platforms and more!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools today! We are truly grateful for your support and assistance .

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h3 style=""text-align: center
column3:
>

Slayer's Frontier is a Finnish tabletop roleplaying game based on the 5th edition open game license rule set as the foundation, with the focus on creating faster paced and dynamic combat experiences. 

With the base mechanics of 5th edition d20 rules in place, most changes are in how classes and combat are handled. Oh, did we mention classes? Oh my, as there actually aren't any classes. Each character is able to choose from a list of features that they fulfill the requirements for, and create a skillset fitting their own playstyle and choice of weapon. 

The combat has had the largest overhaul, moving from an action type based economy to an action point based economy, with each character having a set number of action points available to them each round to use regular actions, or spend more action points to execute special actions granted by their choice of features. 

Part of character progression has also been moved to equipment with a crafting system, allowing the creation of new and exciting weapons and armors using materials from the creatures the characters have slain. 

Along with the overhauled combat rules, the game also comes with a completely new set of monsters, and a toolkit to convert 5th edition monsters to be compatible with Slayer's Frontier and vice-versa.
column5:
>

For me, roleplaying games represent the thrill the exploration of the endless widths of imagination: finding and trying something new that you might not have thought to do before. Despite the games on the market allowing for such play, it stemmed more from the whims of the game master and the players, rather than the game itself. Most of the time the game just facilitated killing monsters and taking the loot.

I was inspired by a few action games that have come out in the recent years. One, where every step you take while in combat needs to be considered to the end, or you’ll end up getting hurt, the game encouraging the player to bide their time. The other, a game about going after monsters, fighting them in fast-paced battles, and yet respect the nature presented. Both of these games exist, yet there wasn’t anything like them on the tabletop. 

To create something new, to create something that would aid in the stories I would like to tell and play. The thrill of the hunt, preparation for a quest, meticulous planning, blood pumping action. Those are what drives the creation and gameplay of Slayer's Frontier onwards.

- Joonas Lind, designer: Slayer's Frontier
column6:
>

In Slayer's Frontier, the player takes on the role of a hunter, a mix of warrior and scholar, and venture out onto the frontier to confront and slay a variety of creatures, most larger than life.

Your choices matter. Not every foe is defeatable by brute force alone, but require some choice equipment or cunning tactic of action to be taken down. And the stronger foes you face and conquer, the stronger materials you'll be able to get to create stronger equipment to face even stronger foes. 

Hunting monsters like the bizarre Stormcaller, the mountainlike Sierra Dragon Turtle or other tough creatures and exploring the world of untrodden lands are at the core of Slayer's Frontier.
column7:
>

Slayer's Frontier rules can be used to play in a variety of fantasy settings, but the book also comes with the setting of Elerest, a formerly lustrous and thriving world of high fantasy, now in a state of lull due to an apocalyptic event in the past.

Now reset, with remnants of the ancient civilizations hidden away in ruins and the far reaches of the land and inadvertently guarded by a variety of creatures, some never before seen. 

Explore the land of Elerest, be it for searching new exotic creatures to make a new fancy set of gear, or delve into the ancient past to find what was lost and why in the ancient past.
column8:
>

The book will be available in PDF and Print-on-Demand formats supported by DriveThruRPG, all in full color. The book itself will be roughly 250 pages, including all the rules you need to play, and the setting of Elerest. The game presented in this campaign will have a page size of A4.
column9:
>

Almost the entire ruleset has been written and is being playtested, and the writing, layout, and art production prior to delivering is well underway. The current release date will be by the end of July 2018. 

The game will be delivered using DriveThruRPG in all of the presented formats.
column10:
>

The team behind Slayer's Frontier is an up-start tabletop game publisher Wooden Cauldron.

Joonas Lind - Designer and writer. Joonas is a Finnish marketing content creator with a decade-long tenure as a tabletop RPG game master. Slayer's Frontier is his first design to be released.

Otso Päiväniemi - Artist. Otso is one of those strange artists who learned how to stop comparing himself to other artists and embrace the endless mastering of his own style. Can easily be recognized by a purple bandana

Eetu Paavola - Layout and graphic design. Purveyour if minimalism and the one to make sure that the game is readable at a glance. 

Mika Leminen - Marketing. Marketing mastermind behind Wooden Cauldron's branding.
column12:
>

Majority of the funds generated will be used to deliver the product on time to the pledgers. This includes the costs of printing the book via DriveThruRPG, covering for the expenses of the production, and forming a foundation for upcoming games made by Wooden Cauldron. The game itself will, however, be finished regardless of the total campaign success.

<li>

column3:
>

The game's rules are almost finalized and are being playtested. We would like to work for the game with every minute of the day, but that is not possible yet - so the team is working part-time on the game. Delays, though currently unlikely, can occur due to time being taken by other occupations. The game also is the first game created by Wooden Cauldron, and thus, unforeseen challenges may arise.
column4:
> 

Why is this campaign on IndieGoGo and not Kickstarter? We're operating from Finland, and Kickstarter is not an option here for legal reasons. Because of this, we had to opt for Indiegogo.
column5:
>

Want to have a try and see how the game plays in person? Our playtest is still ongoing, and you can find it here.
column6:
>

You can find us and up-to-date news about the game on the following pages:

• Twitter
• Website

","Slayer's Frontier is a Finnish tabletop roleplaying game based on the 5th edition open game license rule set as the foundation, with the focus on creating faster paced and dynamic combat experiences. With the base mechanics of 5th edition d20 rules in place, most changes are in how classes and combat are handled. Oh, did we mention classes? Oh my, as there actually aren't any classes. Each character is able to choose from a list of features that they fulfill the requirements for, and create a skillset fitting their own playstyle and choice of weapon. The combat has had the largest overhaul, moving from an action type based economy to an action point based economy, with each character having a set number of action points available to them each round to use regular actions, or spend more action points to execute special actions granted by their choice of features. Part of character progression has also been moved to equipment with a crafting system, allowing the creation of new and exciting weapons and armors using materials from the creatures the characters have slain. Along with the overhauled combat rules, the game also comes with a completely new set of monsters, and a toolkit to convert 5th edition monsters to be compatible with Slayer's Frontier and vice-versa.For me, roleplaying games represent the thrill the exploration of the endless widths of imagination: finding and trying something new that you might not have thought to do before. Despite the games on the market allowing for such play, it stemmed more from the whims of the game master and the players, rather than the game itself. Most of the time the game just facilitated killing monsters and taking the loot.I was inspired by a few action games that have come out in the recent years. One, where every step you take while in combat needs to be considered to the end, or you’ll end up getting hurt, the game encouraging the player to bide their time. The other, a game about going after monsters, fighting them in fast-paced battles, and yet respect the nature presented. Both of these games exist, yet there wasn’t anything like them on the tabletop. To create something new, to create something that would aid in the stories I would like to tell and play. The thrill of the hunt, preparation for a quest, meticulous planning, blood pumping action. Those are what drives the creation and gameplay of Slayer's Frontier onwards.- Joonas Lind, designer: Slayer's FrontierIn Slayer's Frontier, the player takes on the role of a hunter, a mix of warrior and scholar, and venture out onto the frontier to confront and slay a variety of creatures, most larger than life.Your choices matter. Not every foe is defeatable by brute force alone, but require some choice equipment or cunning tactic of action to be taken down. And the stronger foes you face and conquer, the stronger materials you'll be able to get to create stronger equipment to face even stronger foes. Hunting monsters like the bizarre Stormcaller, the mountainlike Sierra Dragon Turtle or other tough creatures and exploring the world of untrodden lands are at the core of Slayer's Frontier. Slayer's Frontier rules can be used to play in a variety of fantasy settings, but the book also comes with the setting of Elerest, a formerly lustrous and thriving world of high fantasy, now in a state of lull due to an apocalyptic event in the past.Now reset, with remnants of the ancient civilizations hidden away in ruins and the far reaches of the land and inadvertently guarded by a variety of creatures, some never before seen. Explore the land of Elerest, be it for searching new exotic creatures to make a new fancy set of gear, or delve into the ancient past to find what was lost and why in the ancient past. The book will be available in PDF and Print-on-Demand formats supported by DriveThruRPG, all in full color. The book itself will be roughly 250 pages, including all the rules you need to play, and the setting of Elerest. The game presented in this campaign will have a page size of A4.Almost the entire ruleset has been written and is being playtested, and the writing, layout, and art production prior to delivering is well underway. The current release date will be by the end of July 2018. The game will be delivered using DriveThruRPG in all of the presented formats.The team behind Slayer's Frontier is an up-start tabletop game publisher Wooden Cauldron.Joonas Lind - Designer and writer. Joonas is a Finnish marketing content creator with a decade-long tenure as a tabletop RPG game master. Slayer's Frontier is his first design to be released.Otso Päiväniemi - Artist. Otso is one of those strange artists who learned how to stop comparing himself to other artists and embrace the endless mastering of his own style. Can easily be recognized by a purple bandanaEetu Paavola - Layout and graphic design. Purveyour if minimalism and the one to make sure that the game is readable at a glance. Mika Leminen - Marketing. Marketing mastermind behind Wooden Cauldron's branding.Majority of the funds generated will be used to deliver the product on time to the pledgers. This includes the costs of printing the book via DriveThruRPG, covering for the expenses of the production, and forming a foundation for upcoming games made by Wooden Cauldron. The game itself will, however, be finished regardless of the total campaign success.
