column2: marketing to a larger crowdfunding campaign.

column1: <center>
</center>
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >What makes this card game unique amongst other card games in the market?

column1: This game is about card fighting and economy building, with the overall goal of winning by defeating all enemies or win by reaching 100 food stacks. All insect race have their own unique strengths and weaknesses, with some races geared more towards economy building with weak but cheap units, while others have strong military supremacy but expensive units.

Upkeeping - As part of the rules of the game, you can upkeep up to 5 cards in your hand unless you can pay the upkeep fee for exceeding cards. Upkeep fee is equivalent to the number of excess cards in your hand. For example, if you have 7 cards in your hand, you have 2 upkeep cards, so you will have to pay 2 food at the end of your turn, or pay 2 Hive life points, or discard the card. It’s not just about producing or summoning units, you need to build a large food income in order to use insect skills, produce units, repair your Hive &
Another fun feature of the game, you get to play as those pesty bugs!
Game Play Variants: 2 to 4 players
Free for All
Game Objective: Reduce opponents Hive health points to zero or or attain a stack of 100 Food.
2 vs 2 Cooperative
Game Objective: Reduce opponent's Hive life points to zero or collectively gain a total stack of 300 Food.
Player turn order - Cooperative
Player 1 &
Turn 1 - Player 1
Turn 2 - Player 3
Turn 3 - Player 2
Turn 4 - Player 4
Action Stage applies to all players’ turn.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
1.Choose Faction: Players choose which insect race they wish to play.
2.Place Hive Card: Each player puts their Hive card in the field. A Hive has 30 Health Points. (If it drops to zero, that player is eliminated.)
3.Determine Play Order: Select which player begins, play then continues clockwise.
4.Draw Hand: All players draw 5 cards from their chosen deck and receive 10 Food each.
5.First Turn: The Action Stage begins now. (See Rule Book Page 4)

column1: Colony Clash: Insect Warfare is a card game where players fight using their chosen insect race to defeat the other players. Players build food production resources and their insect army over the course of the game to achieve victory!
Colony Clash can be played by 2 to 4 players. Each player controls one of four species

column1: SEDA Interactive

Supporters of Colony Clash: Insect Warfare, Its been 2 years since we developed this creepy crawling insect card game. That is 2 years without any game update due to funds issue from the last KS campaign. Now we are back in Adding more insect race/deck to the core game and is planned to have a reboot/new version with improved game arts, logo, card template, back card art and many more. We plan to have the new version a minimal components to avoid previous unwanted expenses, bringing back the default components to paper/cardboard, Light weight components, small game box for shipment size.
However, in order for us to continue the game reboot & expansion, we need your help.
We are in-need of $1750. This will actually pay-off all the expenses of the game arts, that includes 4 race decks, logos, prototypes & advance copies of the game.
We plan to develop 40-50 advance copies of the game's version 2 to help us with the game review & marketing to a larger crowdfunding campaign.
What makes this card game unique amongst other card games in the market?

This game is about card fighting and economy building, with the overall goal of winning by defeating all enemies or win by reaching 100 food stacks. All insect race have their own unique strengths and weaknesses, with some races geared more towards economy building with weak but cheap units, while others have strong military supremacy but expensive units.

Upkeeping - As part of the rules of the game, you can upkeep up to 5 cards in your hand unless you can pay the upkeep fee for exceeding cards. Upkeep fee is equivalent to the number of excess cards in your hand. For example, if you have 7 cards in your hand, you have 2 upkeep cards, so you will have to pay 2 food at the end of your turn, or pay 2 Hive life points, or discard the card. It’s not just about producing or summoning units, you need to build a large food income in order to use insect skills, produce units, repair your Hive & get Hive life points back.
Another fun feature of the game, you get to play as those pesty bugs!
Game Play Variants: 2 to 4 players
Free for All
Game Objective: Reduce opponents Hive health points to zero or or attain a stack of 100 Food.
2 vs 2 Cooperative
Game Objective: Reduce opponent's Hive life points to zero or collectively gain a total stack of 300 Food.
Player turn order - Cooperative
Player 1 & Player 2 versus Player 3 & Player 4
Turn 1 - Player 1
Turn 2 - Player 3
Turn 3 - Player 2
Turn 4 - Player 4
Action Stage applies to all players’ turn.
Game Setup
1.Choose Faction: Players choose which insect race they wish to play.
2.Place Hive Card: Each player puts their Hive card in the field. A Hive has 30 Health Points. (If it drops to zero, that player is eliminated.)
3.Determine Play Order: Select which player begins, play then continues clockwise.
4.Draw Hand: All players draw 5 cards from their chosen deck and receive 10 Food each.
5.First Turn: The Action Stage begins now. (See Rule Book Page 4)

There are still a lot more to do however our main focus is to deliver and complete the game arts of the expansion. There could be changes throughout the development, but rest assure that we will deliver the best version of the game into the tabletop/cardgame market.

The best thing that has happened to Chess!
Hello Chess lovers,

Ever since I started playing Chess in my kindergarten, there were number of occasions when somebody and I were playing Chess and my brother or a friend was just watching the game. Even though he or she eagerly wanted to play. Sometimes it was me watching the game, eagerly wanting to play. (Has this ever happened to you?) I have always wondered since then if three people can play Chess at the same time. It was this desire that led me to Triwizard Chess, Chess for three players.

This game is simply Chess for three players with none of the original rules altered and exact same pieces for each player. (Otherwise it won't be Chess, right!) We hope to redefine the world of Chess.
This game is of Chess lovers, by Chess lovers and for Chess lovers!
Things to note:
1. Triwizard Chess board size is 24 inch x 24 inch and its base is Sunboard. (And the pieces are solid plastic.)
2. Colored blocks (sectors) at the center serve as visual aids for making vertical moves. No sectors are to be occupied.

3. Move diagonally forward or backward along the Trajectory lines when required. Trajectory lines are thin lines designed as visual aids for making diagonal moves present in 5th and 6th row. You will get diagrams in the instruction sheet.
Help us bring this game to you, your family and friends, fund us today!
The game gets more intense than regular Chess. Don’t take our word for it - try it.
What Do You Get When You Back The Project?
There are a number of perks for you. You can choose to get the game, get the personalized game, credits and more. You also get lots of love &
column2: well wishes for supporting our dream. We will always remember you as our early backers.

column1: Who are we?
First and foremost we are lovers of Chess who came together to broaden the horizon and explore possibilities of this beautiful game. We are a registered entity (private limited company) in India.
A father playing the game with his two children and bonding over the game. This is also a perfect way to play non-computer game with your loved ones especially children.
You can now challenge two of your friends to play Chess with you. Read: You can defeat two of your friends in a single game of Chess now.

Delivering game(s):

Expected month of delivery is mentioned as October, to be safe. We will most likely be able to start delivery by late August. You can expect your product to be delivered well before the end of October.

A game of Triwizard Chess is waiting for you!

We would really love your support, not only in backing our project, but also in spreading the word, sharing the project on social media or within your closed group. We hope that you are as excited about Triwizard Chess as we are.

Give this innovative Chess game to yourself or someone you care about who loves Chess.

A father playing the game with his two children and bonding over the game. This is also a perfect way to play non-computer game with your loved ones especially children.
You can now challenge two of your friends to play Chess with you. Read: You can defeat two of your friends in a single game of Chess now.

Delivering game(s):Expected month of delivery is mentioned as October, to be safe. We will most likely be able to start delivery by late August. You can expect your product to be delivered well before the end of October.A game of Triwizard Chess is waiting for you!We would really love your support, not only in backing our project, but also in spreading the word, sharing the project on social media or within your closed group. We hope that you are as excited about Triwizard Chess as we are.Give this innovative Chess game to yourself or someone you care about who loves Chess.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

SoundTrak!™ The Music Game

We've all done it. Sitting with friends and family and sharing memories of songs and music and how it defines some of life's events. We talk about the music we like and enjoy and music and songs we don't like. There's the one hit wonders, songs we danced to and still dance to, our wedding songs, times with our kids, a song that brings on a vacation memory. And then there's the music or that one song that completely rocked your world! Rock, Jazz, Rap, Country, Bluegrass, Broadway, Classical, Gospel, it's all in SoundTrak!™ The Music Game. It's Your life, Your music.
A card is picked. The challenge and the topic are out. The search is on for the music. You find it, you play it and if your song is chosen as the best song for the topic, you win!
Let's pick a card.....
So what song would you play?
It's subjective, it's all opinion, it's generational, it's timeless, it's great fun.

SoundTrak!™ The Music Game was born from a summer evening with friends, playing music loudly, laughing and sharing. This game changes every time you play it. Just add a topic, challenge the players and the variety of music played will amaze all. Pull a card that has the '60s and you may hear a Gregorian chant form 1560 or something from Chuck Berry. That's the fun of SoundTrak!™ The Music Game.
Let's play another round...
So what's your Guilty Pleasure Song?
Thank you for supporting SoundTrak!™ The Music Game and Indiegogo.
Who We Are
We're just 3 friends that really enjoy music, playing games and getting together with family and friends.
<ul><li>

John Wagner - Has always loved music and was a DJ at his college's radio station in the late 70's. A sales representative in the manufacturing sector, he's an avid fisherman and enjoys a good tribute-band concert.

•  Russ Hedrick - A project manager in real life, he's also a collector of vinyl to play on his turntable and blast through his large speakers. Russ is an avid bicycle rider and has been known to enjoy a bourbon or two.
<ul><li>

Steve Jegier - A banker, outstanding cook and a big music fan. According to Steve, there's nothing better than grilling, tailgating before a college football game and cranking up a great playlist to compliment the food.
What We Need
What we need is capital to bring SoundTrak!™ The Music Game to the market and the world.
• We are asking for $25,000 which will be used for our initial production run, distribution and marketing.
<ul>
• We need you to help create a buzz in the marketplace. Tell your friends, family, be an influencer and do some shameless promotion!

• If we don't reach our goal, we will fulfill our obligation to those who have invested and send a first edition copy of the game and the additional perks as detailed here on Indiegogo. We have an obligation and intend to keep it.
Impact
Music and games bring family and old and new friends together and SoundTrak!™  The Music Game is a great way to do that. Besides, it's a lot of fun. Talk about positive impact!
In addition to bringing people together, sharing music and having fun, SoundTrak!™ The Music Game is pledged to giving back, supporting US based businesses and protecting the environment...

Give Back - We support Cancer Research Institute and Brain Up, and $1.00 for every game purchased will be donated to these two great organizations. See our website for more details  www.soundtrakthemusicgame.com.

Take it Back - If the game gets tattered, torn, old and it's time to upgrade, send it back to SoundTrak! and we'll give you  10% off a new game and include the most recent expansion pack and ship it for free. The returned copy will then either be recycled or donated to a charity.  But it definitely won't go to a landfill!
• SoundTrak!™ is proudly printed in the US and we are dedicated to working with small, independent businesses.
• We are committed to recycling and reusing - recycled cardboard for game box, recycled paper for the cards, biodegradable inks.
Risks &
Will we raise enough money to bring the game to market?
The initial challenges are 3 fold: production,distribution and marketing.  Hitting $20,000 investment support will deliver initial games to the market.
Aggressive grass roots and social media marketing along with word of mouth as SoundTrak!™ The Music Game is played will generate new interest and purchases.
Other Ways You Can Help
Buy the game.  Play the game.  Talk it up with friends, family and associates.  And post it on your social media pages.
""Played with the family and we laughed, remembered, argued and shared music and stories. It was a great evening together."" Maachah, Chicago

The Quest

Hi! This is Planet Quest: a 3D printed strategy board game where players race to explore the galaxy. Players discover planets, complete quests, and battle each other to be the first to explore the ends of the galaxy.

We are Katie, Connor, Natasha, and Jethro: 4 students currently in the USC Games program. We're deeply passionate about making games of all shapes and sizes. But more than that, we love to make games that can touch people and bring a little bit of joy into their lives.
So we made Planet Quest to create an approachable, yet deep gameplay experience for those new to the strategy game genre.

column3: >If you want to find out more about us, check us out at:
column5: >https://planetquestgame.wixsite.com/website

column1: What Comes In The ""Box""?
This is what you'll get:
<ul>
<li>
4 Player Ships The player pieces that you'll use to zoom around the Aurora Galaxy.
<li>
4 Resources Trackers Featuring dials (that spin) to track your Quest Points, Gems, and Space Pennies, as well as slots to store your crew and ship upgrade cards.
<li>
3 Shop Card Decks One deck for each ring containing special ship upgrades to help you in your race to explore the galaxy.
<li>
3 Planetary Rings 3 fully assemblable rings that together make up the Aurora Galaxy. Each ring has 5 planetary slots inhabited by unique alien civilizations.
<li>
3 Planet Containers The storage containers that hold the planet pieces until they are discovered and placed on the board.
<li>
15 Planet Pieces 5 Red, Blue, Yellow, Purple, and Green planets pieces.
• 15 Planet Markers
<li>
28 Dice Dice are used to represent your crew and they help you explore.
• Our Sincere Appreciation
Simply put we need support to make more of this game.
<ul>

• The funding for the purely digital versions will go to supporting the developers, and help them prototype and produce physical copies of the game. If we exceed our goal by enough, we plan on looking into injection molding to mass-produce copies of the game, and potentially create a digital version.
• Funds for the physical versions will primarily account for production costs, while also helping the developers similarly to what is stated above.
• If the project isn't fully funded, we still plan on getting everyone what they paid for.
The Impact
The main goal since day one has been to make a strategy game that is approachable for new players while still maintaining the depth and replayability that is typical of strategy games:
• We designed the Planet and Shop Card systems to allow for players to interact with the game in creative ways at every skill level.
At the end of the day, we're a bunch of passionate developers who want to be able to give more people the ability to get the same enjoyment out of strategy games that we've had.
<h3>Risks &amp

The biggest hurdle we have right now is getting access to our 3D printers. In all honesty, we wanted to come to you with a more refined product at this time, but due to COVID-19, we lost a lot of our ability to ideate and test. This is why our gameplay video contains older versions of the game pieces, and our 3D rendered images demonstrate newer designs. We still managed to bring something together that we're super excited about, but we don't have a clear timeline of when we will get access to our 3D printing facilities again.
<ul>
• We've been working hard to refine our 2D assets, and come up with creative solutions to continue the development process without our 3D printers.
• If need be, we plan on reaching out to fellow 3D printing enthusiasts to help us test prints and get this awesome game out to you all as quickly as possible.
Other Ways You Can Help
We'd really appreciate spreading the word about our project on social media.
Twitter: @planetqgame (https://twitter.com/planetqgame)
Instagram: @planetquestgame (https://www.instagram.com/planetquestgame/)
TikTok: @planetquestgame (https://vm.tiktok.com/cjJ7fa/)
Otherwise, just be kind to each other out there.

Thanks!

","The Quest

Hi! This is Planet Quest: a 3D printed strategy board game where players race to explore the galaxy. Players discover planets, complete quests, and battle each other to be the first to explore the ends of the galaxy.

We are Katie, Connor, Natasha, and Jethro: 4 students currently in the USC Games program. We're deeply passionate about making games of all shapes and sizes. But more than that, we love to make games that can touch people and bring a little bit of joy into their lives.
So we made Planet Quest to create an approachable, yet deep gameplay experience for those new to the strategy game genre.
If you want to find out more about us, check us out at: https://planetquestgame.wixsite.com/website
What Comes In The ""Box""?
This is what you'll get:
4 Player Ships The player pieces that you'll use to zoom around the Aurora Galaxy.
4 Resources Trackers Featuring dials (that spin) to track your Quest Points, Gems, and Space Pennies, as well as slots to store your crew and ship upgrade cards.
3 Shop Card Decks One deck for each ring containing special ship upgrades to help you in your race to explore the galaxy.
3 Planetary Rings 3 fully assemblable rings that together make up the Aurora Galaxy. Each ring has 5 planetary slots inhabited by unique alien civilizations.
3 Planet Containers The storage containers that hold the planet pieces until they are discovered and placed on the board.
15 Planet Pieces 5 Red, Blue, Yellow, Purple, and Green planets pieces.
15 Planet Markers
28 Dice Dice are used to represent your crew and they help you explore.
Our Sincere Appreciation
Where Does The Money Go?
Simply put we need support to make more of this game.

The funding for the purely digital versions will go to supporting the developers, and help them prototype and produce physical copies of the game. If we exceed our goal by enough, we plan on looking into injection molding to mass-produce copies of the game, and potentially create a digital version.
Funds for the physical versions will primarily account for production costs, while also helping the developers similarly to what is stated above.
If the project isn't fully funded, we still plan on getting everyone what they paid for.
The Impact
The main goal since day one has been to make a strategy game that is approachable for new players while still maintaining the depth and replayability that is typical of strategy games:
We designed the Planet and Shop Card systems to allow for players to interact with the game in creative ways at every skill level.
At the end of the day, we're a bunch of passionate developers who want to be able to give more people the ability to get the same enjoyment out of strategy games that we've had.
Risks & Challenges

The biggest hurdle we have right now is getting access to our 3D printers. In all honesty, we wanted to come to you with a more refined product at this time, but due to COVID-19, we lost a lot of our ability to ideate and test. This is why our gameplay video contains older versions of the game pieces, and our 3D rendered images demonstrate newer designs. We still managed to bring something together that we're super excited about, but we don't have a clear timeline of when we will get access to our 3D printing facilities again.
We've been working hard to refine our 2D assets, and come up with creative solutions to continue the development process without our 3D printers.
If need be, we plan on reaching out to fellow 3D printing enthusiasts to help us test prints and get this awesome game out to you all as quickly as possible.
Other Ways You Can Help
We'd really appreciate spreading the word about our project on social media.
Twitter: @planetqgame (https://twitter.com/planetqgame)
Instagram: @planetquestgame (https://www.instagram.com/planetquestgame/)
TikTok: @planetquestgame (https://vm.tiktok.com/cjJ7fa/)
Otherwise, just be kind to each other out there.

Our Story

Hello! We are Jeff Chin and Andrew Nerger the designers of Afternova. Our passion is making compact, strategic, and easy to learn tabletop games for the community. We have come to IndieGoGo to share our latest crowfunding project with you.

 

We've already raised over 1500% of our initial goal on Kickstarter, and now we're now sharing the project on Indiegogo! We've been crowdfunding board games for a number of years, releasing games like Crypt, Galactic Debate, and Road to Infamy. We pride ourselves on delivering a transparent, smooth, and gorgeous project for all our supporters.
What's in the Box?
About The Game

You may purchase Hired Paws and Blueprints for your starship...


 

... or Negotiate!

Play Hired Paws to meet the requirements and take your Fragments.

After taking an action, score points by building blueprints on your Starship. To do this, you will need to spend some of the Fragments you have collected.



 

Want to Give It a Try?
<ul>
• Check out the Rulebook
<li><a href=""https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QNABumIphVEt3e-yi8xtXk_6_XJtkptU/view"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Download the Print &amp
• Play Online for free with Tabletopia or Tabletop Simulator
<h2>Risks &amp
We are experienced campaign runners. Our previous game, Crypt, landed on 12,000+ doorsteps on-time and for some a month early! We are confident Afternova can deliver in a similar time frame.

No Hassle Shipping

If your shipment is lost in transit or damaged we will be happy to reship your game free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. If your order cannot be delivered, we will refund your order completely, including fees.

Night Parade of 100 Demons is a  board game which centers around mystical beings that will keep you wanting to play more.

HOW TO PLAY?

Short:
1. Choose your Starting Yokai!

2. Manage your Resources

3. Catch Wild Yokai to Make a Stronger Team!

4. Acquire Items and Make Formations!

5. Set Combos, Thwart your Enemies, Attack and Destroy them!

 

Long:

FULL PLAY THROUGH:

In this mystical world, there are creatures from other dimensions from hundreds of centuries ago. In ancient folklore, we called them Yokai, a class of supernatural monsters, spirits, and demons in Japanese folklore. We, human beings, studied them and tried hard to manipulate them during ancient times. We call the art of dealing with paranormal creatures Onmyo Magic.

The objective of Night Parade of 100 Demons is simple: you have to capture wild Yokai, put them under your control, form battle formations, manage your resources, and destroy other Onmyo mages. Although it may seem simple, you still have to be very strategic and calculated with your approach.

What makes Night Parade of 100 Demons so fun is that it can be played 1-on-1, free for all, or team matches. It can be played with friends, families, and colleagues at work.

 

HERE ARE SOME OF THE YOKAI OR MONSTERS! STAY TUNED! WE WILL REVEAL NEW YOKAI ONCE A WHILE!
'
Innovative Gameplay:

This game features original gameplay which uses a common deck, a common pool, and individual hands. Players have to evaluate the resources they have, the Yokai in the current common pool, as well as the battle formations of your opponents.

You have to manage the resources you have to protect yourself from your opponent’s attack. Make sure you spend some of your resources to make significant moves while leaving some for defending your Yokai and position. You use your resources to your advantage: you can choose to go full offensive or full defensive.
Position Matters!

This game requires more skill than luck. Players have to consider where to put their Yokai as well as what kind of Yokai to catch. Stronger Yokai is harder to catch and hence they require more resources, generally, as you have to defeat the Yokai before catching it.
However, you have to cleverly position your Yokai once captured, so that your opponent may not reach them effectively.
SHIPPING RATES
US$13-18 Hong Kong
US$19-24 Rest of the World
FACEBOOK PAGE
https://www.facebook.com/RedTofuStudio/
Risks and challenges

We are confident in the preparations we have taken, we would like to honestly assume that no risks or challenges lie ahead.
All the cards have been designed (except for the 5 cards which might be added from the Grand Master package, which allow our players to take part in the actual game!),
production houses, delivery services and quotations are all ready too.

<h3 style=""margin-left:40px

I Think Therefore I Question is more than just words on paper. It's more than manufactured questions generated by co-workers in a think tank. This deck is an expression my cumulative lifetime of experiences, interactions, and friendships amassed on a beautifully designed deck of cards. 60 cards, with 60 thoughtful if not eccentric questions crafted to mine entertaining, unexpected answers, interesting conversations, and a whole lot of fun. And just for the record: the questions in this deck are thoughtful and sincere. I don't move through the world presenting crass topics in the interest of shock value. Enter with an open spirit and you will learn a little something about yourself, too.

column2: >Get yourself a high quality, vinyl sticker produced by GelaSkin. column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
​
<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
""What value is inherent in a question?""
You have to understand somebody in order to connect with them.
​
""When somebody tells you about a past life regression or fortune teller experience, what runs through your mind? Are you interested in exploring the supernatural? ""
Have you ever asked yourself, “Is it just me?” when it comes to the way you think or feel about things? That is where this deck comes in.

Standard icebreakers like “If you were ice cream, what flavor would you be?” have their place in the world, but not in this deck. There is no reason why every encounter, even the short ones, shouldn't bring you a little closer to the meaning of life, or at least closer to the human you are speaking with.  A good question guides conversations towards mutual illumination. I've focused this deck on human experiences to garner dialogue about the choices we make and why,  to illuminate what shapes us, and to highlight our intersections. Think of this deck as a facilitator who makes you a student of someone else’s life.
""What value is inherent in a question?""
You have to understand somebody in order to connect with them.
BIG APPRECIATION
Thank you...

...for checking out my project. I'm thrilled to invite you to join me in realizing I Think Therefore I Question.  I feel that my life as an inquisitive spirit has been leading up to this moment - I've wanted to create something like this for a very long time.
After reviewing samples from many manufacturers, I am happy to be working with Shuffled Ink. They are proudly family owned &
column2: operated since 1999, and have produced millions of decks of custom playing cards, board games, and tarot cards for individuals and companies around the world. They have production facilities in both Orlando, Florida, and Nantong, China. They are attentive and friendly, and follow up on their promises.  I was seeking an environmentally-friendly ink product, so I asked Charles (my contact and owner of Shuffled Ink) if we could use a soy ink instead of the usual petroleum-based one. Charles went out of his way for a couple of weeks to do the sourcing to make that possible. Their products are certified safe and are high quality. I love how this deck looks and feels.

column1: Please join me in realizing a vision to create great dialogue and delve deeper into what unites us.  You are just a few questions away from a deeper understanding of what makes us all human.
THE TEAM

Creator - My name is Cooper Bates. I'm a writer, entrepreneur, and storyteller, who is deeply fascinated with people and our human condition. I co-founded the world's first designer breath mint company: www.hintmint.com, and currently tour my award wining solo show, www.blackwheniwasaboy.com.

Nery Orellana  -  A versatile graphic designer and artist with over 30 years of experience who lives and works in Los Angeles, California. Born in Guatemala’s Caribbean coast, Nery discovered his passion for art and illustration as a child when his 3rd Grade teacher neglected to teach anything but art for the whole year. Nery believes that interesting things happen when the creative impulse is cultivated with curiosity, freedom and intensity. Trained and worked with legendary designer Saul Bass for five years, Nery has worked in a range of art forms, including painting, mural making, illustration, ceramics, block printing, and photography. See www.neryorellana.com.
Joe Nankin - Music Video and Commercial Director in California whose work includes videos for M83, Baths, Purity Ring and The xx. See www.joenankin.com.

column2: Design.  Contributed to this project as lead graphic designer and editor of the Kickstarter page. See www.niazayre.com.

column1: Lina Parades - Deck Editior - Lina is an independent Philanthropic/Nonprofit Consultant and Certified Professional Coach
SHIPPING AND HANDLING

In order to give you the most competitive pricing on shipping, we will not be charging shipping and taxes through Indiegogo, but will be charging it closer to our delivery dates through BackerKit.  Shipping should be in the ballpark of $9 for U.S. orders and up to $13 for international. Extra decks are a minimal add on cost of about $3ea.  (See more in FAQ.)
<h3>RISKS &amp

The lion's share of production prep is finished, but a large amount still remains in printing and packaging. My monetary goal and timeline are based off of pre-existing quotes with some extra padding in case of changes. I feel prepared. I am not new to manufacturing as I ran a boutique high end candy company for almost 20 years, and I've seen a brush fire or two in my day. I will communicate any such issues if they arise, along the way. This process should be really straight forward. That said, we are in unexplored territory with Covid-19, which has already created both production and shipping delays, so we do ask for understanding if necessary.
All Donations Matter:
All donations matter. No kidding. I know this is fundraiser talk, but it is absolutely true. All donations matter.

We would love it if you could share on this page on your social media platforms or screenshot photos of the cards and have conversations about about them.  We are trying to change the world through interesting conversations. Get started early.
Stay in touch with our website: IQuestionCards.com
This is not shopping, you are helping a small business come to life.
We appreciate your time.
","I Think Therefore I Question
60 Questions. Countless discoveries. Infinite connections.

I Think Therefore I Question is more than just words on paper. It's more than manufactured questions generated by co-workers in a think tank. This deck is an expression my cumulative lifetime of experiences, interactions, and friendships amassed on a beautifully designed deck of cards. 60 cards, with 60 thoughtful if not eccentric questions crafted to mine entertaining, unexpected answers, interesting conversations, and a whole lot of fun. And just for the record: the questions in this deck are thoughtful and sincere. I don't move through the world presenting crass topics in the interest of shock value. Enter with an open spirit and you will learn a little something about yourself, too.

Get yourself a high quality, vinyl sticker produced by GelaSkin. They provide great protection against scratches, and will give your device some flair, not to mention reiterating your personal mantra every time you look at it. The GelaSkin ""I Think Therefore I Question"" stickers adhere to many types of surfaces.  You can also relocate them easily, simply by peeling off the sticker and applying to its new location. No hassle and without residue. (See above for final design)
